Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Eastlink is a family owned, entrepreneurial and innovative company headquartered in Halifax, Nova Scotia. We take great pride in being a leader in delivering creative competitive, customer focused telecommunications solutions, and connecting our customers to the things and people that matter most. Serving a customer base across seven provinces, our advanced solutions include Internet, Mobile, TV, Telephone, Security and Automation, Data Communications and exclusive locally produced programming on Eastlink Community TV. 
We embrace diversity, inclusion, equity and accessibility throughout all levels of the organization and encourage members of equity groups to self-identify during the application process. 
Reporting to the Manager, BI & Data Analytics, the Data Analyst is a key contributor to create data driven solutions to deliver business insights and enable better decisions to drive growth. The successful candidate will have an inquisitive mindset with strong analytical and problem solving skills. They will have a drive to learn and master new technologies and have the ability to leverage information assets to support business goals and strategies. Finally, they will also have demonstrated ability to translate analytics insights into clear recommendations to support business goals and strategies. 


Responsibilities:


Work with various teams across Eastlink to identify and integrate new data sources to address business needs
Explore various sources of information to uncover business opportunities and customer insights through statistical analysis
Present findings, conclusions and recommendations in a clear and understandable way

Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics or a relevant discipline
2+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role
Proficiency in Python (NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, and scikit learn)
Advanced SQL skills Strong background in statistics and data analytics
Experience in data storytelling
Experience with data visualization tools.
Microsoft Power BI and or Tableau is considered an asset
Experience with Alteryx is considered an asset
 Employees who work from home are occasionally required to attend in-person meetings in the workplace. To maintain the health and safety of our teams, the successful candidate must provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 upon hire, subject to Federal Human rights law. 
Why Choose Eastlink? 
Eastlink operates in a culture of continuous improvement through listening, learning and adapting, which enables us to respond quickly to the evolving needs of both employees and customers. We recognize that our truly greatest competitive edge is our people and that delivering a great customer experience begins with a great employee experience. Our philosophy of developing and training our team “on the ground” not only helps to create a strong onboarding experience but also readies employees for future growth opportunities within the organization. 
Get your career started with us and stay with us, your journey begins here!

Title: Data & Business Analyst
Description:
Title: Data & Business Analyst 


Location: Toronto, ON 


Type: Contract 

 Purpose 

 To assist in the planning of statistical collection and analysis activities in support of various educational programs and policy initiatives related to elementary and secondary school education. To design and develop systems for collecting, validating, maintaining and processing data in support of large-scale assessments. To collect, analyze, summarize and disseminate relevant data on educational topics for use by internal staff, ministry stakeholders, and educational institutions. 

 Key Responsibilities 
1. Data Management 
Plans, coordinates and provides data management support and technical advice regarding the processing and analysis of large-scale assessment data. 
Developing processes to ensure data quality (e.g., integrity, accuracy, and completeness). 
Designing guidelines and protocols to facilitate the data lifecycle processes; sharing these developments with relevant staff. 
Participates in the development, monitoring and enforcement of protocols to maintain data and information for data sharing and to ensure data integrity. 

 2. Data Analysis 
Leads and coordinates the analysis of data as well as the implementation of data quality assurance policies and procedures. 
Verifies identified solutions have been accurately applied and reflect specifications and requirements. 
Defining data needs to reflect information requirements to meet its business and policy needs. 
Coordinates and ensures data security and confidentiality for assigned projects. 
Identifies, recommends, and implements improvements to data processing systems. 

 3. Stakeholder Relations, Advice and Support 
Develops and maintains contacts with key internal and external stakeholders groups to enable consultation and collaboration on research endeavors and to provide/exchange research data and results. 
Provides support to internal working groups involved in data analysis and reporting, and participates in, and/or leads stakeholder consultation processes. 
Receives, processes, and distributes data requests from internal and external stakeholders 

 Knowledge / Skill 


Knowledge of and skills in:
 Theory, principles and concepts of data structures, database design and information retrieval, data architecture, and programming languages (e.g., SQL, R) to coordinate data management and analysis related projects/tasks/activities. 
Information management practice and processes, data warehousing and use of business intelligence (BI) tools, data retrieval and analysis systems techniques to manage and conduct in-depth analyses, to develop reports and provide guidance and statistical advice. 
Project management to plan and coordinate the design, development and implementation of systems, databases, and procedures of large-scale assessments. 
Oral and written communications to provide information and advice to senior management, and/or other internal/external stakeholders. 
Presentation skills to disseminate technical, research, and other reports. 

 Identify and evaluate sources of data for research purposes, assess and select mathematical/statistical methods, investigate and assess new technologies required to support business processes, and prepare statistical analyses. 
Develop project plans to support the development and implementation of database systems and analyses. 
Understand and develop solutions to meet business needs when working with large scale information systems and data sets 
Planning, coordinating and providing technical expertise for the development of data systems and procedures for large scale assessment projects. 
Monitoring the performance of existing processes and databases and proposing solutions to improve the quality of data collected. 
Providing technical and project leadership in the design, development and implementation of databases. 
Providing research and drafting reports/options analyses to assist with end-user goals. 
Has input to determine research and analysis approaches, method of data presentation, identify and recommend data systems for project 
requirements. 

 Apply now!!! We look forward to working with you!!! 

 #LI-KS1 

 INDHuntelGlobalToronto

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Integrity & Key Controls
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Analyst, Data Integrity & Key Controls
 





































 Job Description






































 Support the Standardized Approach to Key Controls (SAKC) control identification methodology and ensure consistent application across all Critical Risk and Finance Reports and key business processes.
 Evaluate any unmitigated risks and control weaknesses, and recommend new or enhanced controls consistent with the Enterprise Data Policy.
 Maintain and update the key control methodology principles, process and documentation.
 Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of key control groups (e.g. data input, data transfer, business rule, data quality, ITGC) and how each control type would most effectively apply in a given data flow or system scenario.
 Work with report and business process owners and delegates to determine exception scenarios, based on materiality thresholds, where critical data element instances or individuals systems might be immaterial.
 Collaborate with lines of business (LOB) functions in the bank, other Data Management Offices (DMOs), SOX Office, and Audit to facilitate data control enhancement and/or implementation where needed.
 Review CDE Memos, data lineage and control information for Finance, Risk and other critical reports, key business processes and data domains.
 Provide support by tracking status of team objectives by maintaining and updating the team’s JIRA board on SAKC and CDE Memo Review progress.







































 Job Summary




































 Reporting to the Associate Director, Data Integrity & Key Controls this role is a key contributor in ensuring the integrity, accuracy and completeness of Finance and Risk shared data assets and reporting data. The incumbent will support and perform effective key control assessments of critical reports and business process data. In addition, they will critically assess Critical Data Element (CDE) Memos, data lineage and control effectiveness within the Shared Data Management Operations (SDMO).
 
 The incumbent will develop and maintain working relationships with line of business (LOB) and audit partners across the organization including Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, Finance, Wealth Management Internal/External Audit, SOX Office, and other enterprise functions.
 




































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada
 




































 Work hours/week:




































 37.5
 




































 Employment Type:




































 Full time
 




































 Platform:




































 Strategy and Administration
 




































 Job Type:




































 Regular
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-07-18-07:00
 




































 Application Deadline:




































 2022-08-01-07:00
 







































































 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Title: Analyst, Data Assets
Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity!
 


   The Data Analyst is responsible for providing support on data collection, disclosure and data transfer activities to Ontario Health internal and external stakeholders. Working in collaboration with the business, the Data analyst will be primary point of contact with external data providers, ensuring the receipt of data in a secure manner as per agreed to schedule. The Data Analyst will work with internal and external clients to help troubleshoot issues and challenges with the data as well as support process documentation and redesign to ensure the team is efficient and effective. This position requires a good understanding of the healthcare environment and Data Assets.
 


   Here is what you will be doing:
 



     Supports the end-to-end data operations of OH-CCO data collection and disclosure for key datasets including but not limited to DAD, NACRS, OMHRS, and OHIP.
   


     Provides advice, guidance and makes recommendations to OH teams regarding new data asset collections and disclosures to optimize project outcomes. Facilitates initial set-up and provides ongoing operational support.
   


     Develops, improves and uses existing processes to ensure timely delivery of all data collections, distribution and transfers.
   


     Support operationalization of new processes and recommends system and process adjustments.
   


     Identifies gaps with data access provisioning and seeks appropriate resources to help implement solutions.
   


     Manages the access to Data Holdings as per Ontario Health privacy policies.
   


     Develops education and training tools about appropriate access and use of PHI.
   


     Support operationalization of new processes and recommend system and process adjustments.
   


     Manages various client requests/inquiries channels for collections, transfers, distribution.
   


     Execute appropriate data analysis to support strategic business needs and decision making in coordination with the Manager, develops the tools, templates and processes required to execute the research and analysis activities.
   



 Here is what you will need to be successful:
 


   Education and Experience
 



     Bachelor Degree in Public Administration, Health Administration, Business Management or equivalent education/experience
   


     2+ years of data related experience or experience in similar capacity preferred
   


     Knowledge of the relevant data quality processes, frameworks and methodologies
   


     Knowledge of data governance principles, data management, data models, processes and application
   


     Knowledge of data manipulation and data management to deliver on objectives or execute activities
   


     Experience collecting and documenting requirements for a wide range of initiatives and the ability to apply this experience to a wide range of situations
   


     Familiarity with information issues in the healthcare environment
   


     An understanding of Ontario's health care environment, experience with cancer is an asset
   



   Knowledge and Skills
 



     Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively engage and solicit support from a wide range of external and internal stakeholders in the delivery of the program activities
   


     Requires an ability to influence decisions through well-articulated recommendations to key decision makers
   


     Demonstrated superior written communication skills including the ability to prepare executive correspondence
   


     Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work within a cross functional team
   


     Strong organizational skills and time management skills
   


     Detailed, customer service, and process oriented
   


     Ability to perform routine tasks on on-going basis
   



   Employment Type: Permanent Full-Time
 


   Employment Location: Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change). All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
 


   Internal Application Deadline Date: July 20, 2022
 


   Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, Applicants must confirm that they are Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19. If Applicants are not Fully Vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the Applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Title: Operations Volume and Data Analyst - Junior Role
Description:
Operations Volume and Data Analyst – Junior Role 
Lynx Energy is a private, intermediate gas production company with a key focus on gas‐weighted assets in Alberta. 
Lynx Energy is an operator of choice, with production from our 6,000+ wells exceeding 19,000 BOE per day. 
Lynx Energy has an excellent opportunity for a Junior Operations Volume and Data Analyst. Reporting to the Senior
Operations Advisor, the successful candidate will be focused on the gathering and in‐depth analysis of production data and preparing related reports. The position will be based in our Corporate Office in Calgary, Alberta with a hybrid in‐office/work‐from‐home model.
Lynx Energy offers a value‐enriched culture with emphasizes on a healthy work‐life balance, focus on learning and development, innovation, and having fun at work. Align with a culture where people and integrity matter!
Key Responsibilities: 

Accurately manage information within the Field Data Capture System, including master data management, data quality and volumetric reporting
Analyze operations data (ie Swab data) using statistical techniques and provide timely reporting
Assist in the development of cross system reporting to support field operations and production engineers
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems, databases, and related

Power Bi Reporting

Work with management to help prioritize operations data and information needs as well as identifying and defining related process improvement opportunities
Support/backup the set‐up of master data in various operations systems i.e. (Cygnet, FMS and

Flowcal, Clairifi, OpLynx)

Support/backup the weekly/monthly flow of volume estimates to the marketing group

Essential Experience, Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities: 

Diploma, technical certificate, or degree in a related field would be an asset
Must have Advanced Excel and intermediate proficiency in the other of Microsoft Office Suite, ideally including Teams and Sharepoint
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Excellent communicator, comfortable engaging with people at all levels of the organization
Experience with Scada Systems preferred
Experience with other FDC Systems (ie Opworx, PVR, Field View) is an asset
Experience with Business Intelligence tools/capabilities
Experience working with geographically dispersed field teams

Attributes: 

Extremely high attention to detail; maximum precision and accuracy are critical to success in this role 
Highly driven to succeed and exceed expectations
Open to Mentorship from a team of smart, fun people
Resourceful, flexible, and adaptable
Enjoy working independently and in a team while disciplined in meeting deadlines

We appreciate and thank all applicants for your interest in Lynx Energy. Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. 
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Calgary, AB T2P 4H4: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application deadline: 2022-07-21

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, EDAC Inc., is looking for an experienced individual to join their team!
Number of Positions: 1
Schedule Hours: 9 AM – 5 PM
Work Environment: Hybrid, 2 days in office
Reports to: Director of Business Development
ROLE SUMMARY: 
EDAC Inc. is looking for a Data Analyst to join the business development department. is responsible for providing data analytics and market data analysis. This role serves to support EDAC Inc’s sales operations.
Data Analytics

Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligent questions.


Create and maintain the data integrity of the master database.


Development and implementation of employee portal to access complete product information.


Coordinating and analyze data scrapping reports for competitive benchmarking and distribution compliance to MSRPs.


Propose and recommend market analysis data to improve market competitiveness.


Monitoring and evaluating sales performance utilizing POS data.


Provide innovative analytical insights within the Data Products Program – POS, ERP system, CRM tool and Power Bi.


Responsible for Internal ERP system (MS NAV), sales reporting, and analytical tools/application.


Facilitate and coordinate between Engineering and Marketing (SEO) teams to ensure product content data is aligned.

Market Data Analysis

Exploring and analyzing competitive activity, customer, and market trends.


Providing actionable insights to guide the sales and marketing teams.


Respond to data and product related inquiries in real-time to support business and technical teams.

Sales Operations

Identify gaps internally, prepare alternate solutions to improve workflow efficiency, provide training for staff based on changes made.


Integrate Business Analysis skills within the organization's processes and procedures.


Ensure standard operational procedures are implemented and followed.


Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate business processes and improve on/create new features.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS: 
Education: Community College Diploma in computer engineering, or a related Data Analytics field. University degree in the same disciplines preferred but not required.
A. Experience: 3-5 years of business experience in an operational environment
B. Excellent Computer skills in Office applications and data visualization tools
C. Good verbal and written communication skills
D. Advanced knowledge of MS Power BI, Excel, DBMS and SQL
E. Experienced presentation skills
F. Excellent planning and organizational skills
G. Project Management experience
H. Technical aptitude and experience in building Power BI’s and integrating multiple datasets
Experience in analyzing data to isolate trends and other pertinent information to draw attention to Senior Management
EDAC Inc. is committed to equity in employment and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. We value new perspectives and non-traditional experience, particularly from those who identify as part of an under-represented community. EDAC Inc. will make available reasonable accommodations for people with disabilities upon request.
We thank all candidates for your interest and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $60,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Markham, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

How many years of experience do you have with data mapping?
Do you have experience with communicating to managers and/or shareholders?

Experience:

Power BI: 2 years (preferred)
Data analytics: 2 years (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-08-08

Title: Analyst, Data Operations
Description:
You might not know our name, but you know where we are. That’s because Compass Group Canada is part of a global foodservice and support services company that’s the 6th largest employer in the world, with 625,000 employees.
 You’ll find us in schools, colleges, hospitals, office buildings, senior living communities, tourist attractions, sports venues, remote camps and military installations and more. We’re in all major cities, at remote work sites and everywhere in between – doing business in Canada and 50+ other countries where you can learn and grow. Join us now and point your career forward!
 Imagine working in a place that offers great resources to help you achieve your greatest potential. At Foodbuy, our solutions strengthen supplier relationships, customize offerings, and lower purchasing and production costs. In turn, we can give our passionate employees ongoing opportunities to grow. Join us.
 Why work with Foodbuy? We are a member of Compass Group Canada, the leading foodservice and support Services Company. We extend our value-driven purchasing service model to external clients who benefit from our negotiated contracts with manufacturers that support food and beverage and facility management suppliers.



 Job Summary


 Now, if you were to come on board as an Analyst, Data Operations, we’d ask you to do the following for us:


 Make data-driven decisions to optimize and support business needs.
 Participate in training and user acceptance testing sessions.
 Partner with internal departments to resolve any data, invoicing, and reporting issues.
 Train associates on required systems and application functionality.
 Drive revenue by analyzing data, optimizing processes, and ensuring compliance.
 Assist with strategies, reporting, and implementation, as it relates to new applications.
 Collaborate with stakeholders to define scope of work and document business requirements.
 Provide operational support for the deployment of system enhancements.
 Recommend innovative solutions that support business objectives.


 Think you have what it takes to be our Analyst, Data Operations? We’re committed to hiring the best talent for the role. Here’s how we’ll know you will be successful:


 Post-secondary education in business-related studies.
 Minimum 3 years of operations experience, ideally in supply chain.
 Proficient with Microsoft Office (exceptional in Excel).
 Knowledge of VBA Macros is an asset.
 Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written).





 Compass Group Canada is committed to nurturing a diverse workforce representative of the communities within which we operate. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

 For accommodation requests during the hiring process, please contact PeopleHub@compass-canada.com for further information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hi Potential Co-Worker,

 My name is Adam. I'm the Engineering Manager at GrantMe.
 We are building the leading education planning platform for a future full of options. GrantMe is securing students' futures and when students and families feel they have options, the future looks brighter.

 Education and careers are changing and the marketplace has been crying out for an innovative partner to help navigate the change. Our education platform is a student’s expert guide that removes uncertainty and creates options.

 We are one of Canada’s fastest-growing startups and we have assembled a team of high-performers who are striving to be world-class in everything we do. We are intentional about creating a brand and culture that is consistent all the way through from company leadership to our students. So GrantMe is a place where people come to do great work and be surrounded by others who develop themselves and want to push themselves. If you want to accelerate your career by 5 years, then GrantMe is the place to do it.

 We work with a sense of urgency and we like to do great work fast. Being student-centred is the soul of everything we do, we act with integrity because we do what we say and by when, and we strive for perfection in our work through constant kaizen (continuous improvement). If you’re the type of person who enjoys getting so passionate about our customers that you dream about them, then GrantMe is for you.

 At GrantMe, we see a future full of options for students and you. Class is now in session!

 The role:

This is a full-time role as a Data Analyst in our Vancouver, BC office.
You will work side by side with stakeholders in all departments to streamline processes and build reports.
Implement processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Work with other members of engineering to build out new API integrations to support continuing increases in data volume and complexity.
You will have the opportunity to have a hands on role in architecting all things data for one of the fastest growing startups in Canada.
You will translate business needs into technical requirements and provide solutions to complex business problems.
Collaborate on building the data roadmap and own its progress.
Have the opportunity to collaborate on future data science projects in the pipeline.



 We’re looking for people who:

Have 1-3 years of experience in a Data Analyst / Data Engineer role.
Have strong knowledge of SQL and are comfortable with at least one programming language such as Python.
Experience in data modeling, ETL / reverse ETL processes, and data warehousing.
Experience with business intelligence tools like Holistics, Power BI, Looker, Tableau or similar.
Experience with API's and creating integrations between tools.
Exhibit sound judgement, keen eye for details and tenacity for solving difficult problems.
Exceptional communication skills and ability to translate technical details into easy to understand concepts for our stakeholders.
Excitement for working with team; collaboration, asking questions and receiving/providing direct feedback are all things you love.
Are egoless - entitled to nothing and willing to earn everything.
Passionate about helping students get into their top choice schools and graduate debt-free.
Are driven, self-motivated, and have a fantastic work ethic.
Are results-oriented: will run through a wall to get stuff done.
Are masters of efficiency, are highly organized, and love using technology to get things done quickly.



 We offer:

Brand new Macbook Air.
Competitive compensation package.
Health, Dental, and Vision benefit plan.
Career growth: skip five years of your career in one year at GrantMe.
Work out of our Vancouver office in Mount Pleasant with an energetic team of professionals who are top in their field.



 Bonus points if you:

Been part of a startup or are an entrepreneur.
Have applied for university, applied for (or even won) scholarships, and have an understanding of some of the challenges involved in the process.



 Sound like fun? Then go ahead and submit your application. We’d love to hear from you!
 Join us as we continue to grow. Class dismissed!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
BIMM is booming, so we’re looking for a Data Analyst to join our team!
 WHO WE ARE
 For over 30 years, we’ve crafted flawless data driven creative solutions for some of the biggest brands in Canada and across the globe. Everything we do is guided by a simple philosophy: marketing with greater certainty. We love creating amazing integrated brand experiences for our clients that deliver real business results.  We all act as one unit and believe in “having every BIMMER’s back”. Nice people only. Egos need not apply.  WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
 We’re looking for an energetic person with superior analytical abilities, great attention to detail and strong communication skills to join our growing team as a Data Analyst.
 This role reports to the Director of Analytics and involves frequent interaction with all levels of management, clients, and outside suppliers. The ideal candidate will display the perfect balance of analytic capabilities, confidence, and business acumen.
 RESPONSABILITIES

 Be the subject matter expert for all things digital on a clients’ business
 Be the point of contact internally for all inquiries relating to a clients’ properties
 Make recommendations and help implement process improvements with the ultimate goals of driving client results
 Provide technical expertise on the development, analysis and interpretation of marketing data and reports
 Develop new data visualizations that help lay people understand the insights in the data
 Develop new tagging strategies to meet client needs
 Be the first person that notices when something is unusual with the clients’ digital properties
 Analyze ‘offline’ data in isolation or in conjunction with data obtained from digital sources

 QUALIFICATIONS

 Exceptional analytical, critical thinking and organizational skills, including the ability to quantify and analyze customer data
 Outstanding oral and written communication skills; particularly in the area of presenting complex technical concepts to colleagues and clients
 Able to manage your workload across a number of tasks and projects to help the team execute campaigns flawlessly in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
 Ability to manage a large number of concurrent tasks and projects
 A team player with strong interpersonal skills, a bias for action and strong customer service orientation
 Flexible and able to work in an environment where “change” is prevalent
 Self-starter, with the ability to manage and drive projects with limited supervision

 REQUIREMENTS
 Must Have

 University degree in business, finance, economics, statistics/math or computer science 
1 - 2 years working experience as a Data Analyst, or similar
 Deep experience with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics (both is preferred) 
Must have experience in building tagging solutions with Google Tag Manager
 Strong, fundamental understanding of web analytics principles
 Experience in data visualization platforms like Google Data Studio and Power BI 
Advanced MS Office capabilities, most importantly MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
 Experience with tracking on mobile platforms: Adobe Mobile Services or Google Firebase (both preferred)

 Nice to have

 Experience in the configuration of analytics
 Frontend (HTML, JS, CSS) development experience
 Google Optimize
 Google certifications
 Tableau
 SQL, R or general programming experience


 BIMM is committed to providing an environment that is inclusive and accessible. We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment without discrimination. Please let us know if accommodation for the recruitment/interview process is required and we will work with you to make sure your needs are met.
 
xa9CNPY8v9

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 
Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? Are you a big fan of simplification and automation? Manulife is seeking a Senior Data Analyst to join our team as we work to accelerate growth and become a digital customer leader. 

This role sits within Manulife’s Canada Segment Central Marketing Organization. The team provide a wide range of data services for a variety of business units across the segment which provides a unique opportunity to work broadly and collaborate with cross functional business stake holders. This team also collaborate closely with other data and analytics teams to develop and deliver data driven marketing solutions that are relevant, personalized and engaging for our customers. 

What do we do: 

Specialization in campaign management and reporting targeting our Manulife customers 
Drive technology enablement projects and improve capabilities through Marketing Automation 
Transform experiences through data, processes, and insights to drive business value and delight our stakeholders and customers 


Key Accountabilities: 

Campaign management & reporting and maturing capabilities 

Campaign data management end to end; data exploration, opportunity sizing, translating business requirements into technical requirements, data provisioning to build leads data, testing/QA, supporting execution, developing post campaign analysis & reporting, summarizing and visualizing the data in dashboards for senior management and product owner 
Mature campaign management and reporting capabilities - design, upgrade and implement new data workflows, automations, tools and API integrations. Integrate our technology with Salesforce, MDM, Enterprise Data Lake and more to mature our capabilities. Automate routine activities that are manual. Proactively identify and integrate new data sources, new analytics capabilities / competencies & technologies. 
Leverage marketing and analytical experience to deliver proactive and insightful program/campaign analytics and actionable insights. Complete deep dive of results identifying insights for maximizing the campaign potential. 
Suggest product or process enhancement to increase campaign conversion and channel penetration 
Analyze intermediary and customer data from multiple lines of business to prepare and effectively present recommendations on marketing strategy 
Support ongoing build/enhancement of leads database to continuously improve all analytics, reporting and campaign management. Work with the product owner to build out new data models and support implementation. 
Participate in agile ceremonies and promote agile principles and methodologies 
Support ad-hoc data requests 


Leadership/Collaboration 

Consult, collaborate, and recommend solutions to our stakeholders 
Collaborate with other data teams like Advanced Analytics, Canadian Data Office, Email & Marketing Automation Team, Core Engineering, Salesforce, Digital Analytics 
Support the expansion of our services to more stakeholders and be involved in the opportunity to evolve into cloud capabilities, evolve your own capabilities, and keep an eye on developments that can support our expansion 
Act as the team representative at stakeholder meetings bringing actional insights and providing updates on campaign deliverables 
Collaborate with analytics teams across Manulife and track key trends to enrich the team’s ability to provide enhanced insights and improvements in marketing performance 
Support marketing automation projects, collaborating with multiple data teams and Marketing Managers 
Support project planning by building workback schedules and outline key milestones dates 


Building and assuring the proper data quality and governance processes 

Build data governance, audit, security, and data quality practices in compliance with Manulife standards and policies and aligning to the Canadian Data Office 
Mitigate data, compliance, and privacy risks 
Monitor and track campaign programs and ensure that any problems arising are highlighted to management with proposed solutions - escalate and fix issues related to data 
Create, design and update documentation to help support data understanding and management 
Leverage tools to enhance code management & control practices 


Qualifications: 

Bachelor's Degree in a technical (computer science, engineering, math, etc.) and/or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise 
5+ years of relevant experience with focus on business and/or marketing analytics, including data management/programming experience. Experience in financial services an asset. 
Employing exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving skills, with the ability to see and solve issues before they snowball into problems 
Python, SQL, SSIS, Github, PowerBI, Advanced Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint experience. Hive/Spark/Jenkins an asset. 
Exposure to Microsoft Azure (or other cloud) platforms is preferred. Data Warehouse knowledge/experience 
Proficient in data wrangling, data cleansing, ETL/ELT, exploratory data analysis, data visualization 
Significant experience with data provisioning (gathering, storing, and retrieval methods) working with various data sources 
Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills while working in a face-paced environment with changing priorities 
Strong communication skills, able to present effectively to senior leaders in various sized groups 
Strong verbal & written communication skills who can clearly articulate/interpret business needs to translate into technical requirements 
Practical experience with Agile tools & methods such as Confluence, JIRA, Scrum/Kanban preferred 
Ability to foster positive relationships 
Demonstrated ability to communicate methodology, insights and recommendations with non-technical stakeholders at all levels of the organization 
Strong ability to document and monitor processes 
Experience in setting up data pipelines, processing data with complex analytics and ensuring data integrity 
Understanding of relational and dimensional database design and knowledge of logical and physical data models is preferred 
Ability to manage multiple projects and report simultaneously across different stakeholders 
The successful candidate will be innovative, inquisitive, resilient, results oriented and motivated to provide actionable insights, reporting and strategy 
Lives by our values: Obsess about customers, do the right thing, think big, own it, get it done together and share your humanity 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Title: Data Integration Analyst
Description:
ReCollect was founded in 2012 and serves hundreds of municipalities and waste companies across Canada, the United States, and the United Kingdom.
At ReCollect, we care a great deal about making the planet more sustainable, improving public services, and growing a company that both effects change and is fun to work for. Our products allow solid waste departments and companies to engage with recyclers in order to reduce contamination and increase participation in recycling programs.
Routeware is the industry leader in providing software and data analysis that enables public and private enterprises to improve the effectiveness of their waste and recycling programs. Our solutions help organizations save time and money, increase efficiency, improve safety and help make our world a greener place.

  Based in Portland, Oregon, the company employs a distributed team across North America and the UK. Our brands, products, and services provide an all-in-one platform to municipal and private waste haulers and other fleet services. As part of an essential and growing industry, we seek solution-oriented team players who want to positively impact the environment. Our work environment is collaborative, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun with a strong appreciation for innovation and initiative.
  
 Our Values:
  


Intellectual Curiosity - We nurture skills, knowledge, and creativity.
Emotional Intelligence - We are personable, positive, and caring — and we don't take ourselves too seriously.
Customer Focus - We advocate for our customers.
Team Commitment - We take ownership, play well with others, and are reliable.
Solution and Action Orientation - We approach solutions proactively, collaboratively, and thoroughly.


As a Data Integration Analyst, you'll be joining a geographically distributed team that plays a critical role in onboarding our customers, working with people and data from cities around the world to move data into and out of systems by leveraging some of the latest technologies.

We are looking for an experienced, resourceful problem solver with:

a passion for developing relationships, sharing, teaching, and learning. You will bring curiosity, a fresh set of eyes, offer alternative approaches, challenge us to think differently, and standardize our offerings as we round out our toolset. You'll coach and be coached as you develop both as an individual and a professional.
 experience in a customer-facing role - perhaps you've done support work in the past but are looking to transition into a more technical role. You communicate effectively (verbally and in writing), understand the importance of clear requirements, and deliver consistent outcomes that support the legendary service that we have become known for.
 a demonstrable knowledge of ETL tools and processes, integration platforms, SQL, scripting languages (Python preferred), and regular expressions. You're also comfortable working with data, manipulating CSV, JSON, XML, or geospatial data formats, and understanding how to work with APIs.
   
 If you have worked with FME (Safe Software) and GIS Tools, even better.

 an exceptional work ethic and strong decision-making skills, while being comfortable with ambiguity as we grow and explore new markets. You're prepared to occasionally carry the weight for others and take on tasks outside of your typical responsibilities when needed.
 an understanding of how to keep yourself organized, productive, happy, and healthy while working from your home office, co-working space, or one of our offices (if you're nearby).

You daily responsibilities include:

Designing, building and configuring tools and processes to import/maintain customer data
 Communicating with peers and customers to clarify, make commitments and share information
 Supporting our Customer Support team by investigating and addressing data-related problems
 Helping us think about and execute on how to do all of this work more efficiently, both with customers and internally through automation

We will support you with:

A clear vision of where we want to go as an organization and a team
 A collaborative and communicative environment comprised of peers with varied backgrounds
 A delightful product and set of tools
 Documentation on how existing systems work. (Wikis, code comments, and helpful teammates; )
 Career growth and opportunity to move into new roles

a passion for developing relationships, sharing, teaching, and learning. You will bring curiosity, a fresh set of eyes, offer alternative approaches, challenge us to think differently, and standardize our offerings as we round out our toolset. You'll coach and be coached as you develop both as an individual and a professional.
 experience in a customer-facing role - perhaps you've done support work in the past but are looking to transition into a more technical role. BENEFITS


Comprehensive benefits (medical with HSA option, vision, dental, and life insurance)
 Paid parental leave
 Medical and Dependent FSA
 401K match
 Paid Time Off
 Nine company holidays


 This listing is for a full-time position, based anywhere in the US or Canada with availability to work CST or EST hours.  Routeware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits all forms of discrimination or harassment. At Routeware, we are committed to the principle of equality, and all employment decisions are based on job requirements, business needs, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Execute internal consultation projects by understanding stakeholders' objectives and converting business requirements into data problems and providing suitable data solutions.


Implement advanced-level techniques and tools including statistical modeling and business intelligence tools to perform in- depth data analytics and reporting.


Design integrated ETL flows with query languages to streamline data extraction, transformation and loading process.


Supporting the design of databases and data warehouse by defining the relationship between different data sources to prepare data.


Visualize data with business intelligence tools to provide in-depth insights for management teams and support their decision making process.


Lead the team of data and business intelligence analysts by performing project management functions to ensure the quality and efficiency of delivery of data products.


Other duties may assigned.

Key Qualifications & Skills: 

Bachelor’s degree in a related field or an equivalent combination of education and work experience.


Strong technical expertise in SQL, query languages, and data integration.


Strong technical expertise in business intelligence tools, preferably Power BI.


Strong organizational skills and excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills, ability to work with minimal supervision.


Strong communication, collaboration, teamwork, and people skills.


Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits ( Extended health care, vision care etc.).


Training & Development Programs.


An opportunity to grow into a larger role.

工作内容:

通过了解公司目标,将业务需求转化为数据问题,并提供合适的数据解决方案,执行内部咨询项目。


实施高级技术和工具,包括统计建模和商业智能工具,以执行深入的数据分析和报告。


使用查询语言设计集成的ETL 流,以简化数据提取、转换和加载过程。


通过定义不同数据源之间的关系来准备数据,支持数据库和数据仓库的设计。


使用商业智能工具可视化数据,为管理团队提供深入的洞察力并支持他们的决策过程。


通过执行项目管理职能来领导数据和商业智能分析师团队,以确保数据产品交付的质量和效率。


其他分配的职责。

任职要求:

拥有相关领域的学士学位或同等学历或相关工作经验。


在 SQL、查询语言和数据集成方面拥有足够的知识背景。


优秀的商业智能工具技术专长,最好是 Power BI。


优秀的组织能力和对细节的掌握,有解决问题的能力,能够在最少的监督下工作。


良好的沟通、协作、团队合作和人际交往能力。


适应快节奏的工作环境,热爱团队工作。

公司福利:

充满市场竞争力的薪资&奖金。


享受Extended Healthcare & Vision Care & 带薪年假 & 商家折扣等诸多员工福利。


完善的培训体系,晋升机制 & Referral Bonus奖金等。


享受Easy Group旗下所有产品线独一无二的内部培训和服务优惠。

Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $50,000.00-$60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Extended health care

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Ability to commute/relocate:

Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

What is your level of proficiency in Chinese?

Experience:

Data analytics: 1 year (preferred)

Expected start date: 2022-08-08

Title: Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst
Description:
Job ID #343322
 Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst 
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst. 
Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst – Job Description 

Lending Services - Corporate Credit 
Project: This is a remediation initiative, remediating aged cash breaks, and to clean up data in lending systems 
Investigate and resolve outstanding cash breaks and associated deal/facility/obligation data issues including processing the required entries in corresponding systems to clear the cash breaks and issues 
Assist with data updates required in the Lending System (ACBS and/or LoanIQ) migration project 
Support additional reconciliation and investigation activities during the transitioning to the new system 
Recognize and ensure all exceptions to policies and procedures are brought to the attention of management for resolution when required 
Build effective relationships with key business partners by collaborating with process managers and subject matter experts to achieve desired objectives 

Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst – Mandatory Skills 

2+ years of experience working in corporate lending operations, particularly with servicing syndication facilities 
Experience with ACBS or LoanIQ or equivalent lending systems 
Demonstrated experience reading and understanding loan documentation 
Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills 
Analytical and detail-oriented 
Motivated problem solver 
Strong communications skills 
University undergraduate degree in finance or business-related studies or equivalent 

Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst - Nice to Have Skills 

Cash-reconciliation experience 

Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst - Assignment Start Date 
ASAP – 12 months to start 
Cash Break & Data Remediation Analyst - Assignment Location 
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Assist in the design and development of customized operational and management reports including Dashboards and Scorecards using various programming languages and BI Tools. Assist management with briefing and presentation materials on a regular or ad hoc basis. Provide technical support on CBIA produced BI/data products as well as assist in the extraction, transfer and load processes of data using multi-platform programs. Execute on data requests from internal and external clients, and assist other Analysts in the preparation and deliver of Branch information products and services. Conduct various business analytic functions including documenting business requirements, participating in various branch projects and initiatives including the co-ordination and tracking of project deliverables.Major Duties & Responsibilities1. Refresh and maintain ad hoc and regular reports and data extractions on claims and cost utilization, employer and worker profiling, in response to data requests from internal business areas and external clients. . This includes executing routine data requests by writing/editing programs/queries from multiple data sources, updating data sets, validating data, and assisting with data analysis.2. Build queries and/or write programs to extract and compile data using software tools and programing languages such as: Power BI, DAX, M, SAS, R, SQL, Python and Cognos, to merge, analyze, and transform data from various sources in order to conduct business and statistical analysis.3. Assist in the development and production of ad hoc and regular BI products on claims and cost utilization, employer and worker profiling, in response to requests from internal business areas. This includes consulting with business analysts to select the most appropriate data source, writing and/or documenting programs/queries from multiple data sources, and assisting in the building and enhancing reports; providing basic explanations of data findings, analysis and statistical methodologies and measurements.4. Document data and report requirements including source-to-target mapping to ensure data integrity and quality. This includes consolidating and documenting meta data for business values; gathering and documenting business rules and definitions for data attributes in WSIB Enterprise data sources. Ensure data and information are valid and reasonable before releasing to the business.5. In collaboration with analysts and the business, document business and technical requirements and participate in technical and business testing of data sources and BI and analytics products.6. Ensure data quality and integrity of BI and analytics products by matching or comparing data to appropriate data sources, validating accuracy, identifying, analyzing and assisting in the investigation root causes to data issues or problems.7. Assist in the maintenance and improvement of internal processes including the creation of process maps, user guides, as well as identify and implement solutions to increase automation and increase efficiencies.8. Develop and maintain comprehensive end user documentation and reference materials/guides for BI and analytics products.9. Assist the Business Analysts with the compiling of data, ensuring data validity and accuracy in order to understand the overall performance of the business to support decision-making.10. Participate in key Branch projects, forums and working groups varying in scope and complexity including the writing of requirements, contributing to work plans and progress reports.11. Perform other related duties as assigned or required.Job RequirementsEducation

High school completion plus additional specialized courses or certificate program up to one year in business statistics, computer science, business/data analytics, data science, business decision support, big data.

Experience

Eight months prior experience in business analytics.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusionWe respect and value the diversity of our people. We strive to create an environment where employees can be themselves and where our differences are celebrated.The WSIB is committed to being accessible and inclusive, and following barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please let us know when we contact you and we will work with you to meet your needs.Disclosing conflicts of interestAs public servants, employees at the WSIB have a responsibility to act in an ethical way at all times to create a respectful workplace and maintain public trust. Job applicants are required to disclose any circumstance that could result in a real, potential or perceived conflict of interest. A conflict of interest is any situation where your private interests may impair or be perceived to impair the decisions you make in your official capacity. This may include: political activity, directorship, other outside employment and certain personal relationships (e.g. with current WSIB employees, customers and/or stakeholders). If you have any questions about conflict of interest obligations and/or how to make a disclosure, please contact the Talent Acquisition Centre at talentacquisitioncentre@wsib.on.ca.Privacy information
We collect personal information from your resume, application, cover letter and references under the authority of the Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, 1997. The Talent Acquisition Centre and WSIB hiring parties will used this information to assess/validate your qualifications, determine if you meet the requirements of vacant positions and/or gather information relevant for recruitment purposes. If you have questions or concerns regarding the collection and use of your personal information, please contact the WSIB’s Privacy Office at privacy_office@wsib.on.ca. The Privacy Office cannot provide information about the status of your application.As a precondition of employment, the WSIB requires that prospective candidates undergo a criminal records name check any time before or after they are hired.To apply for this position, please submit your application by the closing date.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)
Description:
ABOUT THE COMPANYMilk Moovement is building a world-class team focused on getting the right milk to the right place at the right time.
Our herd of over 50 employees and growing is driven to provide our clients with the data they need to make critical decisions that impact their operations and ultimately your favorite dairy products.
Who is Milk Moovement you might ask? We are a young VC-backed company with humble roots and massive ambitions to disrupt the dairy supply chain. We think differently, act nimbly, and always leave things better than we found them.
We're adding to our team as we continue significant growth in 2022. Check us out on Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, and our home page (@milkmoovement) to learn more or hit “apply” below!
*THE ROLE*Milk Moovement is seeking a data-driven Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to help our executive team make informed decisions. The BI Analyst should be passionate about data and technology solutions and improving the decision making process through clear, concise and elegantly-presented data.
As the BI Analyst at Milk Moovement, you will be the subject matter expert of all things data. You will work mainly with internal stakeholders to identify areas where data can resolve business challenges. Other areas you will be responsible for include but aren’t limited to:

Experimenting with feature validation and tracking post release
Acting as the subject matter expert for accessing and analyzing diverse, unstructured data across Milk Moovement products using combinations of analytic software
Leading, defining, designing, and implementing end-to-end data-oriented solutions to solve business challenges or provide context to ambiguous
Customer research (in our data)
Dashboard set up (as needed across Product, execs, CX, AEs)
Analysis of complex data sets (ex: a trend in avg user session timer for a specific user class linked to a specific release date or linked to an inverse trend elsewhere)
Work cross-functionally with Engineering, Product, Marketing and Sales leadership to define the business requirements for data collection, analysis and infrastructure needs
Provide direction, expertise, and end-user training oriented toward self-service reporting portals

*WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR*Milk Moovement seeks to have a diverse, inclusive, team-oriented, and curiosity driven herd. Our product team lives up to our core values, and we expect you will be excited to do so as well. You will likely have had 3+ years of BI/Data/Analyst experience contributing to executive decision making at an established or high-growth technology company, but working in the dairy industry is not required! We will teach you all there is to know about the industry beginning with our dairy 101 course. It is definitely more complicated than you think and that is why we do what we do! Here’s what else we’re looking for:

Strong sense of empathy to care deeply about internal friction
An eagle eye for detail

- A bias for action - spotting problems and jumping in to solve them

Passion for working with diverse stakeholders to drive internal change
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment
3+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence/Reporting Analyst role
2+ years of knowledge and experience using database systems, SQL (ETL tools a bonus!)
3+ years of experience deploying data visualizations into BI solutions
Experience in analysis and reporting with large, complex data structures
Ability to manage data from multiple data sources
Experience working with structured and unstructured data from various sources and formats
Passion and interest in Business Intelligence, Dashboards, Reports, Data-modeling, Data Warehouses, ETL Processes and Data-Integration

*PLEASE NOTE*Job postings are what the ideal looks like, have passion for what we are doing but don’t match the post perfectly? Apply anyway!WHAT WE OFFERCompetitive salaries - we’re constantly reevaluating market trends to ensure we meet or exceed industry standards.Unlimited paid vacation and flex time - unlimited vacation can be vague and difficult to track; we strongly encourage everyone to take at least 2 weeks off per year plus public holidays. The rest is up to you.Enhanced health & dental coverage across North America.Remote work environment - work from wherever you want or from one of our hubs in Halifax, St. John’s or Minneapolis.Flexible hours - night owl or early riser? No problem.Tools - need the latest and great software to perform more efficiently? Ask and you shall receive.Monthly guest speakers - from shark trainers and graffiti artists to astronomers and sandwich aficionados. The more unique, the better.
*ABOUT OUR CULTURE*We’ll drop everything to ensure our customers feel supported.Transparency is ingrained in everything we do.Respect is paramount.We win and lose as a herd - lessons learned are equally as important as the wins.We’re all in this together - our company wide thirst for knowledge is unquenchable.Want to learn a bit more about what makes us moo-nique? Check out our About Us page for company mission, purpose, and values.Did we mention we love puns?!
*HOW TO APPLY*Send your resume via our Careers page and don’t forget to fill out our Get To Know The Candidate form; we love hearing what your favourite dairy products are! For bonus points, send the hiring manager or member of our people team a brief LinkedIn message explaining why you’re interested in the position.
We conduct remote interviews always. This role is flexible given the candidate's location and work preference and we’ll work closely with you as we understand every person has unique circumstances.
_At Milk Moovement, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace._
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst - Rainbow Six Mobile
Description:
Job Description
  The data we collect is pivotal to our success: information such as player acquisition and retention is how we understand the performance of our projects while user feedback and market research allow us to connect to our fans and know how to keep them satisfied. As a Data Analyst at Ubisoft Montreal, you will help us better understand our dedicated fans and provide the knowledge needed to guide our production teams towards a better future for our games.
 Your work will transform data into actionable suggestions or solutions for the Rainbow 6 Mobile team and ensure we can stay up to date with player trends by organizing data into easy-to-understand dashboards or visualisations.

 What you’ll do

Elicit and collect analytical needs from stakeholders.
Find solutions to use data to answer business questions.
Create reports and dashboards.
Build analysis and communicate findings to decision makers.
Design and develop ETL flows to structure data.
Propose in-game telemetry for operational and analytical needs.
Identify new sources of information to collect to enrich analysis.
Profile data to evaluate and monitor quality.
Help construct test cases for testing team.
Participate in the resolution of incidents and problems.
Collaborate with partners of different expertises (Community Manager, Marketing, Monetization, Production, Technical Operations, User Researcher, etc.).




 Qualifications
  What you bring

Bachelor’s degree in Business Intelligence, Administration, Information Technology, Mathematics or any other relevant field of expertise
Experience in a similar position or any other relevant experience
Ability to adopt structured, strategic and rigorous thinking
Autonomy and entrepreneurship
Extensive knowledge of data analysis tools (Excel, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)
Expertise in reading and writing SQL Language
Solid knowledge of data modelling (Inmon & Kimball) as well as visualization concepts (Stephen Few)
Excellent communication skills/bilingualism (French-English, spoken and written)
Knowledge of the video game industry (a bonus)

 What to send our way

Your CV highlighting your education, experience, and skills

Title: Data Analyst – Subscription Analytics
Description:
Company Description
  Torstar Corporation is a broadly-based media company. Its businesses include the Toronto Star, Canada’s largest daily newspaper, six regional daily newspapers in Ontario including The Hamilton Spectator, and more than 70 weekly community newspapers in Ontario; flyer distribution services; and digital properties including thestar.com (with local editions in Toronto, Vancouver, Calgary, Edmonton, Winnipeg, Ottawa and Halifax), wheels.ca, toronto.com, save.ca, a number of regional online sites. Torstar also holds a majority interest in VerticalScope, a North American vertically-focused digital media company.
 The Toronto Star is Canada’s largest daily newspaper and is read in print and across desktop, mobile and tablet platforms by more than 6 million readers every week. Online, thestar.com is one of the most-visited newspaper websites in Canada.
 Our Commitment To Diversity We strive to be a leader in building and cultivating an employee community framed around fairness, support and opportunity. We believe that what makes us different, makes a difference. And as a team, the diversity of our backgrounds, interests and experiences is what enriches our work, and our workplaces. We welcome all, and we strive for an inclusive culture that allows individual growth and shared success.



 Job Description
  Your key goal is to support the Digital and Marketing teams through insights and analysis, focused on the 360 view of a customer. Responsible for delivering exceptional data products that lead to subscription growth and optimal customer experiences. You possess a hybrid skillset of strong analytical depth coupled with business acumen and can leverage your skills to deliver accurate reporting, scorecards, analysis and recommendations to various business units. You will help drive a data-first culture across the organization. This position reports to the Director, Data Science.
 Responsibilities

 Build and maintain key operational KPI executive dashboards, scorecards, and reports
 Conduct various digital subscription, newsroom, and digital advertising analytics
 Leverage the data gathered to better understand how customers find content, where they consume it, how to further optimize that experience, and drive them down the subscription funnel
 Work closely with cross functional teams such as the data engineering team and business teams to ensure that data required by stakeholders is collected and reported effectively in order to help drive successful business outcomes
 Understand each stakeholders’ products, KPIs, goals and challenges to bring data informed recommendations and analysis for testing offers, segmentations and marketing experiments
 Prepare and present presentations to senior leaders in a non-technical way, have a high attention to detail in double checking data for accuracy, and produce detailed documentation




 Qualifications
 

 Basic knowledge of web analytics and analytics setup/configuration and experience with Adobe Analytics (Omniture), Google Analytics, Parse.ly, etc.
 Advanced experience in creating visualizations through tools such as Tableau, Cognos, Power BI , and/or Mode Analytics
 Technical Skills - experience with SQL, Excel, Python, R, relational databases, data warehouses
 Experience with data-management systems, working with large data-sets and creating reporting surrounding the data
 Knowledge of advanced analytics tools such as Data Robot, Rapid Miner, etc. preferred
 Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to relay technical concepts to non-technical audiences and explain analytics with context.
 Excellent attention to detail and ability to organize and prioritize
 Highly motivated independent worker

 Additional Information
  AODA Torstar is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Toronto, ON, CA 
    







     Jul 18, 2022
     









This is an opportunity for you to join the world’s largest law firm, a firm that offers opportunities to build your career while growing your skills and deepening your expertise. We are seeking a data analyst who can take data, analyze and understand it, and transform it into insightful products that will help drive strategic business decisions. You'll be serving as an integral part of the development team to support and streamline business processes and analytics utilizing tools such as (but not limited to) reporting packages, databases, and programming.


Primary Responsibilities

Interpret & analyze data to provide ongoing reports, identify patterns in complex data sets, and provide insight in order to drive business efficiencies.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics.
Develop and implement SQL queries and data integrations.
Filter, clean, and convert complex data sets to deliver business needs.
When necessary, research and recommend third party tools to solve a business need or create custom apps.
Provide training of newly designed applications to clients and Service Desk.
Provide reasonably accurate task/project time estimates to manager & stakeholders. Provide adjustments to manager & stakeholders as needed.
Report to manager and/or supervisor on status of current development projects.


 
Experience & Qualifications

Strong work experience in development and data analytics.
Strong technical expertise with data models, database design, and data mining.
Strong technical expertise in SQL, query languages, and data integration.
Strong technical expertise in business intelligence tools, preferrable Power BI.
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technology.
Ability to think critically in high pressure situations, design robust solutions that meet the immediate and future needs (including minimal maintenance), and deliver quality solutions in a calm and effective manner and short time frame.
Ability to work on multiple projects at a time and shift seamlessly between technologies.
Effectively interact with other members of the team, IT department, and business leaders.
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Experience within the Legal industry experience a plus.
Experience with IntApp Integration Builder a plus


 
BENEFITS WE OFFER

Competitive salary and benefits package 
Generous allowance of flex and vacation days
RRSP matching program
Opportunities for professional growth
Short and long term disability insurance
Subsidized fitness program
Various social events and activities throughout the year
Flexible work arrangements


 

We thank all applicants who apply, however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.



Equal Opportunity Statement
At Dentons Canada, inclusion, diversity and equity (ID&E) are not just ancillary values, they are foundational to our business. We believe that ID&E is essential to the shared success of our team and our clients. Our forward-thinking and inclusive culture supports the professional development of all our people, enhances the leading services we offer to our clients, and informs our commitment to make a positive impact in the communities where we live and work. As a testament to our commitment to ID&E, we have been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employer’s for 12 consecutive years (2011-2022), as well as one of Canada’s Top Employers for Young People (2022) for the fifth time.


Dentons Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome your application. All employment decisions, including hiring, will be made without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, colour, creed, disability, ethnic origin, family status, gender assigned at birth, gender identity, marital status, place of origin, race, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable human rights legislation.


We are committed to providing you with an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible workplace to support your success. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment process, for example as a result of a disability, please contact us at careers.canada@dentons.com.
