Title: Analyst, Business Systems
Description:
Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity
 

   The Analyst is primarily responsible for conducting research and analysis in support of OLIS (Ontario Laboratories Information System). As part of this role, the Analyst develops business and operational procedures and provides business support to internal and external clients and stakeholders.
 


   The Analyst is focused on programs/operational areas that are specific to Identity and Authorization service, have straightforward mandates/objectives, with operational scopes that are focused and/or have similar stakeholders.
 


   Key areas of responsibility include:
 



     Research and analysis
   


     Program/Operational support
   


     Documentation creation and management
   



   Here is what you will be doing:
 



     Develop processes and tools to support stakeholders’ implementation of OLIS.
   


     Performs business and client requirement analysis in support of Identity and Authorization service development, operational and deployment projects.
   


     Continuously seeks and identifies opportunities for the improvement of deployment, operational and registration processes and procedures.
   


     Solve business problems and provide guidance to clients and adoption teams
   


     Educate clients, stakeholders and users in the broader health care sector on Identity and Authorization policies, key concepts and processes.
   


     Performs data analysis in support of program and stakeholder objectives
   


     Adjudicates and processes requests from internal/external stakeholders and prepares reports as required
   


     May present findings, reports and commentary as requested
   



   Here is what you will need to be successful:
 


   Experience
 



     Completion of a bachelor degree, major in business administration, health administration, health informatics, information technology, data science or recognized equivalent
   


     3 years of related work experience is required
   


     Knowledge of process development and implementation
   


     Expertise in Identity and Access Management is a definite asset.
   


     Knowledge of Identity, Authentication & Authorization policies, standards and processes
   


     Experience in compiling subject matter information that is both comprehensive and easy to understand
   


     Verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills
   


     Well-versed in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
   



   Attributes
 



     Detail oriented
   


     Well organized with the ability to prioritize and meet tough deadlines
   


     Problem solver with analytical and decision-making skills
   


     Ability to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully
   


     Ability to work independently or in a team
   



   Employment Type: Permanent Full Time
 


   Location: Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change)
 


   Internal Application Deadline Date: July 20th ,2022
 


   Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, Applicants must confirm that they are Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19. If Applicants are not Fully Vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the Applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Title: Procurement Analyst, Functions Supplier Management Office (Fall 2022 Student)
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































 Job Title




































 Procurement Analyst, Functions Supplier Management Office (Fall 2022 Student)
 





































 Job Description









































 Please note: This posting is for a 4-month Fall 2022 Student placement with a start date of September 2022, and end date of December 2022. In order to be eligible for this 4-month Student position, you must either:

 Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of December 2022; or
 If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in December 2022), you must require the full 4-month work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

 Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.





 What is the opportunity?

 RBC is a highly complex global organization with significant supplier spend and vendor complexity. Effective sourcing and management of suppliers are critical contributors to RBC's operational efficiency. Managing these complex relationships can be risky and require effective execution of supplier risk management activities.

 The purpose of this position is support the Senior Manager on the execution of the Supplier Management processes and methodologies according to the Third Party Policy and standards. The Summer Internship role is responsible for proactive support, including anticipating issues and initiating appropriate actions to ensure the most effective use of time during the internship

 What will you do?

 Work with various procurement applications, data analysis tools and resources providing support to teams and key stakeholders
 Prioritize incoming requests and project assignments to support execution of the required risk management activities under the Functions Supplier Management (FSMO) team
 Establish relationships with teams in other platforms to share and discuss best practices outside RBC Functions
 Build and manage effective relationships with key stakeholders, Supplier Management, and other support groups including Center of governances


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 Microsoft Office Suite
 Organization skills: identifies and prioritized information
 Analytical thinking: Identifies relationships between data and information.

Title: Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies. 
Reporting to the Manager, Data Analytics & Business Insights, the analyst will be responsible for interpreting data into consumable business insights and providing recommendations to the business. They will perform advanced reporting/business analysis and upgrading/migrating reporting to new and more efficient technologies. They will be responsible for the regular running, verifying and delivery of standard reporting, as well as being the primary provider of analytical information to members of senior management. They will work with all areas of the business to provide analysis and present recommendations to assist with new initiatives, day to day business, or to solve pressing business problems. 
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone. 
What you’ll do 

Support the business with an analytical service offering. 
Perform data analysis to support ad-hoc requests. 
Resolve data issues and report inconsistencies. 
Convert data into business insights and recommendations. 
Use data visualization techniques where possible for quicker insight & improved user experience. 
Create unified datasets to support business needs by connecting and transforming data from different sources. 
Design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights. 
Create and maintain dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI. 
Support of any departmental teams with analysis and consultation for their new initiatives, day to day business and problem solving. 
Continuously improve and upgrade current reporting/process quality by developing and identifying enhancements and migrating/developing reports using the most appropriate technology available. 
Continuously improve and upgrade on the team’s internal processes, including documentation of code and operating procedures, ease of storing/retrieving/sharing knowledge, identifying and eliminating waste, etc. 

What you bring 

2+ years of experience with visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, ThoughtSpot. 
2+ years of experience in SQL, Power Query, Knime, Synapse or other similar data modeling tools. 
2+ years of experience in A/B testing or hypothesis testing with the primary focus to provide decision support, project validation and data insights into key business metrics. 
Experience with Microsoft Azure cloud platform would an asset. 
Ability to translate technical processes into business language. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Understanding how to best leverage data to improve business process. 
Ability to formulate or quickly understand business problems, find patterns and insights within structured and unstructured data. 
Ability to clearly communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences. 
Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources. 
Have a good eye for and an understanding of visual report design principles. 
Ability to execute multiple projects and drive key business results under tight deadlines. 
Self-starter attitude with willingness to learn and master new technologies. 
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .

Title: Junior Information Analyst (08SID)
Description:
Who is eHealth Saskatchewan? eHealth Saskatchewan is a Treasury Board Crown Corporation with a unique blend of healthcare, information technology, and citizen services. Our vision is “Connected healthcare, accessible to everyone, everywhere” with a mission to “Collaborate to transform healthcare through the use of information and innovative technology”. It is a complex environment, constantly evolving and quickly changing as we live our values of excellence, integrity, teamwork, courage, resilience and collaboration.
A large and complex organization, eHealth is comprised of 30+ clinical and non-clinical program (service) areas that all work together to support health care providers and teams across the province in delivering the best possible care to patients, providers, citizens, and health system users. Programs range from primary care to acute care, and includes laboratories, pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Additional programs that also support patient care and information, include Virtual Care, the MySaskHealthRecord, and the Provincial Electronic Health Record. eHealth is also responsible for the administration of various pieces of legislation to manage the registration of/changes to all vital event records (e.g. birth, marriage, death, etc.), registration of legal name changes, registration of adoptions, and for maintaining the provincial health registry for health services eligibility and distribution of health services cards.
The eHealth teams engage directly with health system partners and other stakeholders both provincially and federally to ensure all services are delivered efficiently and effectively.
The Junior Information Analyst Role eHealth Saskatchewan is seeking a Junior Information Analyst and the incumbent will report to the Manager Data Solutions. In this position you will be responsible for report generation and querying techniques, providing data extractions and reporting solutions for applications. In addition to extracting reports from a variety of systems and from the integration of those systems, you will also be responsible for liaising with a broad spectrum of stakeholders. You will work collaboratively with Data Warehouse and Data Quality Administrators to build solutions within the corporate architecture framework. Other responsibilities will include troubleshooting and resolving incidents for various existing production reporting/data solutions and assisting with planning and technology changes or upgrades in a complex integrated environment.

What are we looking for:


You have a growing knowledge of database concepts, theories, and data integration using various computer platforms.
You have strong computer programming skills and passion for report creation and data extraction.
You have experience creating a decision-enabling dashboard using a variety of visualizations (Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau, etc.).
You have an excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office package.
You possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills and thrive in a dynamic, technology driven environment.
You have proven experience and skills in effective communication, problem solving, data analysis, documentation standards.
Knowledge of the health environment and of data quality improvement techniques would be an additional asset.
Thorough understanding of change management protocols and quality control are also required.


Our ideal candidate would have gained the knowledge and skills required for this position through the completion of a post-secondary degree program or diploma program that is supplemented with experience, in computer science, health informatics, or related discipline. Equivalent experience would be considered. In addition, the successful candidate will have completed a minimum of 6-month work placement experience.

Competencies:
 Problem Solving
   

Extract, recall, synthesize, conceptualize, and apply ideas, processes, and information to create creative and innovative new solutions.
 Technical
   

You have technical knowledge of database concepts, theories, and data integration using various computer platforms.
You have strong computer programming skills and demonstrated proven experience on report creation and data extraction.
You have an excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office package
You have experience creating an analytic dashboard using a variety of visualizations (Power BI, MicroStrategy).



   Team/Independence
   

Build positive work relationships;
Work independently and participate as a team member to meet the needs of customers, partners and co-workers.



   Organizational
   

Independently prioritize and organize your own workload to meet tight deadlines and successfully complete projects in a changing environment.



   Analytical
   

Ability to identify, explore and evaluate options on data, processes and methodologies, information technology and potential systems design to make feasible recommendations.
Thorough understanding of change management protocols and quality control are also required.



   Communication
   

You possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills and thrive in a dynamic, technology driven environment.
You have proven experience and skills in effective communication, problem solving, data analysis, documentation standards.


Knowledge of the health environment and of data quality improvement techniques would be an additional asset.

   You will be:
   

Flexible, organized and quick to learn in order to independently prioritize and organize your own workload to meet tight deadlines and successfully complete projects in a changing environment;
Patient, honest, discreet and respectful/tactful while working with various types personal health information etc.;
Service-oriented, thorough, reliable, disciplined, organized, and strong attention to detail in order to complete tasks for clients and coworkers etc.;
Creative, logical, and have a strong motivation for continuous improvement and learning; and
Empathetic, diplomatic and sensitive in order to respond to issues and concerns of others who may be angry or frustrated.


If this role sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for to challenge yourself, make a difference in people’s lives, and showcase your abilities – we would love to hear from you.
Anticipated Start Date: September 12, 2022 Grade: 08SID-SGEU

Title: Database Administrator and Data Analyst
Description:
About KEV

 KEV Group is an enterprise SaaS company providing online payment and accounting software to simplify student activity fund management in schools. KEV’s easy-to-use web-based software automates the collection, disbursement, and management of student funds, thereby reducing the time it takes to receive and account for all school activity fees and increasing the time teachers can spend on education. The company is based in Toronto, with offices in the US. KEV is a portfolio company of Serent Capital, a leading middle market private equity firm focused on high growth technology businesses.

 Why Join KEV?

 Work in an industry that benefits children, parents, and schools
 Do meaningful and purpose-driven work, and make a real impact
 Join a growing organization with real opportunity for learning and growth
 Passionate and accessible leadership team that cares about people, personally and professionally
 Flexible work environment


 About the Role
 As the database administrator and data analyst you’ll be responsible for performance monitoring and tuning of our production databases, working with developers to optimizes stored procedures and general database access, perform data analysis, and create standard analytics datasets utilized by business intelligence software.
 The role requires a technically skilled individual that is capable of holding positions of great responsibility. In this role, you'll be the first respondent to database problems that arise and carry out periodic maintenance and troubleshooting.
 To ensure success as a database administrator, you should be an excellent problem-solver and communicator that is fluent in most data manipulation languages. Ultimately, a top-notch database administrator should have extensive knowledge of the databases under their administration and display sound technical skills and administrative aptitude.

 Responsibilities

 Performance Tuning using Execution Plan, SQL Server Profiler and Database Engine Tuning Advisor to optimize queries and enhance the performance of databases 
T-SQL scripting for data manipulation and building Ad-hoc reports 
Re-writing SQL legacy code to improve the performance of the application
 Database migrations to the newer versions
 Investigating issues in production and fixing root causes as and when needed
 Performing adhoc data pulls for analysis
 Creating and automating standard analytics datasets via ETLs to be utilized by PowerBI
 Assisting our customer support & Implementation teams when required

 Requirements

 7+ years experience working with Microsoft SQL Server
 In-depth technical knowledge of database and transaction management technologies 
Experienced with data manipulation languages, data definition languages, physical database design, and application performance analysis & tuning
 Experience in providing support in troubleshooting SQL Server performance-related issues.
 Expert knowledge to analyze performance issues, identify tuning opportunities, implement improvements and advise developers on SQL Server
 Experience automating routine DBA tasks using scripts or adhoc reports


 Nice-to-have experience

 Azure DevOps
 PowerShell


 We Offer

 We are a remote-first organization, with Canadian offices in Toronto and Cambridge, Ontario, and a US office in Wilmington, North Carolina.
 Competitive salary
 Comprehensive health and dental benefits
 Professional development opportunities
 Continuing Education
 Great colleagues and collaboration


 This job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required by the incumbent. Incumbent may be asked to perform other duties as required.

 KEV Group is pleased to accommodate individual needs in accordance with the Accessibility of Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA), within our recruitment process. If you require accommodation at any time throughout the recruitment process, please speak with Human Resources or the hiring manager.

 KEV Group is an equal opportunity employer who agrees not to discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, physical or mental disability, or age.

Title: International Business Analyst
Description:
Duties
Strategy, Planning, Project Management and Analysis (60%)

Member of senior management A&I management team working to clearly define the Company’s strategic objectives/initiatives and to plan, manage and carry out a course of action to achieve these objectives. Document and prepare Business Plans and decision support documents aligned with strategic objectives.
Assist the maturing, coordination and drive for the strategic planning and business planning processes, including the analysis and presentation of the same.
Update quarterly and annual internal Management reporting packages.
Data collection and analysis to support strategy and initiatives including manipulating data and data mining as well as translating complex data into user friendly reports, graphs, charts or models.
Tracking and reporting strategic initiative execution and implementation via Decide ACT against KPIs
Work with stakeholders to form KPIs/Market Indicators based on forecasted business plans and monitor and report on those KPIs/Market Indicators routinely. Reporting to Management on progress, issues and solutions that could impact operations and delivery of business plans.
Competitor Intelligence Tracking (Annual Sales, new products, major news)
Key Markets & Projects - tracking and reporting major news or planned projects within a specific market space (i.e.Owner, EPC, Contractor - Enverus subscription)
Support planning and analysis activities by leading the development of detailed evaluations of projects.
Support Market sizing (SAM, TAM, percent share, across products across all product portfolios including relevant market research/data)
Revenue by Market Updates for A&I Globally (monthly)

M&A (20%)

M&A Analyst

(own M&A funnel, inputs, support open M&A projects)

Support the valuation process for identifying potential strategic transactions, including building Excel-based valuation models that consider business-specific earnings and cash flow projections, accretion/dilution, capital considerations and other transaction metrics.
Support the preparation of oral and written presentations for Senior Management which present analysis and conclusions in a clear and concise manner
Develop and maintain financial tools to evaluate the company's internal financial and operational performance.
Provide support to the existing business and to M&A activity, working closely with multi-disciplined stakeholders to understand and communicate how the various business choices impact the Automotive & Industrial segment.
Provide analytical and project management support throughout the transaction process from due diligence to portfolio integration.
Maintain databases to monitor M&A activity/deal funnel, financing activity, current and developing legislation and other industry trends.

Corporate (20%)

CEO objectives, CEO presentations/updates
Strategy/SPBP/Board//Quarterlies presentation support
Market research & analysis

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Engineering, or another related field.
MBA designation is preferred.
Minimum 5 years directly related work experience.
Recognized as a business advisor and partner in collaborating with and supporting all departments in an organization to attain their specific business objectives.
Ability to navigate ambiguity, apply systems and processes and simplify complex situations.
Proactive approach to process and system improvements with demonstrated positive results.
Experience with strategic planning, valuations, and economics, developing profitable strategies and maturing processes.
Strong understanding of performance management and corporate finance principles.
Excellent project management skills gained through 3-5 years of managing analytical projects
Strong hands-on proficiency in Microsoft Office software suite, especially Excel.
Awareness of industry specific software.
Requires a high level of cultural sensitivity, interactive communication, negotiation, and effective collaboration. This necessitates considerable tact, discretion, and persuasion to obtain desired outcomes while maintaining ongoing professional relationships.
Experience in managing global cross-functional teams and project-management.
Ability to establish credibility with both internal (good networker) and external stakeholders.

What Shawcor Offers

We understand times have changed and so have we. Shawcor offers flexible work arrangements (where possible) to suit your needs
We recognize your efforts in personalized and meaningful ways such as: Competitive salary, Incentive pay, Medical benefits, Retirement savings plan, Paid vacation days, Education Assistance Program and confidential access to our Employee and Family Assistance Program (EFAP)
Participation in Service Milestone Awards and ongoing recognition opportunities
Access to Mental Health support resources such as our personalized Mental Health and Wellness platform offered through Headversity
Employees are provided with personalized opportunities to support interests and career development (including Global Career and travel opportunities)
Commitment to continuously promote a diverse, inclusive and accessible workplace environment
Challenging and rewarding opportunities supported by training initiatives
We value ESG at Shawcor through company events, including volunteering opportunities for employees, social gatherings, community engagement opportunities and team building exercises
At Shawcor, safety comes first! We go the extra mile to ensure our employees are safe and healthy
We’re working to create a better world. Join us!

Title: Business Performance Data Analyst
Description:
If you are committed to public service, enjoy collaborating with others, share our values and have a desire to learn and grow, join The City of Calgary . City employees deliver the services, run the programs and operate the facilities which make a difference in our community. We support work-life balance, promote physical and psychological safety, and offer competitive wages, pensions, and benefits . Together we make Calgary a great place to make a living, a great place to make a life.
            





            The City is committed to fostering a respectful, inclusive and equitable workplace which is representative of the community we serve. We welcome those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, inclusion, anti-racism and reconciliation. Applications are encouraged from members of groups that are historically disadvantaged and underrepresented. Accommodations are available during the hiring process, upon request. 
          










           As a Business Performance Data Analyst, you will undertake various financial and operational analyses used by the Workplace Solutions division in making business decisions with a focus on continuous improvement. You will also be responsible for ensuring the accuracy and integrity of the data used to formulate reports. Primary duties include:
          



             Support the maintenance and refinement of a system that manages employee location & work style, space classification & ownership, service requests and associated metric & exception reporting.
             


             Consult with clients and Workplace Solutions staff to understand data needs and develop tailored reporting solutions to understand workplace data.
             


             Conduct financial and operational analysis, as well as business process analysis, and the interpretation of space-related data.
             


             Research, consolidate, report and make recommendations for best practices.
             


             Input information and maintain a variety of databases containing business-critical information.
             


             Act as the subject matter expert for all databases within Facility Management.
             


             Provide quality control by ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data used for business decisions.
             










Qualifications
 





           A completed 1 year certificate in information technology, business, data analytics or related field and at least 5 years of experience in applicable Data Analytics, Information Technology, workplace management or related field, OR
           


           A completed 2 year diploma in information technology, business, data analytics and at least 3 years of experience in applicable Data Analytics, Information Technology, workplace management or related field.
           


           Intermediate proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Access, and PowerPoint) is considered to be an asset.
           


           Intermediate proficiency in Archibus, Smart Client, Adobe Suite, People Soft, IWMS (Integrated Workplace Management System) or similar software is considered to be an asset.
           


           You can effectively communicate with technical and general audiences, build productive working relationships with diverse groups, and have the ability to make sound business decisions.
           


           Strong analytical skills along with the ability to learn and adapt quickly to changing priorities.
           


Pre-employment Requirements 





            Successful applicants must provide proof of qualifications.
            


















                 Union: CUPE Local 38
                



                 Business Unit: Facility Management
                







                 Position Type: 1 Temporary (up to 6 months)
                



                 Location: 800 Macleod Trail S.E.
                







                 Compensation: Pay Grade 8 $33.79 - 45.19 per hour
                



                 Days of Work: This position works a 5 day
                

                 work week with 1 day off in a 3 week cycle.
                







                 Hours of work: Standard 35 hour work week
                







                 Audience: Internal/External
                



                 Apply By: July 26, 2022
                








                 Job ID #: 305967

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Background: 
Inner City Health Associates (ICHA) is group of more than 100 physicians working in over 50 shelters and drop-ins across Toronto. ICHA provides transitional primary care and specialist (i.e. psychiatry, substance use, and palliative care) to those who do not otherwise have access to care. We serve people who are unsheltered and temporarily living in shelters as well as those who are precariously housed. ICHA is very pleased to be expanding its interprofessional team to include nursing to offer enhanced client supports. Many of ICHA’s clients have complex health needs including untreated chronic and complex multi-system diseases, an elevated risk of acute health emergencies, and serious and persistent mental illness and substance use.
Role Description: 
The Business Intelligence Analyst will support ICHA’s data and reporting function. The Business Intelligence Analyst reports to the Director of Operations and will work closely with ICHA’s Research and Quality Lead and Manager, Programs and Privacy.
Roles and Responsibilities: 
The Business Intelligence Analyst will have primary accountability for the following activities:

Coordinate annual/quarterly corporate performance reporting to the Board of Directors, provincial and federal funders and other key stakeholders.
Design, populate and evolve an organizational scorecard with key milestones and performance indicators.
Work with Physician/Program leads to support the development and population of program reports with key performance indicators.
Work with the Research, Evaluation and QI lead and other internal partners to develop and implement a roadmap to improve EMR data quality and extract value from the data in the EMR.
Support the creation of EMR dashboards.
Support the development of an enterprise-wide data strategy.
Build a data governance and management model to support ICHA’s data strategy.
Support development of business cases and funding proposals for ICHA.
Develop and implement a benefits evaluation framework for ICHA’s work in the shelter system.
Support leaders working with OHTs and other external partners to support cross-organizational data and analytics initiatives.
Respond to ad hoc queries, frequent collaboration with stakeholders (internal and external).
Perform other data-related tasks as required by the Director of Operations.

Qualifications, Skills and Experience: 

An undergraduate Degree in Information Management, Information Technology, Business Administration, Health Sciences, Health Administration or Health Informatics or related field or recognized equivalent, is required. Masters degree in a relevant field is advantageous.
Minimum 3-5 years of overall working experience (or graduate degree plus 1-3); experience as an analyst in the healthcare industry is preferred.
Experience in data manipulation and reporting, as well as data governance practices.
Strong MS Excel (data manipulation, advanced formulas and pivot tables) is essential.
Experience with SQL and/or analytical tools such as SAS, Python, R would be an asset.
Familiarity with BI Solutions, including PowerBI, would be an asset.
Ability to translate analytical results into actionable insights and recommendations.
Familiarity with CIHI DAD and NACRS, OHIP and other healthcare datasets are an asset.
Proven ability to establish positive working relationships with a broad variety of clients, staff, and external organizations.
Stakeholder management skills.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, including the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
Excellent organizational skills with high level of attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and manage competing deadlines and periods of intense activity.
Highest level of ethics, personal integrity and confidentiality.
May occasionally require flexible working hours if required to meet deadlines.
Self-directed with an ability to organize, plan, and prioritize.
Ability to work in a small-to-medium sized organization as part of a committed team with fluidity in roles and responsibilities.
Open minded, non-judgmental with a commitment to upholding the rights and dignity of all people and respecting their diversity.

Inner City Health Associates encourages applications from candidates who reflect the diversity of our community.
Inner City Health Associates is committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection process and work environment. If contacted, please advise us if you require any accommodation measures to ensure you will be interviewed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality.

Salary: $85,000.00 per year

Extended health care

Title: Business Analyst CA - jvip-na
Description:
About Worldline






Worldline is the European leader in digital payments and number four worldwide, powered by over 20,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Every day, our technology provides the trusted infrastructure for millions of people and businesses around the world - and we´re just getting started. We are on an exciting journey to lead the way towards the next frontier of payments. Our ambitions are extraordinarily high, and we need the best people in the world to bring them to life – people like you. So if you are a highly skilled Business Analyst looking to make a real impact on the world, join our journey!





Your day-to-day responsibilities include

Understand customer issues and requirements and provide suitable technical solutions after an end-to-end analysis of the current application
Use knowledge and IT experience to review, analyze and implement improvements
Bridging the gap between IT and the business with data-driven recommendations
Build and maintain documentation related to business opportunities 
Works in an Agile environment with stakeholders, and continuously reviews the business needs, refines priorities, outlines milestones and deliverables, and identifies opportunities and risk.
Business Performance - KPIs: Monitor and report on performance of business, recommending corrective action where needed.


 
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Competencies and skills we can't do without

Understanding the business objectives
Analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Superior communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills
Adaptable and capable of working in fast-paced environments
Must be a strong team player 
Demonstrated effectiveness in consensus building, time management, issue escalation, planning, organizing, and project management



Grow with us, create tomorrow


At Worldline, we are dedicated to helping our people unlock their full potential - both professionally and personally. With comprehensive training and development programs, expert communities, and global mobility programs, you will always be able to develop and grow at Worldline - wherever you want to go and whatever you want to do. We also offer flexible hours and remote working, to empower you to be your best self at work and at home. 8 in 10 Worldliners consider Worldline a friendly place to work, and 9 in 10 are satisfied with the training & development they receive. 
Worldline is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, colour, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.


Learn more about life at Worldline on careers.worldline.com 
 Job Segment: Business Analyst, Business Intelligence, Project Manager, Technology

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST - We offer an excellent benefit package, staff meal program and generous rewards and recognition programs! 
The Location:  Hollyburn Country Club is located in West Vancouver at 950 Cross Creek Road. Our location is quite remote. The ideal candidate has their own transportation and lives on the North Shore, Downtown or in Burnaby. Please check our location prior to applying. 
Hollyburn Country Club is a premier private family Club that provides its Members with an exclusive hub for activity, sport, dining, entertainment, socialization and business.

Our Club is a home away from home for many of our Members.
We believe in living our value of Service Excellence through accountability, adaptability, empathy, enthusiasm, initiative and teamwork.

The Position: The ideal candidate is passionate about data, recreation programming and strategic planning as well as leading, coordinating and supporting projects. We are looking for a full-time Business Analyst to join our fun, fast-paced team!
Requirements: 

Post-secondary education in Business or Project Management, Sport and Recreation

Programming or Urban Planning or an equivalent combination of education and work experience

Proficient in a variety of digital applications up to and including: Microsoft Office (Word,

Excel, PowerPoint), recreation programming applications (Gametime, Perfect Mind) and data automation and visualization software (Power Automate, Power BI, Qlik)

Own transportation is an asset due to the Club’s remote location 
You agree to get a Police Information Check with a vulnerable sector search

Responsibilities: 

Researches, drafts and supports the development, evolution and ongoing management of recreation-related policies, standards, procedures, strategies, plans, agreements, audits and studies resolving issues and initiating continuous improvement processes as needed
Supports project team members and management in effectively using metrics, financial information, quantitative data and/or qualitative information to identify issues and opportunities, establish key performance indicators and to inform operational and project- related decision-making
Monitors and makes recommendations on adoption of recreation, sport and health industry standards, trends and best practices
Makes recommendations on preferred solutions and develops business cases and value proposition documents
Plans, supports and facilitates/implements public engagement and internal/external stakeholder processes


Synthesizes and consolidates complex information into succinct and meaningful written and verbal management reporting
Leads or contributes to the development of reports, memos and presentations to the General Manager, Senior Leadership Team and Board of Directors


Other duties assigned as required

Perks & Benefits: 

Work with an awesome team! We love to work hard but we have fun doing it!
Access to one of the best benefits packages for part-time and full-time employees
Access to our in-house staff meal program and free on-site parking
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Quarterly staff events
And much more!

Company pension
Dental care
Disability insurance
Discounted or free food
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
RRSP match
Store discount
Vision care
Wellness program

8 hour shift

West Vancouver, BC V7S 2S5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Jane is looking for an experienced Senior Data Analyst who will be responsible for delivering consistent, meaningful insights across the team. You will have strong experience with Looker and preferably experience in a fast-growing software company. You are excited about the opportunity to be responsible for analytics across multiple subject areas and looking forward to the prospect of mentoring junior analysts.
   




   Our small, collaborative team is responsible for delivering actionable insights across the entirety of Jane, so you are interested in championing a data informed culture across all areas of the business, from marketing to product and everything in between. You are passionate about transparency, accuracy, creating delightful experiences with data, and digging deep in to the "why." 
   We want every team at Jane to have the ability to make decisions inspired by data and you will have the opportunity to help make this happen from the ground up.
   




   Like with all positions at Jane, this position is a remote position, allowing you to work anywhere you want across Canada. Building a delighted team who can delight our customers is part of Jane’s DNA, so even though we’re not a strict 9 to 5 environment, we’re working hard to ensure that you also have a life outside of work. We pride ourselves on flexibility & autonomy, and when it comes to decision making, we take a decentralized approach ensuring that our teams' voices aren't just heard, but are acted upon. We're building something special at Jane, and we back that up with an employee stock option plan that ensures that everyone has a chance to share in Jane’s success.
  


 We really want the people who work at Jane to love being here, so it's important that we start off with a bit about what makes our company unique. Here are some specifics about what Jane is all about, and with these, hopefully, you have a better idea if this might be the kind of company you want to be part of.
  


 We’re a North Vancouver-born SaaS company with a distributed remote team across Canada, and our platform is modernizing the world of practice management software. We enable the likes of physiotherapists, mental health counsellors, chiropractors, and other allied health practitioners to run their practices in a digital-first way through features such as online booking, charting, scheduling, secure video, and billing along with an evolving library of features.
  


 Tens of thousands of healthcare practices globally are now running on Jane. In 2021, we processed over 73 million patient appointments, and our scheduling application alone handles more than 10 million API calls per day. Jane is now the number one choice for Allied Healthcare practitioners in Canada. We’re growing quicker in the US than we were here in Canada 3 years ago, and we’re now helping run clinics in 44 countries.
  


 We’re profitable, product-led, and growing organically to the point where 85% of our customer growth is either from customer referrals or word of mouth. Growth like this is unique, especially in the world of SaaS, and it doesn’t happen by chance. We have a brilliant team of over 250 employees who all do an amazing job of listening to our customers, building what they need, and providing industry-leading support.
  


 Last year alone we’ve grown our development team from 36 to 70, and the product team has doubled as a whole. 2022 is going to be a big year for Jane as we’re investing heavily into patient experience with our first patient-facing mobile app, enhancing our telehealth experience, building our own (J)analytics platform, working on global insurance integrations, and introducing new features like HIPAA compliant chat.
  


 Of course, it's not all about the numbers, but this puts into perspective the scale of Jane, from the thousands of practitioners whose lives are made easier each day to the millions of patients receiving treatment. If you’re the type of person excited by this growth, we’d love to speak with you.
  



What you’ll be doing…


 Own several areas of analysis including product and customer lifecycle while working directly with product managers, dev managers and senior leadership to encourage a data-informed culture
 Helping our team build out our new Looker instance, including supporting with documentation, onboarding, training and best practices
 Creating and improving existing metrics, models, dimensions and documentation through collaboration with the team and stakeholders across multiple subject areas
 Championing data-informed decision making, building trust with stakeholders across Jane, and developing policies to uphold our standards
 Testing hypotheses that drive product roadmap decisions by designing purpose-built experiments and performing statistical analysis
 Own analysis from concept to implementation, managing backlog and prioritization of incoming and existing work
 Proactively seek feedback and opportunities to improve our processes, engage stakeholders






To be successful in this role...


 Experience as a data analyst in a high-growth environment
 Familiarity with common SaaS metrics and experience defining, implementing and measuring them
 Experience with Looker development and as a Looker admin
 Desire to mentor other analysts and continue to flex and grow that muscle
 Excellent communication skills and empathy
 The ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical audiences
 Experience running a/b tests
 Proficient in excel, SQL, LookML, and possibly another programming language like Python or R
 Familiarity with ETL (extract, transform, load) concepts and tools
 An extremely detail-oriented mindset and commitment to accuracy






Bonus points


 Experience building out a new BI platform from the ground up
 Experience or an interest in administering Snowflake or Redshift databases






Benefits


 Extended healthcare from day one.
 Parental top-up.
 Participation in Jane’s employee stock option plan (JSOP).
 Investment in your career development & growth.
 $500 annual health spending account.
 Generous vacation policy along with your birthday off!
 Three annual Jane-cation days: additional days off.






   At Jane, we’re committed to fostering an environment that allows you to come to work as your truest self. We believe it’s important to actively recognize, embrace, and celebrate our differences in order to make Jane an inclusive, equitable, and diverse workplace.
   




   We want to build a team of people who make conversations rich with perspective and experience. We are committed to listening to every voice in order to learn and grow because doing this will allow us to meet the needs of the diverse community of helpers that Jane serves.
   




   We do not tolerate discrimination, prejudice, or oppressive isms of any kind. Employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, experience, and the needs of the Jane community. We encourage anyone who requires accommodation or adjustments throughout the interview process to let us know, and we will do our best to support you.

Title: Database Analyst
Data Analyst
Description:
MED Office of Research






       Competition No. -
      

S104648235





       Posting Date -
      

Jul 13, 2022





       Closing Date -
      

Jul 27, 2022







       Position Type -
      

Part Time - Grant Funded





       Salary Range -
      

$18,651 to $25,181 (pro-rated) per year





       Grade -
      

07





       Hours -
      

14










This position is a part of the Non-Academic Staff Association (NASA).
 This position has a term length of one year plus a day and offers a comprehensive benefits package which can be viewed at: Faculty & Staff Benefits.
 Location - North campus
 Working for the University of Alberta

 The University of Alberta acknowledges that we are located on Treaty 6 territory, and respects the histories, languages and cultures of First Nations, Métis, Inuit and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our vibrant community.
 The University of Alberta is teeming with change makers, community builders, and world shapers who lead with purpose each and every day. We are home to more than 40,000 students in 200+ undergraduate and 500+ graduate programs, over 13,000 faculty and staff, 260,000 alumni worldwide and have been recognized as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers for over a decade.
 Your work will have a meaningful influence on a fascinating cross section of people—from our students and stakeholders, to our renowned researchers and innovators who are quite literally curing diseases, making discoveries and generating solutions that make the world healthier, safer, stronger, and more just.
 Department summary
 The Office of Research (OoR) in the Dean’s Office of the Faculty of Medicine & Dentistry (FoMD) is under the direction of the Vice-Deans of Research. The OoR provides services and support to a wide range of stakeholders including department chairs/divisional directors, FoMD institutes, faculty members, managers, support staff, trainees, and the public. The OoR supports one of the largest research communities on campus with more than 750 faculty members, 1,900 associated clinical faculty, 600 graduate students, 100 postdoctoral fellows, and 200 undergraduate researchers. FoMD occupies space in multiple buildings on campus and in external hospitals and institutes.
 Position summary
 The Office of Research is seeking a new team member to join our fast-paced, dynamic team focused on supporting the research community in FoMD.
 Reporting to the Research Analyst and working collaboratively with the members of the FoMD Research Analytics Working Group, the Data Analyst supports analytical work that furthers FoMD’s research priorities and enables data-driven decision making.
 The Data Analyst will conduct research and analysis on identified issues and contribute to report writing and generation of visualizations and interactive dashboards. Project work will be used to inform research policies and strategic plans. The Data Analyst must have a strong understanding of data analytics, creative thinking skills, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
 Duties
 TECHNICAL ACTIVITIES:

Collects, curates, and provides preliminary analyses of FoMD research data from internal and external sources. Cleans and structures data according to end-use specifications.
Assists the Research Analyst in identifying sources of data to fulfill analysis requirements including the design of surveys to collect additional data, where needed.
Updates monthly faculty-wide grant submission records in PeopleSoft.
Supports the Research Analyst in the development of reports, visualizations and dashboards for FoMD Senior Leadership and other internal research stakeholders.
Researches and implements analytical methodologies to improve data gathering and analysis through automation.
Develops an internal database to store FoMD-specific research data for integration with existing datasets. Updates data and develops SOPs to ensure ongoing database maintenance.
Reduce inefficiencies in analytics process from extraction to end analysis.

 OTHER ACTIVITIES:

Redact grant applications of identifying information for inclusion in the FoMD Grant Repository.
Develops materials (e.g. website, infographic and video) to communicate the value of maintaining bibliometric data and utilizing unique digital identifiers (i.e. ORCID iD)
Liaises with Faculty members including but not limited to providing assistance in obtaining an ORCID iD and cleaning their online bibliometric profiles.

Qualifications

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in health research or other related field with experience in research and analysis
Knowledge of statistical research and analytic methods and a demonstrated ability to apply them and adapt to new techniques as they evolve.
Ability to independently use relevant computer application programs for data access/extraction, analysis and reporting and learn new ones as they evolve.
Proficiency in MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, in particular, the ability to present complex results in an easy to understand manner.
Ability to take initiative and work independently
Superior ability to communicate with colleagues, faculty and other support staff in a technical or non-technical style.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to work collaboratively.
Excellent organizational and project planning skills.
Knowledge and experience with bibliometric analysis and extraction tools is an asset.
Experience with business intelligence visualization tools such as Tableau is an asset.
Computer programming experience and knowledge of various programming languages (e.g., Python) is an asset.
Working knowledge of University data systems is an asset.



How to Apply

Note: Online applications are accepted until midnight Mountain Standard Time of the closing date.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those individuals selected for an interview will be contacted.
The University of Alberta is committed to an equitable, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We welcome applications from all qualified persons. We encourage women; First Nations, MÃ©tis and Inuit persons; members of visible minority groups; persons with disabilities; persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity and expression; and all those who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas and the University to apply.

Title: Business Analyst ll, Enterprise Data Governance
Description:
Staff - Non Union
 

   Job Category
  M&P - AAPS
 

   Job Profile
  AAPS Salaried - Information Systems and Technology, Level D
 

   Job Title
  Business Analyst ll, Enterprise Data Governance
 

   Department
  SADR | Leadership | Integrated Renewal Program Student
 

   Compensation Range
  7,278.33 - $11,372.33 CAD Monthly
 

   Posting End Date
  July 29, 2022
 

   Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
 


   Job End Date
  Aug 31, 2023
 

   Job Summary
 

   UBC has embarked on a multi-year journey to transform its academic and administrative support processes and system environments for the entire UBC community. In November 2020, UBC successfully went live with its new HR and Finance implementation of Workday. The Integrated Renewal Program (IRP) is now focused on the journey to renew the Student information ecosystem, anchored by the implementation of Workday Student.
 


   The Integrated Renewal Program—Student (IRP Student) vision is to transform the way UBC supports learning and research, and how UBC works, to create a cohesive, integrated, and enriched experience for students, staff, and faculty. This implementation will result in superior support for UBC students, a better user experience, a new set of tools, a new way of working, and improved reporting for informed decision-making. IRP Student will leverage the industry-leading cloud enterprise solution Workday to replace our current core Student administration systems with a new integrated, user friendly, mobile-enabled platform.
 

 For more information on the IRP Student, please visit 
  
   www.integrated-renewal.ubc.ca
  


   The Business Analyst ll, Enterprise Data Governance leads the assessment of client needs in an effort to align business initiatives with information technology solutions. The Business Analyst, Enterprise Data Governance will provide expertise in the areas of requirements definition, business process analysis and design, functional design, configuration, implementation, reporting, testing, training and documentation to deliver enterprise solutions to the UBC community, with a focus on data analysis and delivery. The majority of work will be performed in a formal project team. Projects typically have a high degree of complexity, influence, and impact as solutions are generally designed for most constituents in the UBC community.
  
 Organizational Status
 

   The Business Analyst ll, Enterprise Data Governance reports to the Senior Business Analyst, Enterprise Data Governance in the IRP Student Reporting team.
 


 Works daily with a project team typically made up of a project manager, developers, functional experts, and other project specialists
Works closely with a broad range of stakeholders, including management and staff of UBC IT, clients from administrative and academic units, and external entities including vendors, regulatory agencies, and partner institutions.



 Work Performed
 

   Specific Duties:
 

 Assignments include but not limited to work on enterprise systems such as the Student Information System (SIS), HR, Finance, UBC e-Payment, etc.
 Ensures solutions are consistent with the overall technical and business architecture of the university and complies with UBC IT and university policies, as well as governmental legislation and other external entities compliancy requirements on security, privacy, and accessibility.
 Analyze and document data domains and associated reporting requirements to inform the scope and architecture of the transactional or the data platform.
 Ability to write and validate user stories for Business Data validation.
 Provide insights to data modelers to ensure requirements are covered by the underlying data model.
 Gather report requirements, design and implement regular reports in transactional or analytical platforms
 Profile and convert data using a variety of resources, including spreadsheets, reports and SQL for large volumes
 Lead stakeholder requirements gathering and review sessions and obtain sign-offs as required.
 Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of the university s technical and business environment.
 Understands key technical environments to effectively identify integration, security, scalability, and performance requirements.
 Build and maintain good working relationships with project teams, business analyst peers, colleagues, and client stakeholders.



   Core Duties:
 

 Leads the assessment of client needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to identify business priorities and recommends options.
 Identifies, elicits, and documents business requirements, defines business rules and communicates requirements for the implementation of business solutions.
 Communicates with stakeholders of varying technical ability and subject matter expertise.
 Leads short-term planning sessions to implement integrated business process improvements and documents discussion and agreements.
 Provides consultative services for the development of policies and procedures.
 Analyzes metrics to ensure for client satisfaction.
 Provides input to feasibility studies for standard development projects and enhancements.
 Provides technical guidance and leadership to less-experienced individuals. Prepares functional, system and program specifications.
 Develops user test cases and validates test results during user acceptance testing and system acceptance testing stages. Typically performs functional testing.
 May prepare project status reports and communicate status to client.
 Maintains appropriate professional designations and up-to-date knowledge of current information technology techniques and tools.


   Performs other related duties as required.
 


 Consequence of Error/Judgement
    The IRP Student program provides enterprise technology solutions to the university community. Errors in judgment, poor analysis, or failure to act decisively could have a detrimental effect and adversely impact the university community, affecting up to tens of thousands of students, faculty and staff, and could cost hundreds of thousands of dollars in lost productivity, funding and revenue. Unreliable systems or failure to meet contractual obligations for performance and availability will damage the reputation of and UBC.
   
 Supervision Received
    Works under the general direction and receives daily direction from the Chief Data Officer and often from the Senior Manager and Senior Project Manager. Must be able to work independently as well as contribute actively and collaborate openly as a team member to IRP Student Program.
   
 Supervision Given
    In general, provides mentoring and coaching to new or less experienced business analysts, as well as provides leadership and education to other staff in the Project Management Office on demonstrated areas of expertise.
   
 Minimum Qualifications
    Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. In-depth knowledge of applications and the business requirements supporting them. Minimum of five years of related experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
   
 Preferred Qualifications
  


   Formal certification from a recognized professional organization or professional development provider is an asset.
 

   Professional development in business analysis and related disciplines.
 

   Experience as a Business Analyst in the Information Technology sector is an asset.
   Experience in at least one of the following areas of IT is required: data warehouse development, software development, ERP implementation, infrastructure, and ITIL/ITSM.
  
 Experience with prior data warehouse / BI initiatives is an asset.
   Experience with classical reporting tools (Crystal Reports, etc.) and visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI) is an asset.
   Experience in a higher education environment is an asset.
  
 Ability to effectively facilitate groups to achieve appropriate outcome.
  
 Working knowledge of project management, quality assurance, change management disciplines and best practices; and development methodologies.
  
 Demonstrated knowledge and proven experience in producing BRDs, ETL source-to-target mappings, etc.
  
 Working experience on enterprise-wide projects.
  
 Strong knowledge of data analysis.
   Knowledge of data modeling (conceptual, logical) is an asset.
   Excellent organizational, planning, and prioritization skills. Able to multi-task and deliver multiple assignments in a fast-paced and changing environment.
  
 Demonstrates the willingness, ability, and enthusiasm to learn new processes, methodologies or technologies.
   Demonstrated contributions to the continuous improvement of data analysis practices, methodology and implementation.
 


   Core Competencies:
 

   Collaboration - Actively solicits ideas and opinions from others to efficiently and effectively accomplish specific objectives targeted at defined business outcomes. Openly encourages other team members to voice their ideas and concerns. Shows respect for differences and diversity, and disagrees without personalizing issues. Utilizes strengths of team members to achieve optimal performance.
  
 Communication for Results - Conducts discussions with and writes memoranda to all levels of colleagues and peer groups in ways that support troubleshooting and problem solving. Seeks and shares relevant information, opinions, and judgments. Handles conflict empathetically. Explains the context of interrelated situations, asks probing questions, and solicits multiple sources of advice prior to taking action when appropriate.
  
 Problem Solving - Applies problem-solving methodologies and tools to diagnose and solve operational and interpersonal problems. Determines the potential causes of the problem and devises testing methodologies for validation. Shows empathy and objectivity toward individuals involved in the issue. Analyzes multiple alternatives, risks, and benefits for a range of potential solutions. Recommends resource requirements and collaborates with impacted stakeholders.
 


   Role Based Competencies:
 


   Analytical Thinking - Coordinates the information gathering and reporting process. Reviews trends and compares to expectations. Conducts research to define problems and prepares responses to anticipated questions. Prioritizes multiple issues and opportunities. Identifies relationships and linkages within several information sources. Anticipates issues that are not readily apparent on the surface. Identifies root causes and effects. Defines priorities within performance objectives. Reports and identifies areas that need guidance in order to resolve complex issues. Anticipates the possible outcome of potential solutions.
  
 Business Process Knowledge - Maps full business processes and designs operational process flow. Facilitates group input and drafts proposals for process improvements. Identifies resource implications. Implements process improvement recommendations within the context of overall business processes.
  
 Initiative - Seeks out new challenges that require risk taking. Determines the resources, team support, and technical needs necessary to enable success and procures them. Keeps responding to the challenge in spite of obstacles and setbacks.

Title: Data Visualization Architect
Description:
Data Visualization Architect
 Home based
 Competitive salary and benefits package
 An exciting opportunity to join our dynamic, global digital transformation business and to support the creation of innovative, scientific communications solutions for some of the world’s leading pharmaceutical and healthcare organisations.
 The benefits of being huumun
 As well as getting to work with a team of impressive, professional, and friendly colleagues, you’ll make a key difference to our rapidly expanding client base. You will also benefit from:

 Competitive salaries, company pension scheme and health insurance.
 25 days’ annual leave – plus an extra day off on your birthday – on top of your local public holidays.
 Freedom Fridays! (Friday off in every month without a bank holiday)
 Having all the kit you need to make hybrid/homeworking as seamless as possible.

 What’s involved?
 You will work closely with our team of multi-disciplinary experts to produce innovative and visually engaging communications solutions for our clients.
 The role is varied, covering but not limited to the types of tasks listed below.

 Conduct research into our client’s product or disease area.
 Lead discovery process in client-facing role to define communication objectives and understand available data.
 Explore and recommend visualization design, including interaction design, for digital platforms.
 As part of this solution design process, working within a team, you will present visualization and communication ideas to our clients with a compelling communication strategy of your own.
 Provide data science support within a multi-disciplinary team across digital platform development, from discovery through to delivery.
 Improve internal processes and toolsets and drive innovation in our service offering.

 All about you

 Scientific background.
 PhD, Masters or equivalent qualification in Biomedical Sciences.
 Data Visualisation enthusiast with minimum of 2 years relevant experience, with work examples to back it up, preferably in digital channels.
 Creative as well as analytical mind.
 Knowledge of programming, statistical computing and design processes.
 Proficient in the tools for the job. This could be a combination of Excel, Python, R, PowerBI, Tableau, Spotfire, Adobe CC, D3.js, depending on your previous experience.
 Happy to collaborate in multi-discipline digital product teams.

 All about us
 huumun is a digital transformation business. Our work makes high science mean more to the people it touches. We create engaging digital experiences for leading pharma and medical sector clients worldwide. Our team combines digital tech, data science and creative skills. And together we transform life science brands for healthcare professionals and the patients they serve. 
We embrace workforce diversity and believe it enriches us all. We give full and fair consideration to all applicants regardless of difference. And apply the same to the continuing development of all employees. We won’t discriminate on age, ability, gender identity or reassignment, race or ethnicity, religion or beliefs, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parental responsibility. And we do what we can to support people’s mental, physical and emotional health.
