Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The University of Manitoba is a driving force of innovation, discovery and advancement. Our momentum is propelled by our campus community – UM faculty, staff and students whose determination and curiosity shape our world for the better. Our teaching, learning and work environment is uniquely strengthened and enriched by Indigenous perspectives. With two main campuses in Winnipeg, satellite campuses throughout Manitoba, and world-wide research, UM’s impact is global.
Discover outstanding employee benefits, experience world-class facilities and join a dynamic community that values reconciliation, sustainability, diversity, and inclusion. We are one of Manitoba’s Top Employers and one of Canada’s Best Diversity Employers. At the University of Manitoba, what inspires you can change everything.
The opportunity: 
The Data Analyst designs, develops, tests, and implements computer programs written in SAS for complex research investigations looking at the determinants of health and health care of populations using administrative health, social, and education data. It is the responsibility of the incumbent to correctly interpret goals and objectives set out by project teams and then develop the appropriate computing and statistical solutions. They provide guidance on the structure and content of databases and the optimal statistical approach to investigate research objectives. In addition, they aid in writing technical documentation as well as sections of manuscripts for peer-reviewed journals.
The qualifications and experience we’re looking for: 
· Master's degree in a directly related study area (such as statistics, community health sciences, social sciences or quantitative analytic methods) is required.
· Three years of directly related work experience in large database analysis, longitudinal data analysis is required.
· Detailed knowledge of SAS is required.
· Detailed knowledge of epidemiology and statistical methodology for health research is essential.
· Working knowledge of coding systems used in health research such as ICD-9-CM, ICD-10-CA, CCI, ATC, is required.
· Familiarity with other statistical analysis packages such as R, STATA, SPSS is an asset.
· Advanced knowledge of statistical methodology such as survival analysis, multinomial logistic regression, Generalized Estimating Equations (GEE) and structural equation modelling (SEM) is preferred.
· A background working with Statistics Canada data, such as census data, as well as administrative health data, such as CIHI's Discharge Abstract Database (DAD), is beneficial.
· An acceptable equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
· Demonstrated skills involving data linkage, data manipulation (SET/MERGE, use of pointers, RETAIN), use of procedures for statistical analysis (GENMOD, GLM, LOGISTIC) are required.
· Must be proficient in in MS Windows, MS Office (specifically Excel and Word).
· Effective communication skills in English, both oral and written, are required.
· Ability to work within tight timelines is required.
· Confidentiality of the information must be maintained.
· Conscientious attention to detail is required.
· Ability and willingness to learn new techniques is essential.
· Must be able to work in a team environment as well as independently. Keyboarding skills are necessary as this is a computer programming position.
· Satisfactory work record, including satisfactory punctuality and attendance, is required.
Why the University of Manitoba?
Along with being one of Manitoba’s top employers, we are proud to provide a collaborative and enriching work environment. In addition to a strong compensation package with a competitive salary, the University provides an exceptional workplace that includes:

Comprehensive group benefits and pension plan.
Competitive vacation time.
Employee and Family Assistance Program.
A full spectrum of professional development opportunities.

Apply today through the University of Manitoba’s recruitment site, UM Careers: https://viprecprod.ad.umanitoba.ca/DEFAULT.ASPX?REQ_ID=22128
Closing Date: July 24, 2022
Applications will only be accepted if you apply on UM Careers.
The University of Manitoba is committed to the principles of equity, diversity & inclusion and to promoting opportunities in hiring, promotion and tenure (where applicable) for systemically marginalized groups who have been excluded from full participation at the University and the larger community including Indigenous Peoples, women, racialized persons, persons with disabilities and those who identify as 2SLGBTQIA+ (Two Spirit, lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans, questioning, intersex, asexual and other diverse sexual identities).
If you require accommodation supports during the recruitment process, please contact 204-474-7195. Please note this contact information is for accommodation reasons only.
Application materials, including letters of reference, will be handled in accordance with the protection of privacy provisions of The Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (Manitoba). Please note that curriculum vitae will be provided to participating members of the search process.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $57,566.60-$83,064.80 per year
Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Application deadline: 2022-07-24Expected start date: 2022-08-22

Title: Business Systems Analyst (Entry Level)
Description:
Business Systems Analyst ( he / she / they )
Be part of an exciting company that identifies high potential individuals and develops them into professional technology consultants working with the hottest technologies in some of Canada’s top companies - be part of Jarvis Consulting Group’s Technical Training Program! At Jarvis, we recognize that entering the workforce as a new grad or transitioning into a new career is a challenging task, and that's why we are committed to providing opportunities with industry-leading clients, and getting you ready to enter the workforce with confidence.
About the Opportunity

3-months of cost-free comprehensive training and projects led by industry experts:
Analytics with PostgreSQL and Pandas/NumPy
Big Data with Scala, Hadoop and Apache Spark
Cloud Computing and DevOps


The opportunity to drastically improve your skills by working with Tech Leads and Professionals while writing analytical reports, answering business questions based on real data and managing databases with PostgreSQL, Hadoop and Spark.
Guaranteed two-year placement upon successful completion of the program.
The chance to improve your soft skills to unlock new potential, confidence, and leadership.
Dedicated support to help you develop your career throughout the program and beyond including, coaching, professional networking opportunities and attaining industry-recognized certifications
A competitive compensation package with support for continuous learning

Once you successfully complete the Technical Consulting Program led by leading industry professionals, you will be guaranteed a two-year placement* with one of our prominent clients and some of Canada's top companies!*
About you

Diploma or a Bachelor's degree in business in computer science or relevant field
Proficiency with SQL language and database management
Good oral and written communication skills
Excellent organizational and customer service skills
Ability to creatively approach and solve situations
Legally permitted to work in Canada (citizen/permanent resident/work permit)

Next stepsWe wanted to make it as simple as possible to apply to our Job Ad through our simple Form and make our interview process short but effective. Our interviewing process includes an Introductory Interview whose purpose is to get some basic information about your skills, qualifications, and interest in the position and also the Technical Evaluation which is an interview to assess your technical ability for the role and the depth and breadth of your knowledge in your chosen field. For more information, please visit our Notion Page and read more about our interviewing process here.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Decision Support Analyst
Description:
Req ID: 137826 Company: Nova Scotia Health Location: Provincial Zone, Flexible within the Province Department: PPA Mgr Decision Support & Analytics Type of Employment: Casual Hourly FT long-assignment (100% FTE) x 1 position(s) Status: MGMT/NON-Union Management/Non Union Position Posting Closing Date: 25-Jul-22 
 Nova Scotia Health is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia, with some specialized services also offered to clients throughout Atlantic Canada. We’re on a mission to achieve excellence in health, healing and learning through working together, which is reflected in the hospitals, health centres and community-based programs we operate across the province. Our passionate team of professionals provides a variety of high-quality inpatient and outpatient services including academic, tertiary, and quaternary care, as well as continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions. Join a diverse team of innovators, collaborators and creative thinkers today.

 Nova Scotia Health employs professionals in all corners of our beautiful province. We believe there's a place here for everyone to call home, from vibrant cities with exuberant nightlife to quaint towns with picturesque trails. The work-life balance that comes with an Nova Scotia Health role means you'll have the time to explore, discover, and participate in that coveted Atlantic lifestyle. Visit us today and check out www.novascotia.com to see why more people from across the globe are moving here.




 About the Opportunity


 Reporting to the Manager, Analytics and through the Manager to the Director, Performance and Analytics, the Decision Support Analyst has primary responsibility to the Nova Scotia Health Authority to support the mission, vision and strategic directions by assisting in the establishment and implementation of performance measurement tools that can be used throughout the organization.
 The Decision Support Analyst position supports and enhances the use of evidence based decision making through the provision of information and analytics in tailored reports. The Analyst liaises with key stakeholders to clarify data requests, and completes data extraction, data management, synthesis, analytics, and reports with data from clinical information systems, administrative databases, as well as other internal and external sources of data and information.




 About You


 We would love to hear from you if you have the following:


 Baccalaureate degree in health related field, informatics, mathematics / statistics, or business
 An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered
 Three (3) years recent and relevant experience with demonstrated expertise in data extraction, data management, descriptive statistics and data analysis
 Proficiency with micro-computer applications (eg, Microsoft Office Suite of products including Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word) and visualization tools such as Tableau
 Comprehensive knowledge of information management principles including information dissemination and exchange, data collection methodologies and data quality
 Experience and demonstrated expertise with information systems, such as CIHI, Statistic Canada, SAP, Meditech, STAR, EDIS, etc
 Experience working with and synthesizing large, complex datasets and high volumes of information
 Knowledge of MIS standards and guidelines related to statistical data reporting requirements and workload measurement systems considered and asset
 Broad knowledge of the Health Care system and the continuum of care, current health system issues, trends, policy and legislation
 Ability to produce professional reports and presentation materials
 Possess critical thinking and problem solving skills
 Ability to develop and foster relationships with all levels of administrative and clinical management
 Ability to deal with leaders, managers and teams regarding sensitive and confidential matters
 Ability to work independently
 Competencies in other languages an asset; French preferred


 Please ensure your resume is up to date and includes all relevant education, experience, training and certifications.




 Hours



 Long assignment full-time position; 75 hours biweekly
 Beginning as soon as possible with an expected duration of approximately 12 months
 Please note dates are approximate and subject to change





 Compensation and Incentives


 $29.44 - $36.80 hourly

 Successful candidates may be eligible for our benefits package which includes health, dental, travel, long-term disability, life insurance as well as a defined benefit pension plan.



 Once You've Applied
 Thank you for your interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

 This is a Management/Non Union bargaining unit position. Preference is given to bargaining unit employees for unionized positions. Employees are encouraged to view their seniority hours and dates in their SuccessFactors online profile. Successful applicants changing unions, bargaining units or employment status, are advised to seek clarification regarding their seniority, benefits, and vacation entitlement and/or usage, prior to accepting the position.

 As per the COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination Protocol in High-Risk Settings, Nova Scotia Health requires all team members to be fully vaccinated by November 30th, 2021.

 Nova Scotia Health is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. Our priority groups are Indigenous, Black/African Nova Scotians, Persons of Colour, Immigrants/Newcomers, Persons with Disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+. Members of these groups are welcome to apply and self-identify.

Title: Saskatoon Pricing Analyst
Description:
Siemens Transportation Group Inc. is a privately owned transportation company that consist of 7 different trucking divisions - each unique yet firmly grounded in the STG family. These divisions range from International Truckload, Less Than Truckload, International Flat Deck, Ground Courier and Warehouse Distribution services. At Siemens, we believe that good people are the key to our success. We work hard to create an environment that encourages personal growth and creativity for all of our employees. 
Siemens Transportation Group Inc., has an immediate opening for a Pricing Analyst at their Head Office in Saskatoon, SK. The Pricing Analyst is responsible for performing in-depth rate analysis to ensure the Company is competitive in the industry and profitable. The successful candidate will work closely with the Sales Department to ensure the Company is meeting service requirements while maximizing profitability and will report directly to the Pricing Supervisor.
 This position is Monday to Friday 8:00am - 4:30pm
 Responsibilities

Title: Learning Analyst (Jul 2022-Jun 2023)
Description:
Responsibilities 
 
  The Learning Analyst will measure, collect, analyze and report on data related to learners, learning environments, and curriculum design. The qualified candidate can complete quantitative and qualitative research methodologies and data analysis and is skilled at evaluation and monitoring techniques. They will review existing research related to learning and data analytics, data-supported learning design and student persistence, and use that information to recommend action planning at the Centre and institutional levels.
  

Land Acknowledgement



  Located on the traditional lands of the Blackfoot Confederacy, Lethbridge College is committed to honouring the land from a place of knowing. We honour the Siksikaitsitapi as both the traditional and current Land Keepers of this area, and we welcome all Indigenous and non-Indigenous peoples who call Blackfoot territory their home to disclose as such when submitting applications.
  


  Lethbridge College is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse environment for all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, and age.
  


Equity, Diversity and Inclusion



  At Lethbridge College, we know we all benefit when the rich diversity of our campus community is fully represented, and all students and employees are included. We are committed to identifying and overcoming systemic barriers that impede individuals from underrepresented groups. We are ready to work together to ensure Lethbridge College is a place where all individuals feel valued for their unique perspectives, skills, and contributions and are afforded equal opportunities to participate in learning, research, and innovation.
  
Job Duties 
 
  This role would oversee Evaluation Kit and the administration and analysis course surveys. They would be responsible for survey analysis, summary, and dissemination to administration and staff involved in supporting course and program design, which currently is a gap in our processes. The analysis and summary of the course evaluation data will support the college in the following ways: (1) a learning analyst would be able to link quantitative analysis with pedagogy, resulting in more targeted and evidence-based action on curriculum design and student experience; (2) evidence-based understanding of the student experience in individual courses can be shared with faculty, associate deans, and support staff so any issues can be addressed and effective course design practice can be celebrated and encouraged; (3) addressing targeted course design issues supports learner retention (5500 FLEs by 2025) and program/college reputation; (4) faculty requiring extra support to make course updates are identified by associate deans and support/resources prioritized by CTLI; (5) supporting the academic portfolio vitality assessment process, specifically in understanding the quality of curriculum and student experience in each program and across the institution. Furthermore, Evaluation Kit is being underutilized. Having a dedicated person in this role for one year will make it possible to explore automation of some analysis and reporting (e.g., automated dashboards/reports), which supports our college moving towards more operationally efficient, digital practices (operational review). A learning analyst would link quantitative analysis with pedagogy and improve the effective use of the tool.
  Required Qualifications 
 
An undergraduate degree in a related field (E.g., education, educational research, education with math or related major, or another analytical discipline—data visualization, business analysis, predictive analytics combined with post-secondary teaching and learning experience)
Ability to complete foundational statistical analysis is a must. Given the emerging nature of this type of role, we are open to various backgrounds. Knowledge and experience in this area can be from a traditional education (certificate, diploma, degree, etc.) and/or non-traditional methods (e.g., microcredentials, upskilling/reskilling training or professional development).
Similarly, a strong understanding of adult education, either through education, training, or experience is essential to success in this role.
 Preferred Qualifications 
 
Experience with prescriptive analytics—ability to advise on actions and decisions that should be taken.
Knowledge of algorithms, machine learning, computational modeling
Ability to integrate Indigenous knowledge, ways of knowing, and epistemologies into systems, and processes using a systematic approach.
Ability to design and integrate the data in meaningful visualizations/dashboards through software to empower data-supported decision. Common examples include Excel, Tableau, Python or Business Objects
Experience in data analysis using common Customer Relationship Management systems/Student Information Systems. Example: Salesforce

Title: Analyst, Strategy & Business Insights
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Analyst, Strategy & Business Insights
 





































 Job Description






































 What is the opportunity?
 The Analyst, Procurement Strategy & Transformation will be responsible for bringing the facts and data to our procurement decision-making processes. You’ll be supporting analytics and strategies across Global Procurement and solving problems using data-driven insights. As a procurement organization, we know that taking a data-driven approach results in better outcomes (we have the data to support that!) and you will be responsible for taking those facts and data into a story that leads to that better outcome.

 You’ll be part of a fun and engaged team that is made up of master story-tellers with tremendous analytic horsepower that use facts and data to solve problems (big and small) and improve outcomes. To be successful, you’ll have expert analytic capabilities and a strong attention to detail. You’ll collaborate closely with colleagues across Global Procurement, have a willingness to challenge the status quo and an ability to embrace change.

 What will you do?


 Analytics – use facts and data to solve problems: Leverage your analytical prowess to solve tough problems and support the goals and objectives of Global Procurement. This will be done by analyzing third-party spend, pricing, contracts and processes to identify opportunities and support ongoing sourcing engagements.
 Whether it be how to optimize our third-party spend or how to more effectively allocate resources across multiple competing priorities, you’ll let the data guide you to solve these often ambiguous challenges (this will be done through: RFx modeling and decision-making support: spend analysis and planning, benchmarking, industry research, bid evaluation and deal modeling, and spend forecasting).
 You will leverage a data-centric approach to build category and supplier strategies that, in partnership with key stakeholders, can be implemented across the enterprise. Certain strategies may result in transformational change needing to be driven across Global Procurement and the lines of business.
 Story-telling – compel meaningful outcomes (changes, actions and more) through powerful and effective story-telling that adapts across all mediums and audiences. Partner with stakeholders to manage the impacts and change that may come from strategies you’ve developed.
 Continuous improvement – always challenge the status quo: Support various strategic initiatives (big and small) including process re-design, strategy development, budget and priority-setting, digital culture transformation and more – it’s an exciting and fast-paced environment and you’ll be required to leverage your problem-solving, communication, project management, change management and creativity skills to be successful


 What do you need to succeed? 
Must-have

 Bachelor degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Engineering, and/or similar discipline with analytical bias
 Two years’ experience in business/financial analytics, with progressive responsibility and a demonstrated track record of delivery
 Excellent conceptual, analytical and problem solving skills
 Superb written and oral communication skills
 Expert level in Microsoft Office applications; particularly PowerPoint and Excel skills (pivots, complex logic statements, lookups, etc.)
 Fearful of mediocrity and a willingness to embrace change


 Nice-to-have 

A smattering of other technical prowess: MS Access, Power BI, Tableau, surprise us
 Related experience within a matrixed corporate environment


 What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization







































 Job Summary










































































 Address:




































 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada
 




































 City:




































 CAN-ON-TORONTO
 




































 Country:




































 Canada
 




































 Work hours/week:




































 37.5
 




































 Employment Type:




































 Full time
 




































 Platform:




































 Strategy and Administration
 




































 Job Type:




































 Regular
 




































 Pay Type:




































 Salaried
 




































 Posted Date:





































2022-07-17-07:00
 




































 Application Deadline:




































 2022-07-31-07:00
 







































































 Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment
 At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.  We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.













































































































 Join our Talent Community  Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.  Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at rbc.com/careers.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst
Description:
Transportation Data Analyst
Georef Systems Ltd. is a Waterloo-based tech company that provides school bus route planning software solutions to the K-12 industry across North America. We believe strongly that innovation is the key to efficiency and our passion for creating intuitive solutions has made our BusPlanner Suite the market leader here in Canada. We continue to listen to our clients and produce software that is what they want, what they need, and easy enough to actually use. Our commitment to customer service sets us apart as we provide personal, dedicated service to each of our valued clients.
We are looking for a confident, dynamic and engaging professional to enhance our growing team. As a Transportation Data Analyst, you will be a valuable member of a highly cross-functional team using your data management, planning, and communication skills to provide high-quality GIS transportation management solutions, consulting services and training to our new and long-term clients in a collaborative atmosphere.
:: WHAT YOU WILL DO ::

Provide consultative, client-focused technical and process support to our clients
Implement new transportation databases for clients who have recently adopted our BusPlanner transportation management software
Maintain and manage the operational environments of our cloud-hosted clients
Maintain documentation for products and internal processes
Assist with the preparation of software demonstrations including the creation of sample databases, etc.
Engage actively in continuous process and technology improvement efforts

:: WHAT YOU SHOULD EXPECT ::

A level of autonomy to exercise your technical and organizational skills to achieve team goals
The opportunity to be involved in the development of geomatics-based planning databases
A fast-paced work environment where multi-tasking and attention to detail are critical
Working with sensitive and protected information that requires an added level of care
The feeling of satisfaction that comes from making a difference in the professional lives of our clients
Working variable shifts, both in the office and potentially from home, to cover our Help Desk hours of 7am to 7pm
A starting salary ranging from $52,000 - $60,000, plus benefits and bonuses

:: THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE :: 

Geomatics, Geography/GIS, Planning, Business, or Communications degree, diploma or equivalent professional work experience
Strong analytical ability and problem-solving skills, particularly in a technical environment
Strong aptitude in the use of computer software and data management
Solid written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Experience with customer service is an asset
Bilingual (English/French or English/Spanish in particular) is a strong asset and will be given preference


An understanding of transportation management concepts, experience with transportation software, and/or a working knowledge of SQL is an asset
Valid G driver’s license

Applicants who match this description are encouraged to apply online with a resume with a cover letter, in PDF format, at www.busplanner.com. Our offer of employment will be conditional on the provision of a clear criminal records check.
For more information about us, visit www.busplanner.com.

data analytics: 2 years (required)

Title: GIS Data Analyst
Description:
We are Pomerleau. And you could be too.  At Pomerleau, we fully understand that our mission is not only to create infrastructure or erect buildings, but to build communities. As a leader in the construction industry for nearly 60 years, we always aim to make a positive impact on the lives of the people we serve across Canada.   To do this, we do everything we can to listen to their needs, to never lose sight of the realities of tomorrow and to innovate to work in a more committed, more collaborative and more sustainable way. This is how we redefine our practice together - for the good of our profession and of future generations 
  What YOU Will Do  
Under the responsibility of the APEX innovation manager, you will be in charge of the creation, maintenance and display of spatial data  to support strategic decision making.  Responsabilities :

 Create, maintain and analyze spatial data


 Monitor and administer databases


 Spatial data management


 Prepare reports, perform research and give a professional opinion


 Programming automates redundant GIS processes (Python, model builder, FME)


 Develop and maintain GIS data resources


 Assist with data collection with GPS and field collection with Esri Collector


 Digitize, create, maintain, display and update GIS databases, coverages, and linkages to various GIS databases


 Produce accurate maps and other representations of data for field work activity


 Ensure data accuracy 



What YOU Will Bring




BAC or DEC level in geomatics or other fields related to the position


 Create, maintain, and analyze spatial data


 Enterprise GIS - configuration and administration


 Geo-database design and implementation


 Requirements gathering and documentation


 Technical documentation


 FME, Python, SQL, JavaScript


Why Choose Pomerleau 

Competitive salary 


4 weeks’ vacation 


Group insurance (including a health spending account!) 


Group RRSP 


Employer paid monthly public transit pass 


Fitness Membership or Activity Reimbursement 


Employee assistance program 


Exciting training opportunities 


Dynamic culture 


Exciting career opportunities 


Summer hours (available year-round) 


Free access to Dialogue's telemedecine platform 


Refund for ergonomic work equipment 


New telecommuting policy 


What are you waiting for? Let's build something extraordinary together. Apply now to join the team. We want to hear from you!   We thank all applicants, but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. Be sure to join our Talent Network to stay informed about all job opportunities at Pomerleau.   Pomerleau Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. During any stage of the recruitment and hiring process, accommodation for applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

Title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 382351
 At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content - we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
 If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
 Our Bell Business Markets team enables the digital transformation of businesses and governments nationwide through solutions in areas including Internet and private networks, voice and unified communications, contact centre, security, Internet of Things, data centre and cloud. We’re proud to be Canada’s leading provider of broadband network and communication services for businesses and governments.

 The Business Intelligence/Business Performance Optimization team resides within Bell Business Markets and is responsible for developing, maintaining and using data to drive insights on customer experience and optimization of our back office. The team consists of data analysts for analyzing data, capacity planning management for sourcing and maintaining data, programmers for building dashboards and data scientists for building machine learning models.

 Our team partners closely with other business intelligence teams within the company and supports primarily our operational teams with impactful insights that help us continue to transform the business. In addition, the team has an active role in the change management process within Bell Business Markets, often including: automation initiatives, self serve tool development, and process engineering. We are looking for a soon-to-be or recent university graduate with an aptitude to create business impacts using data-driven approach. As part of this team you will have the opportunity to implement the latest practices in analytics, data visualization and machine learning to enable Bell Business Market team members to have faster and more insightful access to the drivers of their operations.
 
How the program works: You will have the opportunity to work on projects and improve your skills in presenting to upper management, data analytics, capacity planning management, data engineering and machine learning.
 
Key responsibilities may include: 

Identify areas for ML/AI opportunities and demonstrate to internal clients how ML/AI can

 improve their business

 Highly analytical with an understanding of the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets 
Ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations 
Demonstrated initiative, leadership and a passion for learning new skills 
Strong work ethic and persistence in the face of challenges and opportunities 
Demonstrated curiosity and ability to learn quickly, with an ability to manage multiple projects and priorities 
Work with partners within Customer Operations and across Bell to make data-driven

 business decisions

 Critical Qualifications / Competencies: 

Undergraduate or masters degree in Engineering, Business, Computer Science, Operations Research, Physics or Mathematics 
Experience with Machine Learning algorithms, including strong knowledge of the mathematical underpinnings behind various methods: regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, dimensionality reduction 
Manipulating large & complex datasets Statistical software and data-mining tools and methods; such as SAS, SPSS, MatLab/Scilab, R, CART or other statistical packages 
At least one general programming language such as Python (preferable), Java or C/C++ Experience with query development using SQL Experience with data visualization tools and time series 
Presentation skills are an asset 
Experience in reporting and data visualization tools such as Microsoft Reporting Services, Microstrategy, Tableau and Python Dash is an asset 
Experience in large data sets and machine learning techniques is an asset

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
At NRG, we’re bringing the power of energy to people and organizations by putting customers at the center of everything we do. We generate electricity and provide energy solutions and natural gas to millions of customers through our diverse portfolio of retail brands. A Fortune 500 company, operating in the United States and Canada, NRG delivers innovative solutions while advocating for competitive energy markets and customer choice, working towards a sustainable energy future. More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, LinkedIn and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy.
 Job Summary:
 The Business Analyst will work with both the Go-to-Market and Retention & Customer Management Teams focusing on the Direct Energy Regulated Services business.

 In supporting the Go-to-Market team, this role will support a wide range of commercially focused activities including contract lifecycle management, financial planning and reporting and the creation of strategic communications for internal stakeholders.

 In supporting the Retention & Customer Management Team, this role will support the development and delivery of the customer experience strategy along with planning and execution of all customer lifecycle, retention and acquisition activities. You will spearhead key initiatives and strategies for customer retention based on your analyses, launch proactive programs & campaigns, and perform post-mortem analyses to continuously learn from and improve results. The optimal candidate will be extremely organized, able to understand and organize analytics of retention campaigns as well as help develop, execute and deliver customer lifecycle campaigns from start to finish.

 Key to this role is a strategical and analytical mind, a passion for supporting our customers and can combine this with a strong commercial awareness to bring solutions to strategic issues and drive to completion.

 Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
 Go-to-Market:

 Financial modelling
 Presentation building
 Data and business analysis
 Contract review and drafting and timeline management
 Project management (able to manage multiple deliverables, familiar with Gannt style reporting and tracking)
 Other duties as assigned


 Retention:

 Develop and execute a lifecycle marketing strategy to build loyalty, increase lifetime value and reduce churn
 Help develop and support acquisition strategies by customer segment
 Strategic focus on churn reducing activities through the call center, process improvement and customer touchpoints
 Work across marketing, sales/digital, operations, campaign management, and analytics peers to define test plans and key objectives, help develop marketing strategy and ensure timely and accurate execution of all campaigns
 Ability to assess and analyze the results of a campaign in order to drive continued improvement
 Utilize customer feedback initiatives to drive and support improvements
 Generate performance reports and conduct campaign audits
 Analyze data to develop actionable insights that can be measured and reported
 Other duties as assigned


 Working Conditions:

 Hybrid: Open office environment + working from home
 Some overtime required as special projects arise
 Some travel <10%


 Minimum Requirements:

 A post-secondary degree in Commerce, Marketing, Communications or a related field coupled with 2-5 years of relevant industry experience.


 Proven experience developing strategies, initiating campaigns/projects and executing to completion
 Excellent analytical, problem-solving and trouble -shooting skills
 Experience with customer journey development
 Demonstrates superior organization and timely execution of initiatives
 Excellent communication skills, ability to lead projects and initiatives and collaborate with multiple teams
 Flexible and able to comfortably operate in an ever-evolving & changing environment
 Experience in a customer related area within the energy industry is preferred
 SAP experience a strong asset


 Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Strategic focus, able to see the big picture when planning
 Comfort dealing with cross-functional teams
 Strong organizational abilities and attention to detail
 Strong written & verbal communication skills, including influencing, advocacy and facilitation
 Demonstrated problem solving & analytical skills
 Expert in MS PowerPoint, Word and Excel
 Autonomous, self-starter
 Positive attitude and desire to create change


 Physical Requirements:

 Occasionally requires lifting as appropriate to perform duties and responsibilities/Position requires employee to work using a laptop/computer screen

 NRG Energy is committed to providing broad access to employment opportunities so that diverse job seekers can apply to positions, and to ensuring our workforce represents the diverse communities we serve. We abide by human rights legislation and accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with applicable law.
 Any information you provide through this form will be used and disclosed for the purposes of considering your application and, if you are offered a job, in relation to your employment (including post employment activities). If you have provided references, you consent to us contacting such references and obtaining your personal information from them. Do not submit references if you have not obtained the consent of such references. Your personal information will otherwise be handled in accordance with our privacy policy.

Title: Marketing Analyst
Description:
We have a newly created opening for a Marketing Analyst. We are looking for a dynamic and motivated individuals to analysis customer preferences and statistical data in order to support customers during their decision-making process regarding product, prices and promotions. Successful candidates should have the ability to gather and analyze data on consumers and competitors, conduct research, formulate policies, and manage programs to stimulate our business development. Must also have excellent communication skills, time management skills, leadership skills, work well independently, and work well as part of team.
J*ob Description: *
· Recruit participants for research activities, starting with selecting participants to invite, creating a screener survey to identify the potential customers of Sunny Shutter
· Monitor survey progress throughout the field process
· Develop research discussion guides and questionnaires for future purpose
· Analyze various types of data from survey responses, categorize the data and focus group discussions.
· Integrate other analytics findings on the buying habits and preferences of wholesale or retail consumers
· Combine the results of data analysis and the actual situation of the company, understand the business needs to provide insights that will help Sunny Shutter improve their products and services
· Responsible for all project-related admin tasks including ensure on-time completion of project; communicate requirements and study progress to colleagues, manage recruitment process and scheduling, complete incentives, etc.
· Provide ongoing feedback about the Sunny Shutter development process and suggest recommendations for improvement
· Collaborate with team members on existing projects, and research into potential customers and partners.
· Provide leadership, guidance, and support to junior team members, including performance reviews
· Create thoughtful research plans on marketing strategies for Sunny Shutter products
· Aim to use other resources like digital marketing platform to promote Sunny Shutter
Qualifications and Skills: 
· A bachelor's degree in economics, commerce, business administration or public administration is required.
· Minimum 2 years of professional experience in market research and analysis
· Experience in business administration
· Proficient in data visualization tools (Tableau/Power BI)
· Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of programs specifically Outlook, Word, Excel
· Proficient in Google applications including Google Drive, Google Docs and google Sheets
· Progressive experience in business analysis and in SQL
· Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
· Strong decision-making skills
· Strong negotiation skills
· Fast-paced environment
· Work under pressure
· Attention to detail
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $36.00 per hour
Schedule:

Day shift
Holidays
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

Scarborough, ON M1H2W2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Expected start date: 2022-07-18

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT MASTERCARD FOUNDATION 
Mastercard Foundation seeks a world where everyone has the opportunity to learn and prosper. Through its Young Africa Works strategy and Canadian EleV program, the Foundation works with partners to ensure that millions of young people, especially young women, access quality education, financial services, and dignified work. Mastercard Foundation was established in 2006 through the generosity of Mastercard when it became a public company. The Foundation is independent with its own Board of Directors and CEO.
 THE WORK AT THE FOUNDATION 
The Foundation has begun working within Canada in partnership with Indigenous communities and post-secondary institutions to listen, learn, and best understand how we can act in meaningful ways. The EleV strategy was co-created with Indigenous communities, young people, and partners to enable 30,000 Indigenous youth to complete their education and transition to dignified work aligned with their values and aspirations.
 As reflected in Canada's Truth and Reconciliation Commission Calls to Action, education is a key driver of improved socio-economic well-being. Through building partnerships with Indigenous communities, we look to expand our initiative ultimately helping to support a generation of transformative Indigenous young leaders who will be change agents within their communities. We believe that by setting a bold target, we will encourage engagement across sectors and create momentum that will elevate the strengths and opportunities of Indigenous youth. In keeping with our approach, Indigenous communities and young people will be the drivers of this transformation. The program will promote innovations to address longer-term systemic change to achieve economic prosperity and social well-being within Indigenous communities.
 The EleV team oversees current and emerging partnerships related to Indigenous education. Consistent with our overall vision and Youth Africa Works strategy, we will share learnings and opportunities to connect across the work of the Foundation. While operating in distinct contexts, the centrality of youth voice and vision, affirmation of culture and identity, and priority to enhance community capacity for self-determination are common threads upon which our work is strengthened and reinforced.
 UNDERSTANDING AFRICA PROGRAMS AT THE FOUNDATION
 We have entered a very exciting time at the Foundation as we scale up our operations across Africa to realize our Young Africa Works strategy. Our role at the Mastercard Foundation is to be a catalyst. Our Young Africa Works strategy focuses on working with others to spur systemic change so young people have the opportunity to find work that is dignified and fulfilling.
 The Foundation has opened offices in Rwanda, Kenya, Ghana, Senegal, Ethiopia, Nigeria, and Uganda, building a broader leadership presence in Africa to develop specific strategies that support youth employment. Within a country, we work with governments, the private sector, educators, young people, and other funders to improve the quality of education and vocational training, prepare young people for the work force, expand access to financial services for entrepreneurs and small businesses, and connect job seekers to dignified and fulfilling work.
 We are ambitious and driven. Our values transcend and rise above everything else as our guide. We encourage you to bring your bold ideas, curiosity, and expertise to your work. We laugh at ourselves and with each other. We are a team. Our journey together makes our impact even more meaningful.
 If you are an experienced BI Data professional looking to increase your impact, read on!
 THE OPPORTUNITY 
Reporting to the Business Intelligence Operations Lead, the role will be responsible for executing reporting and data requests by pulling, structuring, analyzing, and organizing data outputs.
 WAYS YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE 

Conduct basic data analytics as necessary for reports and internal needs.
Collate, structure, and enable integration of multiple different types of data sets for analyses.
Provide ad hoc support for data analytics requests (e.g., aggregation, disaggregation, pivot tables).
Monitor and maintain data for quality, completeness, and structure for optimal utilization.
Maintain knowledge of what data the Foundation has and where / how it is stored.
Maintain knowledge of relevant external data sources that are most heavily utilized by the Foundation (e.g., where to go to retrieve, limitations and characteristics of the data, periodicity of updates, levels of quality, etc.).
Ensure adherence to data dictionary, definitions, and governance protocols.
Engage with counterparts in functional teams (e.g., Programs, Impact, Finance, IT, KM) to ensure on-going robust data quality control and intake.
Maintain data privacy standards and protocols.
Manage data equity issues necessary (e.g., addressing data biases, data ownership, collection methods.
Determine protocols and infrastructure necessary for data collection, validation, storage, structure, retrieval and utilization to help build out the function.
Assess business questions and develop prototypes of the front-end solutions to fit each business question & ensure efficient performance of the solution.
Create data transformation list for each of the visualization and work with the BI Back-End Developer to decide where to execute the said transformations (back-end or front-end) and develop the solution accordingly.
Advise on the ETL (Extraction, Transforming, Loading) data process required to reach user-defined objectives in visualizations.
Develop the visualizations using pre-aligned set of tools.
Automating data ingestion processes.
Enhance data sets by creating automated match rules.
Automating data pre-processing, cleansing and verifying the integrity.
Optimizing Big Data system performance for data pre-processing and Machine Learning algorithms running, including code optimization, Map/Reduce fine tuning, etc.
Analyse, plan and develop requirements and standards in reference to scheduled projects.
Establishes and implements project communication plans, providing status updates to affected staff and stakeholders.
Managing change requests from the users and managing the versioning / release schedule of the solution.
Monitoring the solution usage.
Engage with requestor(s) to refine understanding of the business needs underlying BI requests and tailor outputs to meet needs, iterating as necessary.
Champion the use of data and improve data literacy through education of Foundation staff.
Provide support to program team with external data collection activities from time to time if necessary.

WHO YOU ARE

Bachelor's degree in Data science, data analytics, social sciences is required.
Strong comfort with, and experience in, retrieving, structuring, analyzing, and visualizing data across most well-establish data analytics platforms (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, R, Advanced Excel).
Familiarity with complex data structures and tasks, procedures, processes to maintain.
Experience monitoring and maintaining data quality utilizing best practices.
Familiarity with most common modes of preparing and presenting data insights (e.g., PPT, Word, e-mail, SharePoint).
Experience driving adoption of BI tools.
Demonstrated full toolkit of data management and analytics (e.g., cleaning, structuring, validating, correlations, regressions, statistical analyses, advanced analytics).
Ability to work with complex data sets and understand how to transform and combine disparate data to enable effective analytics.
Ability to translate data insights and outputs into appropriate, consumable formats (e.g., PowerPoint, Word, e-mails, SharePoint, Prezi).
Ability to retrieve data from data warehouses using SQL queries.
Ability to business partner with requestors to clarify substance of requests; act with a "Service mindset," and strive to become a trusted partner''.
Understand use case methodologies, how data insights are utilized by different audience, nuances of how to prepare and present data outputs for different uses.
Ability to flexibly engage other analytics capabilities within the org (e.g., Impact) and outside the org (e.g., Impact Partner Organizations) to execute against co-owned deliverables.
Self-directed and requires minimal guidance to produce most on-going reporting, data analytics, and visualization outputs.
Resilience and flexibility to maintain productivity through shifting priorities, parameters, rapidly changing context, and across time zones and geographies.
Resilience and persistence to ask the right questions, clarify requests, and iterate as necessary to provide the right outputs.
Solid judgment on prioritizing requests and seeking guidance when appropriate.
Listening actively to understand needs and provide constructive/receive feedback.
Aptitude for and keen interest in learning new information design and communication technology.
Resilient, intrapreneurial and flexible mindset comfortable working in a dynamic and ambiguous environment.
Strong self-direction balanced with collaborative and creative approach.
Meticulous detail-orientation and track record of delivering timely results under pressure.
Service mindset for responsiveness to requests and striving towards becoming trusted business partners to drive common Foundation goals.
Exceptional communication skills to support a culture of change.
Professional maturity, cultural sensitivity, impeccable integrity in alignment to Foundation mission and values.
Demonstrate a commitment to Mastercard Foundation's values and vision.

Deadline for Applications is August 22, 2022.
 Mastercard Foundation (the "Foundation") values and respects your privacy. By submitting an application for this opportunity, you hereby agree to the Foundation's collection, use and disclosure of your personal information in accordance with its Privacy Policy (available at https://mastercardfdn.org/privacy/). Please note that the Foundation may share your personal information with third-party agencies that support the Foundation's recruitment activities, and such third-party agencies may contact you directly regarding this opportunity. If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the Foundation's Privacy Officer at the address indicated in its Privacy Policy.
 The Mastercard Foundation values the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the organization and we are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. 
Completion of satisfactory business references and background checks are essential conditions of employment. 
For more information and to sign up for the Foundation's newsletter, please visit http://www.mastercardfdn.org/ Follow the Foundation on Twitter at @MastercardFdn
 NB: To avoid missing email communication about your application, please check your spam/junk folder and mark our emails as "not junk".

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Insights
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Analyst, Data Insights
 





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data issues. As a Senior Analyst/Manager, Data Quality Issue Management you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the identification, root cause analysis, and management of data issues through to resolution for business critical processes and regulatory reports. Reporting to the Associate Director, you will define and monitor data quality controls and resolve data issues for business partners across the organization including Finance, Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth Management.

 What will you do?
 Data Quality Monitoring:

 Monitor data quality control exceptions, conduct detailed investigations, including root cause analysis, and identify and document data issues
 Collaborate with business process and report owners, and other users of shared data assets to capture systemic and other self-identified data issues and control gaps
 Use standardized and ad hoc reporting to communicate data quality results, trends and insights to business partners and management

 Issues Management & Resolution (IMR):

 Track and manage data quality and control issues from assignment through to resolution by applying best practices and using the Collibra IMR workflow and Jira project management tools
 Collaborate with the Chief Data Office, Data Management Offices, IT and other business functions to facilitate data remediation, adjustments and/or system changes to address the root cause of the data issues
 Provide monthly summary and detailed reporting on resolved and outstanding issues, finding and recommendations to business partners and key stakeholders.

 Continuous Improvement:

 Propose process changes/improvement to address identified gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls
 Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of data quality controls, data profiling tools and systems to support the definition and implementation of effective controls and reporting
 Work with the Chief Data Office and other Data Management Offices to support standards and best practices to improve data quality, participating in initiatives to raise awareness and drive improved data quality across the organization (e.g. Data Working Groups, Data Literacy projects)

 [1] Collibra is RBC’s master data management platform and includes Issues Management & Resolution (IMR) work flow and reporting capability.

 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have:

 3+ years of relevant experience with data quality principles, data control design, data management and data analysis
 Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data analysis methods and the ability to analyze and resolve complex data related issues.
 2+ years of experience conducting root cause analysis, using tools/frameworks such as SQL, Excel, Python, Hive.
 Education in a numerical discipline, IT, business or equivalent work experience.
 Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
 Proficiency in preparation of reports and presentations.


 Nice-to-have:

 General understanding of financial reporting, finance and risk business concepts and procedures
 Experience working with financial services and systems including finance and/or credit risk data
 Experience using Collibra or a similar data management or workflow platform
 Ability to manage multiple competing priorities during busy periods


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 Opportunities to do challenging work







































 Job Summary




































 Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

 TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

 CAN-NS-BEDFORD, CAN-ON-TORONTO
