Title: Business Analyst
Description:
WHO ARE WE?
Total Credit Recovery Limited (TCR) is the largest Canadian-owned receivables management company, servicing most major Canadian credit grantors. TCR is a progressive company, with over 350 employees in 4 offices across the country.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
We are looking for a passionate and committed individual to join our growing Analytics team. This is a fantastic opportunity for you to take the lead on an array of exciting projects and bring innovative solutions of your own design to our company.In your position, you will:

Collaborate with a dynamic team on the creation and implementation of strategic projects
Lead new initiatives to improve processes and increase value for the business
Design and build new datasets and monitoring suites, leveraging business intelligence tools
Conduct analysis and present insights to business leaders in monthly meetings
Provide consultation to key clients on strategies and business trends
Research and implement new techniques and emerging technologies
Receive ongoing training and coaching through the TCR Mentorship Program

WHO ARE YOU?

Holds an undergraduate degree
Strong quantitative skills with a working knowledge of statistics
Excellent problem solver who leverages data and analytics, in conjunction with solid judgement and intuition, to make decisions
Fluent with data management and analysis tools like Microsoft Excel, SQL Server
Proficient programming skills in SQL, R, or Python
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Highly motivated, self-starter, with an ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Results-focused, with a passion for business and delivering high quality work on time

WHAT WE OFFER:

Competitive salary
Continuing education reimbursement
Great benefits including medical, dental and optical plans
Friendly and fun work environment
Opportunities for advancement

Total Credit Recovery Limited is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to offering equal employment opportunities and fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment. We welcome applications from persons representing the diversity of our community. Please notify us if you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process.
For more on this and other employment opportunities at Total Credit Recovery Limited please visit our website.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $45,000.00-$55,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
On-site parking
Tuition reimbursement
Vision care

Schedule:

8 hour shift
Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's Degree (required)

Experience:

Analytics: 1 year (required)

Title: Customer Services Business Development Analyst
Description:
Aufgaben 





      Customer Services Business Development Analyst: Mercedes-Benz Canada needs fans like you 
       What it means to be a fan 
       Everything starts with fans. Mercedes-Benz Canada is the number one luxury automotive company in Canada, eight years in a row. We are looking for someone who is enthusiastically devoted to Mercedes-Benz. You love our brand and have the drive to learn about the automotive industry. You are impressed with the Mercedes-Benz legacy and can easily identify with what the star represents. And you are eager to live Mercedes-Benz values and are ready to add to the story. 
       How your role will add to the story: 
       We are looking for a Customer Services Business Development Analyst. You will provide support to Customer Services Business Development by creating standard reports to monitor key metrics and use various data analytics methods to provide business insights and identify business opportunities. You will report directly to Manager, Pricing and Reporting and will also have the opportunity to work with the Parts Operations Team, GSP team, BI Team as well as other external teams. 
       A day in the life: 
      

Support all Business Owners in the department by building reporting to track sales revenue and unit sales for each business. 
Provide reports on a weekly and monthly basis 
Support the build of a new dashboard in Power BI for Sell Out data 
Provide Daily Net Revenue Report to MBC Management and GSP 
Provide Month End roll up of revenue and warranty payout to Controlling 
Provide Month End reporting on PC and Van performance vs target to ExCom 
Manage the current reports in Tableau 
Support transition to Power BI 
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with IT as necessary 
Support Field Team with standard reporting templates 
M-B Canada requires all new employees to present proof they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 when they start work. Currently, an individual is considered “fully vaccinated” two weeks after receiving the second dose of a Health Canada approved two-dose vaccine, or two weeks after receiving one dose of a Health Canada approved single-dose vaccine. Individuals with medical exemptions preventing them from receiving the vaccine may request an accommodation. 
       Mercedes-Benz Canada Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all applicants including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women and aboriginals. We thank you for your interest, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. 
     






Qualifikationen 





      Mercedes-Benz Fan skills, requirements & traits: 
      

University Degree preferably in Computer Science or Engineering 
2 Years’ experience in automotive sector. 
Knowledge in Automotive industry, After-sales business, Database 
Ability to work independently, Prioritize Effectively and meet tight deadlines. 
Experience with Data collection, data analysis 
Experience with Tableau, Alteryx, Power BI, MS Excel 
Bold, innovative and enjoy challenging yourself 
Honest and professional, a strong team player 
Big picture thinker, go-getter, self-starter 
Being a Mercedes-Benz Fan has its perks: 
      

Commitment to inclusion & diversity 
Engaging corporate culture 
Training development and career growth opportunities 
Benefits to support work-life balance/integration 
A strong portfolio of corporate social responsibility initiatives 
State of the art working facilities 
Vehicle purchase and experience programs 
Comprehensive health, dental, and pension programs 
Recognition rewards and discount programs

Title: Junior Research Scholar/Post-Graduate Research Scholar - Data Analyst
Description:
French translation follows below / La version française suit

 The Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada (APFC) is looking to hire a full-time Junior Research Scholar (JRS) or Post-Graduate Research Scholar (PGRS) with a specialty in data analysis to work on gathering, transforming, and preparing data on sub-national connections between Canada and the Asia-Pacific. This role will support the development of the Canada Asia Sustainability Tracker (CAST). CAST is an online, interactive platform for mapping and visualizing developments in the Asia Pacific with respect to specific nodes of Canadian engagement with the region.

 The data created through this role will further develop our understanding of the rich web of connections linking people and places in Canada and Asia. These connections may be cultural, economic, diplomatic, etc. Some examples of datasets we hope to augment or develop include:


 Foreign direct investment
Published academic research collaborations
Asian diaspora communities in Canada
Commodities trade and supply chains
Canada's educational diaspora
Canadian culture in Asia (sports, music, etc.)
Asian culture in Canada (food, music, language, etc.)
Student exchanges, study-abroad experiences, university partnerships
Canadian businesses with locations in Asia
Diplomatic missions and trade offices
Trans-pacific NGOs



 Many of the datasets we are considering come from one or more open or internal sources but will require considerable thought and effort regarding selection, validation, transformation, and formatting to be ready for integration with CAST. It's critical that the datasets being developed are maintainable and updatable, so a large part of the work will focus on setting up automated data transformation/validation pipelines within an appropriate software framework such as Node, Python, PHP, R, PostgreSQL, etc.
 Another key task for this role will be to maintain and extend our database of Canadian and Asian sub-national jurisdictions in collaboration with our regional specialists.

 The application deadline is Sunday, August 7 (at 11:59 p.m. PST). Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled; you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as you are ready.

 Eligibility

 Applicants must


 be eligible to work in Canada and be either a student or have graduated from a Canadian post-secondary institution with either a Ph.D. or master's degree within the past 24 months of the application deadline of Sunday, August 7, 2022 (at 11:59 p.m. PT).
and as part of our legal obligation under the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) and consistent with our Vaccination Policy, APF Canada requires all staff and future staff to be dual-vaccinated. Such vaccination requirement is subject to APF Canada's duty to accommodate under applicable human rights legislation.



 Skills & Experience

 Applicants should be able to demonstrate


 experience working with complex datasets using modern programming languages, data tools, and methods
ability to write clear, concise code and share examples, e.g. through a GitHub profile or similar.
detail-oriented approach to data management



 Other skills and experience that will be considered beneficial:


 Experience with JavaScript /web development
Knowledge and experience of the Asia Pacific, including languages
Experience working with GIS and open geospatial data (e.g. OpenStreetMap, Wikidata)



 Location & Start Date

 We offer a friendly and flexible work environment from our offices based in Toronto and Vancouver. We are working both in the office and remotely on a hybrid schedule, and the JRS/PGRS will ideally be available for regular in-office collaboration in either city. However strong applications from elsewhere in Canada may be considered.
 The start date is flexible, though we hope to fill the position quickly, with a grant agreement initially lasting one year. There is a possibility to extend the grant agreement until March 31, 2024.

 Major Responsibilities


 Audit existing datasets for accuracy/validity/completeness and make updates as necessary
Collect and format new datasets in close collaboration with topic or region specialists
Automate data update/validation workflows in consultation with the CAST development team
Work with the APFC research team to identify potential topics/areas for new datasets
Provide support to various ongoing research initiatives as needed
Assist with other duties as assigned in support of APFC



 Term & Compensation

 This one-year grant agreement offers a research stipend of $3,300 to $4,000 monthly, based on qualifications. The stipend will be paid in regular installments throughout the year and will be reported on a T4A (i.e. is not subject to tax withholding).

 Application Procedures

 Applications should include the following documents as ONE MERGED PDF file. Incomplete applications will not be considered. Please click here to apply.


 One-page cover letter detailing your career interests, fit with the job requirements, and why you are interested in working with APF Canada
Résumé detailing your academic background, skills, and/or professional experiences relevant to the job description



 The application deadline is Sunday, August 7, (at 11:59 p.m. PST). Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis until the position is filled; you are encouraged to submit your application as soon as you are ready.

 For questions, please get in touch with Dr. Nate Wessel at nate.wessel@asiapacific.ca

 La Fondation Asie Pacifique du Canada (FAP Canada) est à la recherche d’un chercheur de cycle supérieur à temps plein, spécialisé en analyse de données, pour travailler à la collecte, la transformation et la préparation de données sur les liens infranationaux entre le Canada et l’Asie-Pacifique. Ce rôle permettra de soutenir le déploiement du Suivi de la durabilité Canada-Asie (CAST). CAST est une plateforme interactive en ligne servant à cartographier et à visualiser les développements en Asie Pacifique particulièrement marqués par une implication canadienne.

 Les données créées dans le cadre de ce rôle nous permettront de mieux comprendre le réseau dense de liens entre les personnes et les lieux au Canada et en Asie. Ces liens peuvent être culturels, économiques, diplomatiques, etc. Voici quelques exemples d’ensembles de données que nous espérons enrichir ou étoffer :


 Investissement étranger direct
Collaborations de recherche universitaire publiées
Communautés de la diaspora asiatique au Canada
Commerce des matières premières et chaînes d’approvisionnement
Diaspora éducative du Canada
Culture canadienne en Asie (sports, musique, etc.).
Culture asiatique au Canada (nourriture, musique, langue, etc.).
Échanges d’étudiants, expériences d’études à l’étranger, partenariats universitaires
Entreprises canadiennes implantées en Asie
Missions diplomatiques et bureaux commerciaux
ONG transpacifiques



 Bon nombre des ensembles de données que nous examinons proviennent d’une ou de plusieurs sources ouvertes ou internes, mais nécessiteront une réflexion et des efforts considérables en matière de sélection, de validation, de transformation et de formatage afin d’être prêts à être intégrés à la plateforme CAST. Il est essentiel que les ensembles de données créés puissent être maintenus et mis à jour. Une grande partie du travail consistera donc à mettre en place des pipelines automatisés de transformation/validation des données dans un cadre logiciel approprié tel que Node, Python, PHP, R, PostgreSQL, etc.

 Le maintien et l’expansion de notre base de données des administrations infranationales canadiennes et asiatiques, en collaboration avec nos spécialistes régionaux, constituent une autre tâche essentielle du poste.

 La date limite de dépôt des candidatures est le dimanche 7 août (à 23 h 59 HP). Les candidatures seront acceptées sur une base continue jusqu’à ce que le poste soit pourvu; nous vous encourageons à soumettre votre candidature dès que vous êtes prêt.

 Admissibilité

 Les candidats doivent :


 être autorisés à travailler au Canada et soit être étudiants ou avoir obtenu un doctorat ou une maîtrise au cours des 24 derniers mois avant la date limite de dépôt des candidatures, le dimanche 7 août 2022 (à 23 h 59 HP).
Et, dans le cadre du Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA) et de notre politique de vaccination, tout personnel de la FAP Canada doit avoir reçu au moins deux doses d’un vaccin contre la COVID-19. Cette exigence en matière de vaccination est assujettie à l’obligation d’adaptation de la FAP Canada en vertu des lois en matière de droits de la personne.



 Compétences et expérience

 Les candidats doivent être en mesure de démontrer :


 une expérience dans l’utilisation d’ensembles de données complexes à l’aide de langages de programmation, d’outils de données et de méthodes modernes;
une capacité à écrire un code clair et concis et à partager des exemples, p. ex., à l’aide d’un profil GitHub ou analogue;
une approche minutieuse de la gestion des données.



 Autres compétences et expériences qui seront considérées comme des atouts :


 expérience de JavaScript et du développement Web;
connaissance et expérience de la région Asie-Pacifique, y compris des langues;
expérience de travail avec les SIG et les données géospatiales ouvertes ( ex., OpenStreetMap, Wikidata).



 Lieu et date de début

 Nous offrons un environnement de travail convivial et flexible depuis nos bureaux situés à Toronto et à Vancouver. Nous travaillons à la fois au bureau et à distance selon un horaire hybride, et le chercheur de cycle supérieur à temps plein sera idéalement disponible pour une collaboration régulière au bureau dans l’une ou l’autre ville. Toutefois, les candidatures solides provenant d’autres régions du Canada peuvent être prises en considération.
 La date de début est flexible, mais nous espérons pourvoir le poste rapidement, avec un accord de subvention d’une durée initiale d’un an. Il existe une possibilité de prolonger l’accord de subvention jusqu’au 31 mars 2024.

 Principales responsabilités


 Vérifier l’exactitude, la validité et l’exhaustivité des ensembles de données existants et effectuer les mises à jour nécessaires.
Collecter et formater de nouveaux ensembles de données en étroite collaboration avec des spécialistes du sujet ou de la région.
Automatiser les processus de mise à jour et de validation des données en consultation avec l’équipe de développement du CAST.
Travailler avec l’équipe de recherche de la FAP Canada pour déterminer les sujets et domaines potentiels pour les nouveaux ensembles de données.
Offrir du soutien aux projets de recherche en cours, au besoin.
Participer à d’autres tâches assignées au service de la FAP Canada.



 Durée du mandat et rémunération

 Cet accord de subvention d’un an offre une allocation de recherche de 3 300 à 4 000 $ par mois, en fonction des qualifications. L’allocation sera payée en versements réguliers tout au long de l’année et sera déclarée sur un T4A (c.-à-d. qu’elle ne fera pas l’objet d’une retenue d’impôt).
 Processus de candidature

 Les candidatures doivent inclure les documents suivants dans UN SEUL FICHIER PDF FUSIONNÉ. Les candidatures incomplètes ne seront pas prises en considération. Veuillez cliquer ici pour appliquer.


 Une lettre de présentation d’une page expliquant vos intérêts professionnels, en quoi vous répondez aux exigences du poste et les raisons pour lesquelles vous souhaitez travailler avec la FAP Canada.
Un curriculum vitae exposant en détail votre formation universitaire et vos compétences ou expériences professionnelles en rapport avec la description du poste.



 La date limite de dépôt des candidatures est le dimanche 7 août (à 23 h 59 HP). Les candidatures seront acceptées sur une base continue jusqu’à ce que le poste soit pourvu; nous vous encourageons à soumettre votre candidature dès que vous êtes prêt.

 Pour toute question, veuillez contacter le M. Nate Wessel, à nate.wessel@asiapacific.ca.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data AnalystPanoply Media is looking for a mid level digital marketer who would like to learn and grow their knowledge and experience in digital marketing, working within the Digital Media Team.Your eagerness to learn will allow you to grow within an environment led by a senior marketing team allowing you to quench your thirst for learning new skills within the ever growing digital marketing landscape (from Connected TV to audio down to Social Media, and much more).You are curious, passionate and attentive to details. You are solutions oriented and like to see the full story and enable others to follow along.
Our valuesWe believe in finding value by doing the hard work. We are all hands on when it comes time to activate, execute and analyse our campaigns.We think that there are great opportunities for ambitious brands who are willing to take a chance on emerging media. We don't rinse and repeat, we always push the envelope to find new opportunities to reach consumers where other brands are not active.We believe in the mid-funnel. The duality of Top-funnel branding and Low-funnel sales activation have plagued marketers since digital media arrived on the scene. We believe that new technologies now make it possible to transmit a brand message while also activating sales.What You'll DoThe Data Analyst plays a key role within our operations team in the day-to-day execution of our advertising campaigns. We expect the candidate to become the key technical resource for tracking & analytics, as well as build out the dashboards within the provided tools. This role will be an ever growing role and can grow into managing a team of data specialists, as we keep growing.Responsibilities

Work with the team in order to gather requirements of dashboards (client objectives, KPIs, and any special reporting needs)
Determine potential roadblocks and solutions for tracking and optimising towards our advertisers KPIs
Work within a various set of platforms to gather reporting and connecting APIs to dashboard
Visualisation of data in a clear precise manner
Develop partner relationships with different ad tech solutions
Create processes to ensure we are leveraging the platforms efficiently and cost effectively
Work closely with the VP and with Digital Media Director to establish a roadmap and determine the needs of the operations team
Developing and ensuring top quality dashboards for clients and management
Provide clean and clear data for post campaign analysis
Drive key reporting metrics for management
Remain up to date on new features and media innovations. Present these to the internal team on a regular basis

What You Bring

DEC or BAC in Marketing/Analytics, Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience
Understanding of media metrics and dimensions
Data visualisation experience (Datorama, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Knowledge of ETL processes
Added assets if you know (SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and data-driven mindset is a must.
Attention to detail
Ability to learn on your own and investigate when needed
Excellent written and oral communication skills (French and English)
Remain organised and consistently follow-up when needed
Intermediate to advanced skills with Excel or Google Sheets

What's in it for you?

Learn and grow within a team of digital marketers who have 15+ years of experience.
Work on million$+ advertising national digital campaigns
You will get access to the top leading industry platforms and training
Flexible work schedule
Hybrid model of working from home and office
Summer hours
Yearly offsite

Job Type: Full-time

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is currently seeking a Data Analyst! Our client is located in Mississauga and is one of the largest organizations in the retail food industry. The Data Analyst will be working hand in hand with the HR team. Please see all details below. 

 Remote? No, Hybrid - in office 2 days/week 

Start date: Immediate 

Hours: Mon-Fri 9am - 5pm 

 Key Responsibilities & Skills 

 Ability to understand the Business ask and translate into Data deliverable 
Ability to analyse data 
Ability to create the Reports independently as per the Business ask 
Ability to explain the findings and provide insights based on the data 
Partner closely with the HR Ops and Analytics team to define key metrics, scorecards and measures, and dashboards to support talent programs 
Ensure the right data sets are in place to manage and monitor. Work with HR solutions team to operationalize. 
Provide analysis on the complete cycle of talent analytics and the interrelationships between different talent information and processes. 
Identify statistical analysis techniques required to deliver HR insights. 
Evaluate the effectiveness of talent investments and programs based on analysis. 
Partner closely with HR Solutions team to create sustainable reports to drive decision making. 


Requirements:
 Data visualization (Tableau knowledge preferred) 
SQL knowledge 
HR data or People Analytics experience preferred 
Data Analytics experience 
Presenting to stakeholders/clients 
Required to compile large data, data cleansing/purge data

Logical Thinking and understanding 
Experience with any data visualization tools 
Experience analyzing large amounts of data and consulting clients. 
Experience formulating hypotheses, interpreting and communicating results. 
Undergraduate degree in Finance or commerce or Stats preferred 
5 years experience in an analyst role 
Knowledge of SAP HR, BW, Tableau/SAS and Success Factors

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Ottawa Hub location)
Description:
Requisition ID: 152051  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 The Team Oversees Finance Data Management & Data Services within Global Finance & Risk Technology (GFRT) provides analytics and support services for Global Finance Initiatives. The Finance Data Management Data Services team supports Financial Close Processes and provide Financial Data Management, Data Analysis, Data Quality and Data Governance services for Toronto/Canada. The team is heavily involved in business transformation projects and equivalency testing during migrations.

 The Role As a Data Engineer you are required to participate in multiple finance transformation projects, liaise with stakeholders on new business initiatives, delivering solutions to meet the needs of multiple lines of business, and interfaces extensively with business clients. The incumbent will have a minimum of 2 to 3 years of strong expertise querying data from ledgers, data models, database design and an understanding of the Bank's financial data. The individual must thrive on challenge, be proactive, and demonstrate initiative, coaching the data engineers and eagerness to learn.
 Some of the key accountabilities include:

Work with senior team members (architects, developers, testers) to develop and implement data solutions for finance reporting systems
Analyze data in both Financial Systems and Big Data environments
Support senior team members through research assignments and proof of concepts
Demonstrate a passion for problem solving and data presentation technologies
Facilitate UAT testing for system migration and new initiatives
Report development and support for internal customers; including executives analytical minded skillset
Provide analytical support to company leadership by providing ad-hoc analysis and data trouble shooting support
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Builds a high-performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment and using a coaching mindset and behaviors; communicating vison/values/business strategy; and managing succession and development planning for the team.



 What You Will Bring to Succeed


Advanced level SQL design / reporting / data mining experience or familiar with using ACL
CPA/CA or Accounting/finance knowledge with computer science/data sciences certification is preferred.
Data Modeling experience with Agile methodology and familiar with scrum meetings and sprint planning.
Analytical and Detail-oriented
Report development and support for internal and external customers; including executives analytical minded skillset.




 The Workplace


We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation



 Scotiabank As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Cognos Analytics
Description:
To help in our planned growth, we are pro-actively recruiting for a Business Intelligence Analyst for upcoming opportunities specific to the Cognos Analytics platform. The BI Analyst will be a key member of our IT Professional Services team. In this role, you will be responsible for client-based projects and, in collaboration with our delivery and sales teams, you will deliver best of breed solutions to new and existing customers.
 Key Responsibilities:

 Conduct business requirements gathering and analysis, identify datasets to support analytics initiatives and expand the existing data warehouse.
 Collaborate with the BI team in detailed design including dynamic reports, executive dashboards, and information portals.
 Work with client stakeholders to support a BI environment that is critical for future decision making and evaluation.
 Review the existing architecture and data feeds and investigate the best approach to incorporate direct calls to source databases.
 Create reports in Cognos and provide Cognos Analytics support & training to data management staff.
 Ensure solutions meet the information, functionality, and performance needs of targeted users through testing

Title: Policy and Program Analyst
Description:
Background
 The Condominium Authority of Ontario (CAO) is committed to meeting the needs of condominium communities through the delivery of the following online services and resources available to all condominium communities across the province:



Easy-to-use information to help owners, residents, directors, and managers understand their general rights and responsibilities.
Online resources, condominium forms, tools, and guided steps to resolve common issues collaboratively before they escalate into disputes.
An easily accessible and cost effective online dispute resolution service through the Condominium Authority Tribunal (CAT) – Canada’s first fully online tribunal. 
Mandatory training for condominium directors to help them understand their oversight and legal obligations.
Easy-to-navigate condominium returns system that allows condominium corporations to file and update key information.
Publicly available and searchable Condominium Public Registry containing information on every condominium corporation in Ontario.



 Underpinning these online services is the CAO’s highly skilled Information Services team which answers inquiries and provides guidance to owners, residents, directors, and condominium managers by phone and email on varied and complex issues that often arise in condominium communities.

 Purpose of position
 Reporting to the Manager, Policy and Programs, the Policy and Programs Analyst will work predominately on assigned service enhancements, online resource development, and submissions to government. This includes CAO program projects and operational policy and procedures which have been identified by the CAO’s senior management as critical to the success of the CAO. These enhancements and projects support the CAO’s overall strategic and annual operational plan(s) offering timely, user-friendly, accessible, and relevant resources to the condominium communities across Ontario.


 The role will either be for a 6-month Fixed-term contract or permanent. Please apply by July 29, 2022.

 Key responsibilities

Liaise with the CAO’s IT department to ensure the timely completion of digital service enhancements. This will include the development of business requirements for identified digital service enhancements, ensuring the timely development of these enhancements, and ensuring the developed enhancements meet the specifications of the business requirements. 
Develop and implement various data collection instruments to inform future service enhancements for the CAO. 
Assist with the review and analysis of collected data to make recommendations to senior management and/or the CAO’s Board of Directors regarding service enhancements. 
Support CAO initiatives by conducting comprehensive research, gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing data and information to make recommendations that will inform decisions on the priorities regarding individual initiatives.
Prepare required summary notes, briefing/decision notes, presentation decks or other materials for senior management and/or the CAO’s Board of Directors.
Prepare detailed workplans on assigned initiatives to ensure that projects are delivered on time and are of high quality. Monitor and report on progress toward completion including identifying any gaps in progress, providing recommendations, and implementing solutions to aid in closing identified gaps.
Augment existing CAO website materials or draft new content with the view to meeting the information needs of various users of the CAO’s information offerings.
Develop and/or amend CAO operational/governance policies, procedures, and/or proposals to support effective operations and/or good governance of the organization.
Other duties as requested. 



Qualifications, skills and knowledge

Post-secondary education in policy or a related field is required; an equivalent combination of training and experience may be considered.
Ability to develop in-depth knowledge and application of the Condominium Act, 1998 and its regulations, as well as other legislation, issues and resources related to condominium living in Ontario.
Ability to gather and synthesize complex information (particularly legal) and gear this information (written and verbal) to the appropriate audience level.
High level of communication skills with particular emphasis on excellent writing ability to convey information in a clear and concise manner.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience with collecting and analyzing data to inform recommendations would be an asset.
Previous experience with project planning and delivery is considered an asset.
Successful candidate(s) must be self-directed and motivated to deliver agreed upon outcomes with minimal supervision, often within short timelines.
Demonstrated time management skills.
Ability to work individually as well as part working as part of a team.
Ability to prioritize and manage conflicting demands.



 Working conditions/ environment 

Hybrid Environment – 3 days in the office.
At CAO, the well-being of our employees is a priority and we will follow the necessary protocols to maintain a safe working environment.



 Disclaimer 
CAO is an equal opportunity employer, encouraging workplace diversity. 
All qualified individuals will be considered without regard to race, national origin, gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other characteristic protected by law.
 CAO welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Field:
    

Business Support




     Job Type:
    

Full-time





Who We Are 
BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com
 SUMMARY
 The Reporting Analyst is responsible preparing business reports to assist with enabling decision makers in making well-informed business decisions.
 KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for data integrity within information management systems
Compiles and maintains large volume of real estate portfolio data within information management systems to support various reporting, benchmarking and analytical requirements.
Generates and compiles data from multiple data sources using various business intelligence tools and information management systems
Prepares various reports including but not limited to performance reports and scorecard reports to assist with business communication and decision making
Performs calculations and analysis to fulfill requirements including but not limited to performance reporting, occupancy cost allocation and chargeback, budget to spend variance reporting
Other duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Ability to handle a large volume of information and accurate management of large datasets along
Very strong attention to detail
Strong data analysis and interpretation skills
Computer proficiency in relational databases, reporting tools, MS Office including MS Access and MS Excel, with ability to learn new information management systems quickly

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None required

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. Title: Logistics Analyst
Description:
The Logistics Analyst (LA) is responsible for gathering, analyzing and producing data from various sources to provide insight to Logistics and Multimodal leadership for ongoing management and improvement. The LA will monitor and organize the overall data management platform for the Logistics team. As well the LA is responsible for providing support as required in order to enhance efficiency, effectiveness, and consistency in the execution of Logistics and Multimodal business.
 


   Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities
 

   Data Reporting & Analysis
 

 Work with ABL and Multimodal leadership to confirm requirements and deliverables
 Confirm that other Bison departments (CI, Analytics, etc.) do not have availability to perform the requirements.
 Gather, analyze, and assess data from various sources
 Create, update, maintain key data requirements for reporting
 Liaise with the leaders to create actionable business improvements, and determine the potential business outcomes from reports/data where reasonable. Track the activity and closure to the actions.
 Ensure cadence to report distribution schedule and timing of follow up action
 Understand and initiate next steps to more sustainable and automated reporting
 Analyze, document and recommend adjustments to processes
 Other projects as assigned



   Data Management / Administration
 

 Update Logistics J:Drive folder for team use and administer best practices, follow up with team as required
 Liaise with carrier, finance, and carrier equipment stakeholders ensuring equipment interchange settlement processing and invoicing is completed monthly
 Process trailer lists and develop automation and best practices for maintenance
 Create, update and maintain a task priority list providing insight to task management
 Other tasks as assigned



   Carrier Program Administration
 

 Create, update and maintain reporting for carrier programs


 Work closely with the Carrier Relationship Coordinator as required on reporting ensuring reporting is done in a timely, sustainable and automated fashion



   Support for Logistics
 

 Providing holiday and back-up support to the operations which could include tasks such as data maintenance, tracing, monitoring, updating and task management
 Assist other departments as time permits to meet operational goals


   Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Qualifications
 


   ESSENTIAL SKILLS
 

   Analytical
 

   Results Orientated
 

   Customer Focused
 

   Time Management
 

   Problem Solving
 

   Initiative
 

   Communication
 


   Work Relationships
 

 Reports directly to the Director, Logistics Operations
 Reports indirectly to the Director, Logistics Operations
 Works in conjunction with all Logistics and Multi-modal, Administration, and all external customers



 Why Bison:
  

Thrive in a supportive team that provides coaching and training to help develop your skills and progress your career
Dispersed work environments that promote a healthy work-life balance
Meaningful and impactful work and projects with an essential service provider
Join our engaging Wellness Program & extracurricular sports teams




   About Bison:
  

Celebrating over 50 years in Business
Named as Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures
Active in giving back through Corporate Social Responsibility and Charitable Giving
Committed to environmental sustainability




   Bison Transport is committed to Diversity and Inclusion in the Workplace.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professionals and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.
 Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home! 

About the team
 The Sales & Client Success analytics team provides insights and helps optimize strategy by working closely with leadership in our sales and customer care organizations. Our business is a two-sided marketplace of homeowners and service professionals, which makes our jobs complex and data rich. We work daily with sales and customer care leadership teams to develop, execute, monitor, and refine initiatives that drive value and quantify that value as it pertains to financial performance. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to stretch your business acumen, technical know-how and quantitative skills while providing insight to the company.
 Additionally, this team will help support our Marketing team that focuses on growing our pro network. This involves surfacing metrics, providing insights, and identifying opportunities that align with company goals.
 What you'll do

Build curated data sources in star schema and develop data pipelines to support strategic and operational improvements.
Synthesize large data sets into digestible information, primarily utilizing Snowflake, Excel, and Looker.
Conduct deep dive analyses with the intent to provide actionable items that foster new and creative ways to enhance and improve performance.
Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on all data and objectives relating to the team you support.

Who you are

BA/BS in a quantitative field (Finance, Engineering, Economics, etc.)
4+ years of professional experience in a data analyst or data engineering role.
Advanced SQL, understanding of relational databases and Excel
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices and dashboard development
Basic to intermediate understanding of data modeling, data engineering concepts
Experience with Looker and Snowflake is a plus

We value diversity
 We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.
 Compensation & Benefits

The salary band for this position varies, commensurate with experience and performance.
Full medical, dental, vision package and a retirement plan to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
RST Industries is an innovative and highly responsive transportation solution company. Specializing in tank operations, we are always ready to tackle the biggest challenge and provide the best value. At RST, we recognize the importance of a strong team. We look for people who want to lead, succeed and contribute to our organization.
 RST Industries is currently seeking a highly motivated individual to fill the role of Business Analyst at our Saint John, NB location. This position will appeal to those who like to work in a fast-paced environment, enjoy being in the field and have a high standard for their work.The Business Analyst delivers full data analysis projects from data extraction, (using various sources including SQL databases), to data preparation (data cleaning and the union of various data sources), integrity checks (including the detection of outliers), feature engineering, modeling, and finally, visualizing and presenting impactful insights.
 Roles and Responsibilities:

Develop understanding of business processes and analyze operational data to support daily management, decision making, and building alerts
Understand key metrics and build dashboards to enable efficient and effective management
Financial & statistical analysis and recommendations to support decision making
Support and participate in Continuous Improvement projects
Ad hoc and project work
Analysis presentation to stakeholders
Develop and implement process automation throughout the business

Qualifications:

Undergraduate university degree in computer science, engineering or a related discipline
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Experience working with relational databases accompanied by an understanding of ETL methods & processes
Experience working with Power BI or other data visualization and analytics tools such as: Minitab, SPSS, Alteryx, or Tableau
Experience with Microsoft Power Services
Ability to manage deadlines and prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong organizational skills and a high sense of urgency & curiosity
Strong communication & presentation skills
Experience in transportation and logistics would be considered an asset

Please apply online.
 We appreciate your interest in our company however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 To learn more about our products and services, click here.


RST Industries Limited is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

Title: Electronic Files Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you. 















Working Arrangement 













Hybrid 
 
Job Description 

Are you a fan of numbers? Do you like solving problems? Do you consider yourself an Excel guru? 

If any of the above describe you, you may be a great fit for the Electronic Files team! 

As an integral part of Group Retirement, Plan Sponsor Services, the Electronic File Analyst is responsible for providing technical and analytical expertise to ensure the successful transmission and upload of electronic demographic and contribution data files on the Manulife administration system.   The Electronic File Analyst works within a very fast paced team where information integrity, effective problem solving abilities, and responsiveness are critical to ensuring a positive service experience for the client while successfully controlling any financial or reputational risk to Manulife. 

Key Accountabilities: 

Accurately and efficiently load demographic and contribution files and take immediate action on issues. 
Accurately and consistently handle all reports generated from file uploads. Review and investigate reports to provide error analysis and identify negative member impacts. 
Apply advanced technical and analytical skills in troubleshooting to resolve client issues and identify process improvement opportunities. 
Provide technical expertise on systems, file specifications, automatic file translators, file security protocols and manual/electronic updating procedures. 
Manage workload efficiently to ensure service standards are consistently met with utmost attention to detail and accuracy 
Liaise with clients, support, and IS teams on data, system, and file issues. Provide technical expertise in meetings with internal and external stakeholders. 
Analyze file data to ensure compatibility with file specification and client structure. Perform data manipulation to put client’s data into proper file specifications. 
Analyze data extracts and member history for client requests and investigations. 
Consider downstream impacts of all file handling and ensure full compliance with required processes. 


Qualifications: 

Experience in a technical role; preferably related to review, loading and/or manipulation of large data files requiring deep analysis and problem solving 
Advanced Excel skills 
Customer service experience, with a high aptitude for relationship building both internally and with clients 
Previous experience with Group Retirement Services, MPS, and associated products is an asset 
SQL knowledge is an asset 


Attributes 

An aptitude for data analysis and reconciliation 
Excellent time management and organizational skills 
Ability to balance multiple competing priorities with quick turn around times 
Results oriented with an excellent level of accuracy and attention to detail 
High level of technical proficiency 
Ability to anticipate potential issues, procedural gaps, and servicing needs 
Excellent interpersonal skills – able to cultivate and maintain strong partnerships with both internal and external customers 
Effective written and verbal communication skills 


Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today. 

About John Hancock and Manulife 

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com . 

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance , annuities , investments , 401(k) plans , and education savings plans . Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com . 

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer 

At Manulife /John Hancock , we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour , ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law. 

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process . All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies . To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com .

Siemens is proud to be an eight-time award winner of Canada’s Top 100 Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers 2022, Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2022 and Greater Toronto's Top Employers 2022.

About us.
 We share our ideas and champion the people behind them.
 For over 110 years, Siemens Canada has stood for engineering excellence, innovation, quality and reliability. Active across Canada, the company focuses on intelligent infrastructure for buildings and distributed energy systems and on automation and digitalization in the process and manufacturing industries. Siemens brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit customers and society. Through Mobility, a leading supplier of intelligent mobility solutions for rail and road transport, Siemens is helping to shape Canada’s passenger rail services. In addition, Siemens holds a minority stake in Siemens Energy, a global leader in the transmission and generation of electrical power.
 Making a difference together we raised $385,000 towards charitable contributions, support over 38 non-profit organizations and planted 660 trees in our local communities. Siemens Canada has 2,500 employees from coast-to-coast and 24 office and production facilities across Canada. Title: Business Analyst, Physical Branch Network - Canadian Banking Fall Internship
Description:
Requisition ID: 157718  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Business Analyst, Physical Branch Network
 Fall 2022 (September – December)

 Why work for Scotiabank? 
Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. We are powered by our 90,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. 
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy.
 
Who we are:
 OMNI Channel Development focuses on the best distribution and utilization for our physical branch network and Resources. This includes understanding the intricacies and needs of all markets across Canada. Best distributing our branch network to supply and support our customers in these markets. Creating and deploying best in class tools and processes for our branch staff to succeed in these markets.

 You will:
 Contribute to the overall success of Scotiabank’s branch retail network by creating robust strategies powered by analytical modelling and business intelligence initiatives. Supporting the gathering of the necessary data; both internal and external and the development of optimization and opportunity models required for setting regional and national strategies.
 Accountabilities:

 Gather business and data requirements to clearly outline business problems, opportunities and solutions. 
Follow analytical frameworks: hypothesis development, collecting, preparing, and combining the data from multiple data sources, analyzing data, validation, drawing conclusions, assessing risks and developing actionable recommendations for the organization.
 Leverage SQL, Python and data visualization software (Power BI) to develop analytical models that support strategic initiatives and improve business processes for the OMNI Channel team.


 Create insightful dashboards and reports with well thought out visualizations that summarize the decisions that need to be taken. To be utilized by branch and district managers across the country to improve branch performance.


 Build tools and analysis to evaluate national and local markets, customer and competitor landscapes, and retail banking trends. Perform benchmark analysis against the 5-year strategy along with recommendations for improvements in optimization models, forecasting and opportunity analysis.


 Perform analysis that identifies opportunities to optimize the Bank’s current physical footprint and staffing as well as developing opportunity models for future placement of branch service and sales staff. 


Assist in the development and monitoring of the national hours strategy, and model how branch hours should be structured to have competitive offerings against our peers. 
Build and present strong data driven business cases to drive strategies for Scotiabank’s branch retail network


 Skills & Qualifications:

 Be able to clearly identify and articulate key insights and recommendations. 
Strong knowledge of analytical tools and languages, specifically in SQL and Python
 Working knowledge with Power BI
 Be able to work in a fast-paced environment with cross functional teams. 
Advanced knowledge of MS Office suite.


 How do I apply?
 Please complete all three steps below:

 Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.
 Complete a short one-way video interview here.
 Apply to the role and when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile.

 We thank you all for your interest in Scotiabank! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.

To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all three steps above.


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
MTD PRODUCTS LIMITEDPOSITION DESCRIPTIONJob Title:  SUPPLY CHAIN ANALYSTDepartment:  DEMANDReports To:  DEMAND MANAGERSUMMARYResponsible to plan the forecast requirements of whole goods to support our customer demands. The analyst works extensively with the forecasting system to improve service levels and maintain inventory efficiencies.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Use historical and sales assumption information to establish and maintain system generated forecasts by item in our JDA Demand Forecasting software system.


Analyze demand patterns and changes to maintain deliverables and inventory measurable.


Make adjustments to stock levels based on customer demands.


Coordinate with the Demand Manager in the development and maintenance of monthly/annual reporting to support Global Corporate Demand and Supply measurement guidelines.


Assist in resolving any warehouse/logistics related issues and concerns.


Recommend process improvements to prevent out of stock and excess inventory situations.


Schedule/Co-ordinate monthly meetings to review demand and inventory levels.


Work with the sales and marketing team to identify sales opportunities and forecast.


Interface with Sales and Customer Service Department to support Retail customer Forecast Management and information requirements. Manage and actively plan to Seasonal Forecast timelines to ensure deadlines are adhered to.


Assist with department reporting and continuous improvement of processes and operational efficiencies.


Support development and analysis of KPI reporting alongside our operational departments to support improved operational results and efficiencies.


Perform new item set up in appropriate systems


Fully analyze the life cycle of parts in conjunction with whole goods. Develop and execute a plan to decrease parts inventory to align with ending life cycle of whole goods.

Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONSN/AOTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIESComputer skills – basics in Windows, Outlook, MS Office. Detail oriented. Communication Skills (CSR).OTHER QUALIFICATIONSN/APHYSICAL DEMANDSThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Title: Business Analyst
Description:
At Breadstack.io, we have developed a data-driven suite of tools designed to help supercharge your business. Deliver personalized, omnichannel experiences that your customers expect, the smart way. Not just for eCommerce but for all commerce!
We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will work closely with the product, marketing, customer success, customer support, and sales to identify growth opportunities and implement solutions. Your main focus includes conducting detailed analysis and evaluating business processes from end to end. You will also be the link between the business and other departments/teams to lead, collect and analyze data and transform the business needs into documented processes and provide strategic solutions to deliver efficient results.
Key Responsibilities: 

Perform thorough business analysis, recognize areas for improvement, develop a plan and implement action plans

Title: Sr Analyst Data Management
Description:
At Rogers, the entrepreneurial spirit is part of our DNA. Our Rogers Business teams help foster and grow the Canadian economy by supporting businesses of all sizes. From small to large-scale enterprises, our teams help deliver innovative technology, network services, and a suite of solutions to help them succeed. We offer Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network for our customers and are proud leaders in wireless private networking and IoT! We continuously expand and evolve our networks, invest in new technology capabilities, and invest in our people to serve our business customers and their communities.
  Come play a key role in driving the future of business innovation in Canada. We are looking for team members with a passion for delivering industry-leading value to customers and supporting businesses in the communities where we live and work.
  Are you up for the challenge? If so, consider the following opportunity:

 This position will report to the Sr. Manager, Data Transformation. Working with the Sr. Manager and cross-functional teams, the Sr. Analyst will be responsible for the development and support of a variety of initiatives meant to enable the Rogers for Business analytical and reporting needs. Current initiatives include the development of a consolidated billing view of the customer as well as building penetration metrics. The successful candidate must have an unwavering attention to detail, an insatiable desire to find answers, tolerance for data ambiguity, and a proven track record of working with large, complex datasets. The Sr. Analyst must also have an in-depth understanding of key wireless and wireline metric information.

 What you will do:

 Support Rogers for Business analytical development priorities, acting as a liaison between the team and various cross-functional teams
 Maintain and update a 360-degree-customer-revenue view
 Develop and maintain building-penetration metrics
 Analyze stakeholder requirements and find actionable, value-added solutions to drive revenue growth, improve operational efficiency and reduce costs
 Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in large, complex datasets
 Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and create datasets as necessary
 Filter, clean and transform data into information, insight, and actionable business decisions
 Develop and manage proof of concepts (POCs) that illustrate and test solutions
 Track project progress and communicate results with stakeholders
 Perform ad-hoc analysis and provide recommendations and insight

 What you will bring:

 Post-secondary education in Mathematics, Statistics, Information Management, Computer Science or other related disciplines
 Highly refined analytical, and programming skills
 Familiarity with querying Rogers wireless and wireline datasets; e.g., V21 and SGI
 Must have proficiency in SQL and experience working with Oracle, SAS, and Microsoft PowerBI
 Experience with Microsoft Azure and Databricks is also an asset
 Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings
 5-Years telecommunications industry experience
 Excellent written and oral communication
 Solid relationship-building and influencing skills, with a proven ability to work within a team
 Self-starter with proven organizational skills, and the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks and deadlines
 Strong sense of ownership, drive, and desire


 As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
 Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.

 Schedule: Full time Shift: Day Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position) Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (200), Toronto, ON Travel Requirements: Up to 10% Posting Category/Function: Reporting and Analytics & Analyst Requisition ID: 273233  Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

 Our people are at the heart of our success
 Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
 We do what’s right, each and every day
 We believe in the power of new ideas
 We work as one team, with one vision
 We give back to our communities and protect our environment


 What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. At Rogers, we value the insights and innovation that diverse teams bring to work. We work with our candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. Please reach out to our recruiters and hiring managers to begin a conversation about how we can ensure that you deliver your best work. You matter to us! For any questions, please visit the Rogers FAQ.  Posting Notes: Digital & Technology
