Title: WORK COORDINATOR ANALYST
Description:
WORK COORDINATOR ANALYST
 Winnipeg, MB
 Manitoba Hydro is consistently recognized as one of Manitoba's Top Employers!
 Manitoba Hydro is a leader among energy companies in North America, recognized for providing highly reliable service and exceptional customer satisfaction. Join our team of Manitoba's best as we continue to build a company that supports innovation, commitment and customer service.
 Under the general direction of the Work Coordination/Dispatch Supervisor, the Business System Analyst performs activities related to analytical support and reporting of the work program performance, resource utilization and work completion for Operations Support Services' customers. You will liaise closely with business users and provide specialized support to them with complex data analysis, statistical reporting, workload planning and system problem resolution.
 Responsibilities:

Responsible for providing moderately complex database interrogation/ad-hoc query support using data retrieval tools
 available. Provide database support and acts as a point of contact for ad-hoc information requests, retrieved from the MWM,
    Banner, SAP or related system's databases and related to Operations. 
   
Responsible for building queries as needed to retrieve data or troubleshoot.
Analyzes the effectiveness of Customer Service Operations work activities by developing reporting processes that clearly

 depict work performance, volumes and quality. Develops and analyzes measurable indicators of performance to achieve effective and efficient Customer Service operations.

Estimates the impact on Customer Service Operations resulting from Government mandated work program changes,
 franchise expansions or procedural changes by analyzing work requirements. 
   
Collects and analyzes data on customer and company work programs to support operational decisions that improve value to
 customers. 
   
Provides moderately complex data analysis and reporting to support the Company with respect to general information
 requests, rate applications, strategic business plans and benchmarking studies. 
   
Responsible for the creation, maintenance and reporting of a detailed workplan for Customer Service Operations and Facility
 Locate and Services. 
   
Works cross-functionally to explore opportunities to achieve the most effective use of resources for Customer Service
 Operations with respect to the yearly workplan. 
   
Works with Shift Coordinator to make recommendations for allocation of shifts/work locations for annual shift bid.
Provides information to external auditors with respect to specific work programs.
Provides input into the development of the Work Coordination team's analytical skills. 
Liaise with IT developers and perform IT testing as required.
Participates on or may lead special projects or teams such as computer system enhancements, process improvement

 initiatives, business planning and benchmarking studies.
 Qualifications:

A four year Bachelor degree in a related discipline such as Commerce, Economics or Computer Science from a University of
 recognized standing with two years of directly related experience; 
   
OR
A two year diploma in a related discipline such as Business Administration, Business Analyst or Information Systems


     Technology from an institute of recognized standing with four years' directly related experience;
    

OR
Grade 12 and a Business Systems Analyst certificate and six years' directly related experience.
Advanced knowledge of database concepts and data query/retrieval tools and the ability to complete complex queries



     including successfully completing a SQL- Structured Query Language course from an institute of recognized standing.
    

Thorough operating knowledge of Computer-Aided Dispatch Systems, Banner Customer Information System, Power BI, SAP



     and related systems.
    

Advanced knowledge of PC based tools, with demonstrated excellence in the use of spreadsheet numerical analysis and


 MANITOBA HYDRO IS COMMITTED TO DIVERSITY AND EMPLOYMENT EQUITY




 Reference Code: CO56592703-01

     charting.
    

Must possess strong oral and written communication skills. This includes report writing and making presentations to a group.
Must possess strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to readily understand, document and propose improvements to operational business processes and issues.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks.
Proven ability to work cooperatively with internal and external customers, in a safe, courteous and responsible manner.


 Great Benefits

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Defined-benefit pension plan.
Nine-day work cycle which normally results in every other Monday off, providing for a balanced approach to work, family life

 and community.
 Salary Range
 Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. The range for the classification is $32.63-$45.14 Hourly, $62,518.04-$86,505.64 Annually.
 Apply Now!
 Visit www.hydro.mb.ca/careers to learn more about this position and to apply online. The deadline for applications is JULY 26, 2022.
 We thank you for your interest and will contact you if you are selected for an interview.
 This document is available in accessible formats upon request. Please let us know if you require any accommodations during the recruitment process.

Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Who is BGRS? 

 At BGRS, we move the people that move the world, enabling opportunities by connecting people and places. 

 We relocate people across the globe, supporting and guiding their journey by administering benefits on behalf of our clients. Synchronized with our clients for success, we transform mobility programs into a means of recruitment, development, and retention of talent. Our client partners include some of the largest global organizations, as well as mid-tier growth companies and government agencies. As a leading company in global talent mobility, we are committed to fostering an engaging, flexible, and inclusive environment that encourages growth and collaboration. We look forward to welcoming you to our team where you can experience what partnership and talent mobility can achieve. 

 Role Overview 

 As a Senior Business Analyst, Business Intelligence, you will contribute to BGRS' success by being responsible for capturing requirements, developing data mapping, extending data models and designing ETL mappings for the purpose of creating usable and accessible data sources for reporting and analysis. The Role will also be required to contribute to the training and usage of the BGRS BI data sources and technologies. 

 **In response to the COVID-19 pandemic all interviews are being conducted virtually. 

 If selected for an in-office position, you will work remotely while BGRS operates under mandatory telework. 

 What You'll Be Doing 



Elicit data requirements for Business Intelligence projects, maintenance and enhancement requests
Document specifications for ETL, physical and logical data model changes
Ability to use TSQL to investigate and reverse engineer 3rd party databases for ETL and reporting purposes
Work with developers and testers in ensuring final solution meets requirement objectives
Maintain an “advanced user” level of skill set on the key Analysis and Reporting BI technologies
Participate in the creation and maintenance of end user documentation and information on the Business Intelligence data sources and technologies
Provide Training and support on Business Intelligence data sources and technologies as required
Support the development, maintenance and the enforcement of BGRS BI best practices
Maintain a working understanding of major business processes and supporting technologies for all BGRS lines of business
Work collaboratively among all Delivery team members ensuring knowledge and expertise is shared across individuals and teams for improved work performance
 What You Bring to BGRS 



Bachelor's degree or equivalent related work experience
5+ Years combined experience in Business or Systems Analysis in a reporting and analysis environment
Strong and demonstrable experience with TSQL and Microsoft SQL Server
Experience designing Microsoft PowerPivot, Microsoft Analysis Services Tabular or Multidimensional data models
Working knowledge of DAX or MDX query functions and Languages
Experience using Microsoft Excel 2013 PowerPivot, PowerQuery and PowerView technologies
Experience building logical and Physical data models with tools such as Microsoft Visio or Toad
Experience working in a distributed and international team environment
Experience working with Business Objects Web and Universe design a benefit
Must have good presentation, written and verbal communication skills
Display high degree of confidence and ability to work in ambiguous situations
Strong work ethic and a desire to drive to successful solution delivery
You foster belonging and encourage authenticity. You are inclusive, value diversity, and recognize that these behaviors empower and inspire positive action and promote innovation
 What BGRS Offers 



Competitive salary and incentive plans
Workplace flexibility for a balanced work/life approach
Comprehensive benefits packages and wellness program
Generous company-paid vacation days and holiday time
Challenging, collaborative, diverse corporate culture
Ongoing opportunities for learning and career development
 Follow BGRS 

 Equal Employment Statement 

 BGRS's global workforce welcomes and encourages growth, innovation, and sharing of perspectives and ideas. We value diversity in the workplace and are an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. To learn about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at BGRS, please visit our website. We thank all candidates who apply, however, only those selected for a personal interview will be contacted. If you require accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs. 

 Les effectifs de BGRS à l'échelle mondiale apprécient et encouragent la croissance, l'innovation et le partage des perspectives et des idées. BGRS accorde une grande importance à la diversité dans le milieu de travail et est un employeur adhérant aux principes d'égalité. Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement accessible et inclusif. Nous remercions toutes les personnes qui posent leur candidature. Cependant, nous communiquerons uniquement avec les candidats retenus pour une entrevue individuelle. N'hésitez pas à communiquer avec nous si vous avez besoin d'un accommodement pendant le processus de recrutement. Nous travaillerons avec vous afin de répondre à vos besoins.

Title: HRIS and People Data Analyst
Description:
Purpose
 The HRIS and People Data Analyst reports into the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics.
 The incumbent in this role will work closely with the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics to understand all current HR business processes and provide recommendations that will contribute to creating more efficiencies using HRIS system.
 This position is responsible for the implementation, support, and maintenance of the organization’s human resources information systems (HRIS) and data and is responsible for providing technical advisory services, guidance, and recommendations to management regarding system requirements based on company resources and needs.
 As a change agent champion, the HRIS and People Data Analyst plays a key role in driving continuous improvement initiatives and adapts to the changing needs of the organization. In this evolving role, the incumbent will support the ongoing maintenance of the system by understanding UltiPro new releases and/or managing business requirements that impact key modules. Effectively ensure communication to users and stakeholders impacted by deployment of changes and enhancements.
 The HRIS Analyst believes in our Vision, is empowered and is a key contributor in bringing the People Analytics plan to life; and as a personal leader, creates clarity and gains commitment from the team for the shared Vision, Purpose, and Values.
 Key Areas of Accountability
 HR Systems – Implementation, Maintenance and Hyper care Support:

Acts as the subject matter expert for all human resource information systems and troubleshoots and works with third parties to resolve and adjust design of systems for effective use.
Provides support on leading technical initiatives and projects including, but not limited to, gathering requirements, planning, design, implementation, and training end users.
Provides end-user troubleshooting, issue remediation, technology request assistance and escalation management. Monitors reoccurring issues, system/data or process gaps and proactively identifies potential sources of increased efficiency and enhancements.
Recommends changes and improvements to existing processes and reports and gathers data as necessary. Identifies and makes recommendations for new or improving current systems and processes with considerations for improved efficiency, effectiveness, financial implication, quality, and scalability.
Supports configuration of business processes; ensuring appropriate security is applied within role limits.
Ensures accuracy and integrity of People data through regular review of the HRIS data, workflow, and practices in collaboration with the P&C team, IT, and system users.
Ensures employee information captured is compliant with any legislation related to employee data.
Motivated to take initiative to identify and anticipate department’s needs and make recommendations for implementation. Applies HR functional knowledge in optimizing HR information systems support.
Responsible for the review, testing and implementation of HR information system upgrades or patches.
Participates in development of HR objectives and systems, including metrics, queries, and standard reports for ongoing company requirement.
Designs, implements, and manages new and supplemental processes and tools for performance management and talent development programs.
Conducts User Acceptance testing for any updates and new features to the systems.
Develops and maintains training documentation on business processes & HR systems. Maintains issues and risks log, communicates status, and escalates concerns to the Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics.

 Client Group Support and User Adoption:

Builds strong business stakeholder relationships across the organization and externally to collaborate, gather feedback and build system solutions that align with operational needs.
Offers continuous HRIS training to the P&C Team and to the organization, develops end user documentation, and provides support and training for all system changes and/or developments, when required.
Supports the improvement of the overall user adoption of the HRIS system for both team members and managers by developing content designed to improve user experience via trainings, tips, hands-on support, and other methods.
In collaboration with the Senior Talent Development Specialist, provides technical support and instruction to client group users of the LMS to navigate, build, and manage effective learning systems for online learning for employee teams.
Provides necessary system support to the Talent Acquisition, Total Rewards and Payroll teams.
Develops business communications, both written and verbal, to support change management initiatives in new HRIS functionality to improve client group experience and increase user adoption rates.

 Data and Analytics:

Applies knowledge of HR information systems and data in extracting and analyzing current, historical, and forecasted data to support strategic workforce planning.
Provides scheduled and ad hoc reporting and analysis to P&C team members and other external client groups. Performs complex data manipulation and aggregation of data from multiple data sources with high degree of accuracy.
Supports the development and maintenance of reporting practices to bring standardization and consistency to HR metrics and reporting requirement associated with People and Culture – dashboards, turnover, headcount, recruitment metrics, etc.
Maintains awareness of current trends in HR information systems with a focus on product and service development, delivery, and support, and applying key technologies. Works in partnership with Director, Total Rewards and People Analytics to socialize insights and trends for business stakeholders.
Partners with the People and Culture Business Partners to support the company and its client groups in the effort to attract, engage, and retain top talent by ensuring data and analytics support business decisions.

 Qualifications
 Education, Certification, Licenses

Undergraduate Degree with a focus on Information Management, Business Administration, Human Resources and/or supplemented with course work in analytics (is an asset)
CPHR designation; considered an asset
HR/People Analytics certification; considered an asset

 Experience

3 – 5 years’ related HR work experience and knowledge of HR policies, practices, and procedures
2 – 3 years’ experience using HRIS and Payroll software/s

 Skills

Advanced proficiency with systems and software including MS Office, HRIS (UKG, Workforce Now/ADP, Dayforce/Ceridian, etc.), Payroll, Adobe, and MS SharePoint
Strong aptitude and precision in working with data
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong business writing and presentation skills

 Attributes

Ability to work well under pressure with multiple projects and timelines
Ability to influence stakeholders at various levels
Warm, charismatic, energetic demeanor
Practices high discretion and excellent judgement, decision making, and diplomacy
Builds credibility, respect, and trust with co-workers and customers
A true partner with P&C colleagues and customers in the business
Effectively works with and advises people of all positions and levels within the company
Ability to adapt to changing priorities and maintains composure in stressful situations
Open and responsive to feedback and seeking growth

 Work Environment

Vancouver-based, hybrid role
Will be required to travel intermittently to other company locations for system implementation and/or training of team members. Travel will fluctuate depending on business requirements

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. Learn more at https://e.inc/

 Role Summary:
 E INC is seeking Principle/Lead Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to build and manage BI reporting. The role will be a senior member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team and will work with stakeholders from various sides of the business to understand data models, pull data and perform analyses to drive business decision making. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and other helpful information and at times, be prepared to present findings and discuss trends and insights. Review and improve data and analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency and accuracy. The candidate will also be an active contributor to the Data & Analytics team policy committee to establish and implement standards across the company.

 What You Will Do:

Solve data questions requiring advanced transforms, custom queries, statistical analysis, or other related tasks outside the realm of possibility for a self-service tool. 
Create ad hoc scripts to extract meaning from the underlying data and answer relevant business questions. 
Convey results that speak to the requester’s core business questions and provide key insights and relevant action items. 
Clearly communicate nuanced and complex analytical concepts, often translating meaning to impact on the business. 
Sustain a comprehensive knowledge of analytics tools (such as Power BI, SQL, JupyterLab, Tableau, statistical languages/packages, or other tools to easily analyze and visualize data) and apply knowledge to help build out more dynamic, automated, and easy to consume reporting for key stakeholders. 
Build reporting dashboards from start to finish, including identification of strategic key performance indicators (KPIs), queries to obtain the data, visualizations, and dashboard maintenance. 
Educate team members on data literacy to promote proper and relevant usage of dashboards and reporting while also maintaining a general understanding of team and project priorities. 
Collaborate with internal partners to identify and understand key data sources for analytics. 
Strong communication skills to translate reports into insights and be able to present to senior business leaders



 What You Will Need:

MBA or Master’s degree in field related to statistics, data analytics, programming, Information Systems, Data Science or Computer Science. 
10-12+ years of experience in the following: 
   
Advanced and experienced in SQL and SQL Server. 
Advanced and experienced in building complex dashboards for variety of audiences with advanced BI tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics or PowerBI. 
Strong knowledge and working experience of building Data Structures in Amazon Web Services (AWS) 
Experience utilizing databases and warehouses for analysis. 
Experience with infrastructure tools (e.g., Transactional Systems knowledge, data repositories, data catalogues) 
Experience with data management tools (e.g., integrations – structured/rectangular and non-structured data/excel, external, APIs) 
Programming background, specifically in statistical languages and packages such as Python. 
Experience with forecasting, statistical analysis, predictive algorithms, clustering, and segmentation.

Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and interfacing with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations). 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.



 E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:

Competitive pay
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k/RSP with Match
Company paid Group Life/AD&D insurance
Paid time off
Flexible working environment
Continuous Learning
And an amazing culture to top it all off!



 E INC is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation.

Title: Product Content Analyst
Description:
The Product Content Analyst plays a pivotal role in research, data analysis & data entry and execution of new travel suppliers for sale wherever the Porter package product is displayed. This individual should possess strong product knowledge and understand the systems (TTS and dynamic connectivity, API) that Porter package product utilizes to leverage product positioning on the website to maximize conversion. The ability to create relationships with vendors, suppliers is an asset. Highly analytical and attentive to detail are key skill sets required for the data entry responsibilities of this role. Organized and able to multi-task, escalating any roadblocks or issues. The role takes on the task of product review and implementation, support and enhancement while following TICO regulation guidelines. This individual will need to be fully proficient in all product operations functions for dynamic property connections and static contracts using the systems and platform where the Porter package product is housed.


 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:


Plan the integration and operational support of new suppliers alongside the Director of Porter package product
Ensure all product components and pricing are fed through the Application Program Interface API from the businses partners
Verification of the accuracy in costs, sale prices, promotions, inventory, system coding, commission structure(s), supplier information, and all other pertinent data and/or changes for the effective sale of all product
Creation of the web pages linked to each product in RCM. (dashboard to display static content and images)
Review inventory levels and communicate with suppliers where additional inventory is needed
Ongoing competitive analysis to ensure we are maximizing conversion
Follow up with suppliers on extended releases, product updates, and contract extensions to ensure all product data is available, up to date and accurate on TTS and the website
Review tableau reports to ensure accuracy and use reports for measurement of number of properties connected, forecasting and noting booking trends and pace to suggest any modification that will increase conversion and improve customer experience
Responsible for assisting other team members with the day to day product testing in order to keep skills sharp and able to resolve loading issues quickly
Build hotel shells in TTS
Troubleshoot issues related to connectivity and all suppliers as it pertains to pricing
Actively participate in Porter's Safety Management System (SMS) including, reporting hazards and incidents encountered in daily opertations; understand, comply and promote the Company's safety policy.


BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES:

Concern for Safety: Identifying hazardous or potentially hazardous situations and taking appropriate action to maintain a safe environment for self and others
Teamwork: Working collaboratively with others to achieve organizational goals
Passenger/Customer Service: Providing service excellence to internal and/or external customers (passengers)
Initiative: Dealing with situations and issues proactively and persistently, seizing opportunities that arise
Results Focus: Focusing efforts on achieving high quality results consistent with the organization’s standards
Fostering Communication: Listening and communicating openly, honestly, and respectfully with different audiences, promoting dialogue and building consensus



QUALIFICATIONS:

University Graduate 
Bilingual English/French and asset 
Experience in an analytical role
Excellent computer skills
Must have the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks concurrently in a fast paced environment
Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination

Title: Business Customer Centre Analyst
Description:
45078 - Toronto - Regular -
Safety Comes First is a core value at Hydro One, and we remain committed to taking every reasonable precaution to ensure a respectful, safe and healthy working environment. Further to this commitment, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health of our employees from the hazard of COVID-19. New employees will be required to declare their vaccination status to Hydro One. Employees who do not provide proof of vaccination status may not enter any 3rd party locations that require full vaccination (e.g. customer properties).
Hydro One is proud to be the largest electricity transmission and distribution provider in Ontario, serving nearly 1.5 million customers. We have a long history in the industry with our roots dating back over 110 years to 1906. Since then, we have worked to grow and evolve to meet the changing needs of our customers and communities across Ontario. Today, we’re focused on providing exceptional customer service and ensuring we are building safe communities where we live, work and play. 
It’s an exciting time to join the team at Hydro One! 
*NOTE* Hydro One introduced a Hybrid Work Pilot Project in 2022 for most office-based roles. Employees work in-office/on-site two days a week and remotely from home for three days a week. Hydro One is adding refreshed workspaces and technology to support these changes. Join us as we ‘trial & learn’ a new modern way of working and be a key driver of future state!
In office but with intention – a time for team and trust building, collaboration, and socialization. Please reach out to us to learn more!
 General Accountabilities:

Support Business Customer Centre (BCC) functions regarding Commercial & Industrial customers and generators.
Understand how customers are set up for billing and payment.
Understand how a customer's facility/meter data relationships are maintained in the meter data management system and customer information system (CIS).
Respond to customer enquiries regarding contract process, field service requests, billing, rates and payment matters and other Hydro One initiatives and customer requests to modify existing accounts and services.
Provide analytical support to Commercial & Industrial Customers, other Hydro One Lines of Businesses, or BCC Supervisor, as required. 

Responsibilities include:

Respond to phone calls or e-mails from customers who have questions regarding their billing, payment or service.
Work with the Settlements team, and other Lines of Business, to obtain details as required
Proactively contact customers by phone or e-mail, as required for various programs, issues or initiatives.
Understand regulatory compliance requirements of OEB Distribution System Code, Retail Settlement Code, IESO Market Rules and Program Rules.
Assist in the development and implement business processes and procedures required to ensure the integrity of BCC functions
Maintain customer account/meter data relationship in CIS and coordinate with other teams as required to update information.
Respond to customer enquiries regarding billing issues, service and account changes, and other Hydro One initiatives.
Contact end-use customers and generators regarding billing and payment issues.
Forward issues of concern to senior staff.
Perform audits to ensure billing parameters such as (rate class, total loss application including transformer loss allowance/adjustments and transformer ownership), have been correctly applied and reflected inthe subsequent bill to the customer. Forward discrepancies identified to senior staff.
Exchange information with outside organizations such as IESO, 3rd party MSP, service providers as directed.
Some travel may be required (support for offsite presentationsand/or customer visits)
Presentations to other Lines of Business, or customers, to describe our role, rates and regulations
Perform other duties as required. 

Selection Criteria and Essential Competencies

Knowledge of engineering principles, economics, and business adminstration.
Ability to translate complex electiricity consumption profile regulatory requirements, and billling calculations into readily understood communications for C&I customers.
Knowledge of relevant sections of OEB Codes, IESO Market Rules and Program Rules.
Knowledge of Hydro One's Conditions of Service.
Knowledge of wholesale market and retail market billing and settlements
Knowledge of metering, billing and settlement processes.
Knowledge of load analysis, billing, settlements and customer service.
Computer programming and data management skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Customer service and account management skills plus experience in the use of CIS.
Four-year university education, or equivalent, in an appropriate field.
Experience in using software such as MS Office, Access, Visio.
Experience in load data management systems such as IEE & CIS.
Excellent communication and writing skills.
A minimum of two-four years related experience.



At Hydro One we understand that the success and strength of our business rests with our people. When we develop their skills, we are investing in both their success and ours. To secure the best talent, we seek to create a workforce that reflects the diverse populations of the communities where we live and work and to create a culture based on safety, innovation and inclusiveness.


We are honoured to be recognized by Forbes in its list of Canada’s Best Employers for 2021.


Thank you for considering a career with Hydro One, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates. If you are having difficulty using our online application system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email careers@hydroone.com. Hydro One will provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in the job application process.


Please note this email is only for accommodation requests. Resumes sent to this email address will not be considered.


Deadline: August 1, 2022


In the event you are experiencing difficulties applying to this job please consult our help page here.

 Job Segment: Compliance, Data Management, Facilities, Law, Engineer, Legal, Data, Operations, Engineering

Title: Business Insights Analyst
Description:
TD Description

Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
 Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.



Department Overview

The UGO Analytics team is responsible for supporting the UGO business with accurate, customer focused, actionable insights and augmenting our mobile analytics and communications capabilities. The Business Insights Analyst will be considered a data analytics expert and will work closely with the Manager of Analytics to solve complex business problems, developing analytical solutions, produce actionable data for the business, and developing solutions powered by technology to build scalability in our business.



Job Description

About this Role As an expert in data and analytics, you will provide in depth expertise, analytical interpretation, key insights and action items to your multi-functional business partners across the organization. Those insights will be brought to bear to enable informed and enabled business decisions enterprise wide or help to solve the increasingly complex business problems they face.
 In this role, you will join TD's industry-leading digital accelerator team – UGO Mobile Solutions. UGO is an industry leader in the distribution of digital gift cards and a fast-growing start-up owned by TD that has its own innovative products and acts as an incubator and accelerator for new experiences. Leverage your domain of expertise within data analytics, technical prowess, and drive to exceed expectations to deliver business results.   If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.

 As a Business Insights Analyst, you will:

 Translate the wealth of data from various sources into scalable and actionable reports/dashboards for key business stakeholders
 Produce insights and recommend business actions to align with strategy, solve business problems, and identify areas of business opportunities
 Provide data requirements for existing and upcoming mobile and web applications 
Act as a bridge to translate business requirements to analytics and reporting needs for a given domain
 Build data pipelines to enable consistent, reliable reporting across campaigns/projects and create clear documentation for new processes
 Support marketing campaigns with customer targeting, communications, and analysis
 Support business operations where it relates to handling data, such as forecasting and managing inventory
 Execute on data requests accurately and within a timely manner
 Represent functional area as an analytics & insights professional and key resource; build positive and productive working partnerships
 Oversee and/or independently perform tasks from end to end




Job Requirements

What can you bring to TD? 

Undergraduate degree or technical certificate in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or other analytical based discipline
 Three (3) or more years relevant experience in analytics and reporting
 Proficient in Python and SQL 
Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
 User behavioural tools such as Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics for web and mobile app analytics an asset
 Experience creating visualizations and dashboards (e.g. Tableau) an asset
 Ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationships across teams and functions




Additional Information

At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Operations Analyst
Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
 


   Job Description
 


   SS&C Technologies Holdings, Inc. is a global provider of financial services software and software-enabled services. Founded in 1986, SS&C has built the most comprehensive powerhouse of software technology in the financial services industry – technology that complements our unrivaled expertise and professionalism in fund administration, insurance and pension funds, and asset and wealth management accounting and operations. Named by Forbes as one of America’s best midsize employers, SS&C has more than 20,000 employees and 15,000 clients worldwide, and is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut, with offices throughout North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa, and Australia.
 


   We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Operations Analyst to join the SS&C Algorithmics team. SS&C Algorithmics has more than 200 Clients globally; operates in 25 countries and has a team of people who design, develop, sell and support risk analytics solutions for financial institutions. SS&C Algorithmics is headquartered in Toronto, Ontario. Candidates must be in commuting distance to the office and be willing to work in the office at least 2-3 days a week.
 


   Primary Responsibilities:
 

   Provide support to the a global team of senior managers:
 

 Provide support for Algo Sales & Marketing events and communications
 Maintain accurate Client contact lists for both active clients and organizational stakeholders in the Client
 Support the attendance of clients at sponsored events by preparing materials; engaging in out reach activities
 Support events to assist in logistics both prior and during
 Provide support for general business operations, reporting and data analytics as it relates to Finance, HR, IT and Facilities
 Support the Client Success team in the development of testimonials, reference checks, out reach for surveys, client appreciation activities
 Support the creation of corporate presentations – for All Hands/TownHalls, special presentations to clients, staff or other audiences
 Support the GM in presentation planning and materials, scheduling, travel arrangements and client outreach



   Desired Qualifications:
 

 Exceptional attention to detail
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills
 Strong technical skills and proficient with Microsoft Tools (Office, Outlook, Teams)
 Strong problem-solving skills and tactical management skills
 Excellent organization and planning skills
 Has a customer focused mindset
 Ability to learn quickly and be agile - pivot on priorities where required and perform well under pressure and re-prioritize tasks as needed
 Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion
 Minimum 3 years of experience supporting senior management/executive-level staff
 Minimum 3 years of experience working in a management support function either in Finance, Human Resources, Sales or Services Operations
 Experience supporting a global team highly preferred



   Education:
 

   University Degree in Bachelor of Arts or Business Administration
 


   Why SS&C?
 


   Working at SS&C is balanced and fair – especially in challenging times. We offer flexible work schedules, time off, and so much more to keep you healthy, safe, and productive. SS&C offers:
 


 Hybrid Schedule featuring 4-6 days in the office monthly combined with working from home
 Competitive base salary plus EXCELLENT benefits (including medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD and more)!
 RRSP Matching Program
 Global Flexible Time Off Policy (personal/vacation time)
 Sick Leave Policy
 Eligible for an annual performance-based bonus program
 Tuition Reimbursement up to 70% and Professional Development up to 100%
 Candidate Referral Program
 Business Casual dress code (includes jeans)



   SS&C Technologies Canada Corp. fosters a positive, equitable and progressive workforce and is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. We will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process. If you require any accommodation during the application and hiring process, please contact: tacanada@sscinc.com
 


   To further explore this opportunity, please apply through our careers page on the corporate website at 
  
   www.ssctech.com/careers
  .No phone calls or email applications please. We thank all candidates for their interest, but only those under consideration will be contacted.
 

   #LI-LM1
 


   Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, dental, 401k plan, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.

Title: Business Operations Coordinator/Analyst
Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Position Description:

   BUSINESS ANALYST
   


The successful candidate has experience working directly with business stakeholders and is able to pull together technical experts from various teams. The professional we seek is a qualified Business Analyst and is a self-starter who works effectively with minimal supervision in a highly dynamic environment. 
The ideal candidate must be people-oriented with excellent analytical and communication skills. The candidate must have demonstrated ability to impact and influence business decisions and successfully work with cross-functional teams. 
Job duties / accountabilities: 
   


Facilitating workshop with key technology stakeholders to capture user stories.
Solicit and interpret conceptual business needs and document requirements collecting data from multiple sources 
Translate business requirements into system requirements and conceptual design to produce thorough assessments and solution recommendations 
Understand technical designs and specifications and comply to architecture models (use cases, conceptual, logical, interfaces). 
Identify, evaluate and document operational changes to improve information and processing systems. 
Identify and quantify risks relevant to business and systems requirements. 
Maintain productive professional relationships 
Resolve conflicts between differing requirements presented by business versus IT 
Develop and/or execute test plans and test cases including defining test conditions, negative testing and regression testing, tracking and documenting result 
Experience and Educational Requirements:
    5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst supporting IT systems
   

Awareness of Telecom, Wireless and Media industries
Experience working in an Agile environment and use of Agile tools (such as Jira, Slack, Confluence or similar)
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new business and technical concepts in a fast paced service focused environment 
Demonstrated ability to meet delivery timelines, learn quickly, problem solve and be organized
Ability to maintain a balance of confidence and approachability
Excel at customer service and communication skills. Must be comfortable interacting with clients and internal staff.
Proactive, highly motivated, with the ability to work well independently and within a multi-cultural team environment 
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to handle several tasks efficiently 
Ability to cope under pressure, and deliver output of highest quality
Office tool proficiency (MS Office, IE/Firefox, etc.) 
Ability to search out technical information when it is not readily available 




Skills:

Business Analysis
 Business Process Analysis
 Client Management
 Financial Management
 Project Management



What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on  While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.   When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.   Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI — where your ideas and actions make a difference.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Robert Half is currently seeking a Data Analyst! Our client is located in Mississauga and is one of the largest organizations in the retail food industry. The Data Analyst will be working hand in hand with the HR team. Please see all details below. 

 Remote? No, Hybrid - in office 2 days/week 

Start date: Immediate 

Hours: Mon-Fri 9am - 5pm 

 Key Responsibilities & Skills 

 Ability to understand the Business ask and translate into Data deliverable 
Ability to analyse data 
Ability to create the Reports independently as per the Business ask 
Ability to explain the findings and provide insights based on the data 
Partner closely with the HR Ops and Analytics team to define key metrics, scorecards and measures, and dashboards to support talent programs 
Ensure the right data sets are in place to manage and monitor. Work with HR solutions team to operationalize. 
Provide analysis on the complete cycle of talent analytics and the interrelationships between different talent information and processes. 
Identify statistical analysis techniques required to deliver HR insights. 
Evaluate the effectiveness of talent investments and programs based on analysis. 
Partner closely with HR Solutions team to create sustainable reports to drive decision making. 


Requirements:
 Data visualization (Tableau knowledge preferred) 
SQL knowledge 
HR data or People Analytics experience preferred 
Data Analytics experience 
Presenting to stakeholders/clients 
Required to compile large data, data cleansing/purge data 
Must have experience with Excel (Advance level). Specifically pivot tables, VLOOKUP, formulas, sorting data, manipulating data and take this data to present it back to teammates in a manner that is easy to understand 
Logical Thinking and understanding 
Experience with any data visualization tools 
Experience analyzing large amounts of data and consulting clients. 
Experience formulating hypotheses, interpreting and communicating results. 
Undergraduate degree in Finance or commerce or Stats preferred 
5 years experience in an analyst role 
Knowledge of SAP HR, BW, Tableau/SAS and Success Factors 

 Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles. 

 Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go. Download the Robert Half app and get 1-tap apply, instant notifications for AI-matched jobs, and more. 

 Questions? Call your local office at 
1.888.490.4154. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

Title: Analyst, Operations Data Integrity (Volume)
Description:
Job Requisition Id: 156711 Business Function: Operations Support Primary City: st-laurent Other Location(s): Province: Quebec Employment Type: Temporary - New Employment Status: Temporary Language Requirement: Bilingual Imperative (BBBB) Employee Class and Level: UPCEA05 Number of Vacancies: 2 Job Closing Date (MM/DD/YYYY): 07/28/2022
 All qualified candidates will be considered however preference will be given to Indigenous people (First Nations, Metis or Inuit) or persons with a disability. This is a special measure employment equity initiative and candidates from this group who wish to qualify for preferential consideration must self-identify.



 Job Description



      The Analyst, Operations Data Integrity is accountable for analysis and interpretation of corporate volume data reported by and provided to the mail processing, collection and delivery, and retail operations groups, and to ensure the accuracy, integrity and timeliness of this data. This job requires a good knowledge of product specifications and rates, mail operations, mail flows, system tools, processes, ability to apply up to date techniques and practices in data collection, analysis, reporting and statistical analysis.
    

      The incumbent is also accountable for the provision of first-line support for data collection and reporting systems within the mail operations groups, including the identification of systems problems, the initiation of appropriate corrective actions, and the provision of technical expertise and coaching to first line operations management. 
    




Job Responsibilities



      Below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the Analyst, Operations Data Integrity (Volume).
    



        Collects, compiles and processes information related to volumes in mail operations activities and for the distribution of performance indicators to clients through appropriate reports. Ensures that accurate records and documentation are maintained, and that all documents are cross-referenced to ensure data accuracy and integrity. 
      

       Provides analysis and interpretation of data, including anomalies, trends and forecasting, and estimates financial and performance impacts of operational decisions. Ensures that data is reported in a clear and understandable fashion appropriate to it’s intended users, and works closely with end users to ensure reports are understood and any questions or concerns are responded to.
       
 Reviews and maintains systems, procedures and documentation current to reflect any changes in mail flows or processes. Performs audits to verify compliance to processes and standards and takes appropriate corrective action when issues are discovered.  
Coordinates activities related to data collection, recording and reporting for the mail processing, collection and delivery, and retail operations groups. Ensures that all data is verified, and applies knowledge of mail operations to ensure that data and reporting errors are immediately identified and appropriate corrective action is taken. Verifies performance measurements and operations statistics against standards to identify operational problems and recommend solutions.





 Job Responsibilities (continued)



 Provides feedback, training and support for the Operations community as well as colleagues in the work unit in data systems utilization and proper procedures. Identifies system and user deficiencies and liaises as necessary with others to facilitate resolution of the deficiencies, including developing job aids to address the issues. Works closely with management team and employees to increase their comfort and efficiency at providing and interpreting corporate data.



 Communicates with internal groups to explain and discuss changes in the methods of collecting, sampling or auditing data and provides expert advice to the management team on options and alternatives to current practice. Acts as a focal point for communication of HO policies and procedures related to performance indicators, systems and reporting. 
 Maintains a thorough knowledge of corporate software and systems in order to efficiently generate and maintain various reports, spreadsheets, databases, charts, communications and presentation materials. 
 May be required to contact internal or external suppliers all general equipment in the work area, and for ensuring that such equipment is repaired or replaced in a timely manner, or, where circumstances dictate, that the situation is reported and escalated as appropriate.





 Qualifications




 Education


 Completion of secondary school according to provincial standards or equivalent (GED) is required, AND
 Completion of post-secondary (College/University) course(s) in a related field is required.



 Experience


 2-4 years of related work experience is required.



 Other Candidate Requirements


 Good knowledge of product specifications and rates, mail operations and mail.
 Good knowledge and ability to apply up to date techniques and practices in data collection, analysis, reporting and statistical analysis.
 Background in production management reporting/cost accounting/statistical analysis.
 Superior database management.
 Good understanding of MS Excel, MS Access, SAP R3 and SAP BW.
 Strong analytical skills.
 Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing.





 Other Information


 6 months temporary assignment (with possibility of extension)




 Safety Sensitive Positions This position may be considered a Safety Sensitive position.

 Employment Equity
 Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences. We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous People, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.  Disability is defined as a persistent or episodic physical, sensory, or mental health condition and/or functional limitation. Disability includes both visible and hidden conditions and/or limitations that may impact vision, hearing, mobility, flexibility, dexterity, pain, learning, developmental, mental/psychological, and memory.

 Conflict of Interest The Conflict of Interest Policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.

 Accommodation
 Canada Post is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you are contacted by Canada Post regarding a job opportunity, please advise if you have any restrictions that need to be accommodated. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

 Important Message Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as Canada Post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

 Leadership Behaviours Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner, that aligns with the corporation's best interests. Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds themselves and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved. Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities. Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations. Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.

 Our Values
 We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.
 Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
 Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders. Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion. Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect. Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity. Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Your career path has many avenues available for you to succeed. Are you looking to advance at a rate that matches your ambition and skill set? At Bunzl, we understand and want to invest in you. With our multi-career options, you’ll not only be able to find the adventure you are looking for today, but can be confident that new opportunities will be there for advancement in your future.
 At Bunzl, we know that our employees are our number one asset. We seek to recruit and retain the right people who are passionate about our business and we provide opportunities for our employees so that they may progress within our company based on their talents, experiences, and their aptitude.
 The Pricing Analyst is instrumental in providing key analytical, maintenance, and costing support to the organization. You will help drive efficiencies within the organization and drive profitable growth into the future.
 As the Pricing Analyst you are a real Data Intelligence Analyst. This role is instrumental in providing key analytical, maintenance and costing support to the organization. Specifically, you will become the catalyst which will drive efficiencies within the organization. Your detail-oriented nature will promote and sustain the profitable growth of the company.
 Responsibilities:

 Review market trends for pricing opportunities to optimize revenues
 Monitor cost and raw material fluctuations
 Interpret data into compelling insights and present to a variety of levels of leadership
 Analyze price relationships between products
 Manage new product listings in the system with appropriate cost and other key data elements
 Assist in development of new key insights by constructing reports which can be utilized throughout the organization
 Maintain data integrity within the system by conducting vendor reviews to ensure accurate information is present
 Manage vendor price adjustments by uploading data within the system while maintaining accuracy
 Maintain accurate vendor contracts and audit monthly denials

 Requirements:

 Bachelor's degree with a specialization in Business or Mathematics
 2-3 years previous experience in similar role
 Microsoft Office expertise, especially in Excel (v-lookup, index match, Pivot table)
 Excellent communicator – speaks and writes clearly and to the point
 Analytical and organized with relentless attention to detail
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
 Team player who displays personal leadership
 Basic knowledge of financial statements and trial balance information
 Proven track record of process optimization an asset
 Ability to work in a fast-paced national distribution environment

 New career… new opportunities! What are YOU waiting for? 
Bunzl provides the food and retail packaging, cleaning supplies and equipment, safety products and industrial packaging that keeps over 45,000 businesses in Canada running optimally, every day.
 Bunzl plc is a global leader with sales in excess of $10 billion. Bunzl North America is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri, owns and operates more than 100 warehouses with over 5,000 employees and 400,000 plus suppliers.
 At Bunzl, we want to invest in you. With our multi-career options, you’ll not only be able to find the adventure you are looking for today but can be confident that new opportunities will be there for advancement in your future. We know that our employees are our number one asset. That’s why we recruit and retain people who are passionate about delivering the very best for our customers. We provide opportunities for our employees to progress within our company based on their talents, experiences, and aptitude.
 Bunzl Distribution offers competitive salaries, a comfortable work environment, and a full range of benefits including an RRSP with a company match.
 Bunzl Distribution has a tradition of commitment to equal employment opportunity. It is the established policy to attract and retain the best qualified people without regard to race, perceived race, ancestry, place of origin, national origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability, social circumstances, political belief and/or source of income; or any other prohibited ground of discrimination as defined in the applicable Human Rights Legislation.
 IndBunzlCa

Title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
Material Master Data Analyst
Description:
About Us 

 Focused on leading the transition to a sustainable future, Glen Dimplex Americas is enhancing the moments that matter in life with a commitment to delivering the best design and efficiency in the areas of temperature control and comfort creation. With operation throughout North America the success of the Glen Dimplex Americas organization is a testament to the strength of our people and investment in innovation and technology. 
Our portfolio of industry recognized brands includes Dimplex, Cadet and Faber. Together these brands provide complete product offerings in the residential and commercial comfort categories, ranging from electric heaters, to fireplaces and controls. 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is a division of the Glen Dimplex Group - the world's largest manufacturer of electrical heating, which holds significant global market positions in domestic appliances, heating, cooling, ventilation, and renewable energy solutions. Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland the Glen Dimplex Group privately owns over 40 brands with operations in 80 countries. 

 Our Values 
We Think Customer– we aim to put our customers at the center of everything we do, taking time to understand their needs; creating solutions that meet and exceed their expectations, enhancing everyday moments 
We Care About People– we recognize the power of a community with a common purpose; empathizing with others’ point of view and acting with integrity to create a safe and healthy environment 
We Value Innovation– we are building a better future day by day; developing innovations that will create quality, consumer-centric, sustainable solutions 
We Keep it Simple– we make the complex simple by driving out inefficiencies; which enables us to be agile, responsive and to get the job done 

 The Opportunity 
The Master Data Materials Analyst will govern and manage the Materials Master Data objects within SAP/MDG. The successful candidate will liaise with the Business to ensure business continuity across all Material objects, will validate requests and ensure updates are made accurately in accordance with the Company Business requirements. This role is critical to ensuring that Data quality standards are adhered to. 


In this role you will:


Develop an understanding of the business ticketing and workflow tool Fresh Service and it’s supporting process for requests to initiate new materials or changes to existing materials
Facilitate enrichment completion by all areas of the business
Escalate as needed within each area to ensure completion in a timely fashion
Manage SAP templates to support the request for creation of new materials to streamline and simplify the process
Play an active role in the governance of the Material Master data objects as they workflow through the change request process in SAP
Ensure that maintenance of all Material Master Data objects is carried out with a high level of accuracy in accordance with Data quality Standards
Adhere to and continually look to improve on the company's data quality standards by conducting reviews of data at regular intervals
Liaise with Business Stakeholders to communicate the processes and standards and resolve issues on Material setups
Review and validate Master Data Change Requests
Execute checks for duplicate records over all Master Data Change Requests
Proactively monitor data accuracy and facilitate required data corrective actions with business owners, such as Engineering, Product Management, Supply and Manufacturing in addition to other internal groups
Reject Change Requests with errors and justifying/supporting any remediation
Support reporting on MDM team activities, volumetrics and KPI's
Execute periodic reviews and clean-ups for assigned Materials Master Data objects
Support the Project Data Migration activities, as required
Support continuous improvement initiatives in Master Data Management
Execute mass updates of material master data as required
 What You Need 


Working knowledge of SAP or similar ERP system desirable
Detail oriented with a high level of accuracy of data entry
Strong Microsoft office skills, particularly Excel
Able to prioritize activities such as management of worklists and queues
Willing to take ownership for several assigned critical master data objects in SAP
Willingness to learn to develop business and system skills
Ability to interact with personnel at various levels
Ability to work in teams, influence across various levels of the organization, and manage conflicting departmental priorities
2 years’ experience in Master Data processing specific to Materials considered an asset
 What We Offer 
Core Total Rewards 


Fully funded Group Benefits (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, dependent life, AD&D, short term disability, & long term disability)
Group RRSP with 100% Employer Match up to 4%
Portable Benefits, Consult +, and Telus Pharmacy Group
3 Weeks Vacation Immediately
Employee Assistance Program
Workplace Wellness Program
Support of professional memberships/certifications
 Additional Rewards 


Educational Reimbursement Program
Smart casual dress atmosphere
Summer Fridays
Employee Service & Recognition Awards
Referral Bonus Program
A unique opportunity to be a key player in a growing global organization
An innovative fast-paced culture focused on people
 How to Apply 


Our team members include people like you: enthusiastic, innovative, motivated and creative. If you are interested in joining our team or learning more about this opportunity, please apply now. Glen Dimplex Americas offers a competitive total rewards package, and we are continually striving to attract and retain the best talent available, building ongoing success for both our organization and our employees! 

 Glen Dimplex Americas is committed to fair and accessible employment practices. 

 We thank all applicants for their interest in Glen Dimplex Americas, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Who We Are 
As a publicly funded, non-profit organization, Legal Aid Alberta provides affordable legal services in family law, domestic violence, child welfare, immigration, and youth and adult criminal defense. We are Alberta-wide, with 300 staff and 1,200 private practice lawyers helping people overcome their legal challenges in more than 75 communities across the province. 

 Legal Aid Alberta is seeking to fill a full time, Business Analyst in our downtown Edmonton OR Calgary office. This position will appeal to an individual that likes to take initiative, is client focused and is exceptionally strong in delivering high-quality results. 

 Who You Are 

 Working at Legal Aid Alberta means you care about people and empathize with their situation. You have excellent communication skills especially in tough situations. You’re computer-savvy and more organized than anyone you know. Fast-paced work environments give you a rush and you’re always up for a challenge. You love learning new things, solving problems, and can adapt to change quickly. You care deeply about the success of our team and our organization. 

 Job Description 

 Reporting to the Team Lead, Business Analysis, some of the key responsibilities include: 



Works with stakeholders to identify issues or opportunities to improve complicated business processes, provides in-depth analysis and suggestions for business process improvement.
Influence business leaders to adopt best practices and procedures.
Elicits, analyzes, validates and manages detailed functional and non-functional requirements using focus groups, brainstorming, workshops, surveys and other techniques.
Documents and leads impact assessments, business cases and feasibility studies.
Delivers detailed design specifications including business rules, user interface designs, report designs, requirements traceability and use cases.
Responsible for requirements traceability, with the ability to contribute to business application test planning by assisting in the creation of test plans, test suites and the execution of solution testing as required.
Participates in the development and delivery of training materials on new or changed business applications or processes.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends.
Develops end-user reporting solutions using available analytical toolsets, including in a “low-code” development environment (for example, Power Platform).
Develops end-user data gathering applications using available toolsets.
Assists in project planning, identifies project risks and issues.
Conducts insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues or service delivery challenges.
Participates in the evaluation, prioritization and requirements gathering for ongoing system changes, enhancements and selection.
Assist or advise on change management activities related to assigned work or projects.
Mentor other team members and business users as required on all facets of business analysis and business processes.
Delivery of regular updates, or presentations on work to senior management or business owners.
 Qualifications 


Education and Experience:


Post secondary education in business administration, computing science/technology or a related field. Acceptable combination of education and experience will be considered.
5 years experience as a Business Analyst, or combination of applicable experience in business areas.
IIBA Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) Certification is considered an asset.

Knowledge and Skills:


Working knowledge of strategic planning, strategic information management, business analysis, requirements management, data design, conceptual design, process modeling and improvement, system development life cycle, research techniques, project management methodologies and practices.
Basic understanding of information technology architectures including integration and application software, database, subsystem components and software.
Foundational knowledge of emerging methods, procedures, tools, technology, best practices and techniques within the IT industry.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to clearly communicate ideas and to discuss technical issues with non-technical clients.
Ability to facilitate requirements sessions, training and present to large groups.
Demonstrated critical thinking and evaluation skills.
In-depth analytical skills, and ability to use innovation and extensive domain knowledge to problem-solve complicated business issues.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and contribute to numerous concurrent projects and deliverables.
Ability to exercise sound judgment while maintaining an organization-wide perspective.
Operate effectively in a matrix environment; organize work, manage time and priorities and consistently meet deadlines, while working independently on multiple and complex assignments.
Interpret and apply organizational operations, policies, legislation and regulations while assisting with the development of new business processes and solutions.
Excellent skills in Microsoft (or similar) suite of products.

Title: IT Business Analyst, intermediary
Description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy.
At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians.
Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day
Here, innovation is everyone's job. Ready to make your mark?











     About the role
     










Do you want to produce innovative solutions using Artificial Intelligence (AI) that bring tangible and undeniable value to your organization? Do you like building solutions in an agile environment? Do you want to have a major impact on the AI and Machine Learning (ML) vision of the largest insurer in Canada? We have the perfect opportunity for you!
What you’ll do here:

As a Functional Analyst, you will Join a Software engineering team with high visibility and a multitude of challenges to deliver AI products in our core business applications
Ensure proactive and effective communication at all levels.
Support the various squads in all phases of product development from exploration to production
Analyse users’ requirements and participate in the creation and elaboration of user stories
Analyse data requests and coordinate the different activities to be compliant with our Data governance policy, security and privacy.
Assist the Product Owner by adding and prioritizing technical elements in stories
Assist and support the team in the testing strategy and execution
Work closely with the different groups of collaborators namely: Developers, Data Scientists, Data governance, Security, Product Owners and Architecture
Deliver production grade solutions that respect Intact standards and business needs
Anticipate problems and sensitive situations, propose solutions, and participate in their resolution.












     Qualifications
     










What you bring to the table:

Interested in artificial intelligence and Data acquisition ,able to interact with software engineers, data scientists and R&D teams.
Comfortable working in complex environment that are constantly evolving and multidisciplinary team.
Mobilizer, delivery-oriented and good priority management.
Autonomous, resourceful and able to question the status quo.
Good communicator, ability to negotiate and take decisions.
Bilingual in French and English

You have:

A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software development, mathematics or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Functional/Data Analyst.
Experience in Agile/Scrum development.
Technical background in Development.
Knowledge of IT Infrastructure and Machine learning concepts are an asset.

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle

Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.
#hybrid

Title: Reporting and Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Radiant offers a complete range of industry-leading transportation and warehousing solutions to businesses around the globe by leveraging our extensive network of carrier partners across all modes. Radiant provides customized logistics solutions that create value and increase profitability for our customers.
Radiant Canada is a learning environment in which passion, dedication and a commitment to getting the job done are valued. That’s what being on our team is all about. It’s where you can gain valuable skills and experience, which also helps Radiant grow. If this sounds like the kind of company you are looking for, we would love to hear from you!
We are currently looking for a Reporting and Business Intelligence Analyst to join Radiant and be part of our dynamic team.
HYBRID WORK MODEL: Work in the office at 1280 Courtneypark Drive E, Mississauga every Monday and Wednesday. Work from home Tuesday, Thursday and Fridays. 
What You’ll Do: 

Respond to reporting requests. Design and develop reports and dashboards using reporting development tools i.e. Excel, SSRS and Power BI.
Analyze data and identify opportunities to maximize profit, minimize costs, recommend value-added business solutions and determine potential areas for improvement and growth.
Communicate with internal teams and customers to collect business logic and requirements.
Summarize and communicate business logic to IT for data structure development and data extract.
Perform data collection, cleansing, transformation and testing for day-to-day analysis, and reporting and dashboard development.
Develop internal and external operational and financial KPI’s.
Design, execute, communicate and troubleshoot problems for external customer reports.
Develop and maintain reporting standard operating procedure documents.
Assist in preparing customer presentations. Participate in the customer presentation as required.

What You Bring to the Role: 

University Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in performing analysis with large sets of data.
Transportation / Warehousing industry experience is preferred.


Project management experience is an asset.


Intermediate skills in SQL programming (e.g., writing statements).
Advanced skills in Exce
Strong knowledge and understanding of Relational Database concept and underlying data with the ability to create relationships among tables.
Experience with Microsoft Power BI is an asset.
SQL Server eporting Services (SSRS) is an asset.
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS, MDX query) is an asset.
Visual Basic and other programming language are an asset.
Knowledge of Transportation Management software or Warehouse Management software is an asset.


Ability to clearly identify the customers’ current and future needs and present solutions to them.


Dedicated commitment to providing superior, timely internal and external customer service.


Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively in verbal and written form.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills in a team environment.
Highly organized with the ability to multi-task.
Team cooperation and respect is required.
Analytical, critical thinking and detail-oriented.
Ability to work with and support all team members, management and shareholders.
Work well under pressure in a time sensitive environment.

Perks You’ll Get: 

Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
RRSP Contribution Matching
Learning & Development Opportunities
Employee Discounts
Access to an Employee Assistance Program for services including counseling, financial and legal consultation
Wellness Program
A Supportive and Positive Work Environment
